loans.name: Shukla

texts.en:
Shukla, a 31-year-old mother of three children, is from Dhupguri. She is married to Subhas, who is a cultivator by profession. Shukla studied until grade eight, but sends her children to school. She wants see her children in a good position with a good education. She is a housewife who looks after her husband and children, as well as manages the household. After that, she helps her husband in his work.

They have their own plot of land. Her husband grows vegetables such as potatoes, beans, eggplants, gourds, etc. there. He is working tirelessly toward the attainment of his dream to expand his business and secure the future of the family. 

With the increasing expenses of his family, he needs to increase his income by cultivating some other crop. Now, they have chosen paddy to cultivate, as it is the staple food for not only the people of their region, but also for the people throughout West Bengal. So, they hope it will be a lucrative business.

Shukla is energetic, enthusiastic and determined to make a future through hard work and cooperation. She has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase necessary things such as seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides so that they can start the cultivation as early as possible. She hopes their business will help her to raise her standard of living, to purchase more agricultural land to expand their agribusiness, and to provide good education to their children. 

She and her husband are thankful to the generous lenders who stand by her.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies for cultivating paddy.

loans.name: José Misael

texts.es:
José de 44 años de edad, estudio hasta 9º grado, esta acompañado, su compañera de vida trabaja en un restaurante, por ahorita no tienen hijos y viven en casa familiar.

José es empleado de una alcaldía,ya tiene varios años de tener el empleo también tiene un negocio de fotografiás el horario de trabajo es de 8:00 AM a 4:00 PM.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar una computadora, puesto que la necesita para su negocio de fotografiás y digitación y  de esa forma lograra mejorar sus ingresos y la necesidad quedara cubierta.
texts.en:
Jose, 44, studied until 9th grade. He is in a common-law marriage. His spouse works in a restaurant. They have no children yet and they live in the family home.
Jose is an employee at the town hall, where he has worked for several years. He also has a photography business. His working schedule is from 8 a.m. to 4 p.m. 
He is asking for a loan through the lending partner, Credicampo, to purchase a computer. He needs it for his photography and digitizing business. In this way he will be able to improve his income and his needs will be met.

loans.use: to purchase a computer he needs for his picture and digitizing business.

loans.name: Marie Gorette

texts.en: Marie Gorette is 46 years old. She is married with 6 children aged between 23 and 6 years; all of them go to school. She sells beans and has been running this business for 10 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more beans and maize for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more beans for sale.

loans.name: Tania Lisseth

texts.es:
Tania de 20 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, poco le gustaba ir a la escuela por lo que decidió no continuar.

Está acompañada, su pareja trabaja como ayudante de mecánico, no tienen hijos, terminaron la casa y viven aparte. De los ingresos que generan solo ellos dependen. 

Ella tiene una tiende en la que vende de todo tipo de ropa para niños, damas y caballeros etc. Cuando el negocio está mal para la venta, se dedica a vender cocteles de frutas, los que ella prepara ya tiene cinco años de realizar esta actividad, la necesidad la llevo a iniciar una fuente de ingreso independiente, su mamá también es comerciante por lo que de ella aprendió todo lo relacionado al negocio, antes de independizarse le ayudaba a su madre con su negocio. La distancia que recorre es aproximadamente un kilómetro, se desplaza a su puesto en el mercado en mototaxi, su esposo cuando no está trabajando se involucra en la actividad, la venta la realiza de 6:00 am a 12:00 md.

También comenta que el crédito anterior se tramito por la línea kiva, con lo que termino de construir el techo de su casa ya que estaba en construcción.

Hoy el préstamo lo necesita para realizarse unos chequeos médicos, ya que espera la llegada de su primer hijo y el resto lo necesita  para terminar de cancelar lo que está vigente de su primer crédito. 

Por hoy solo se enfoca en cuidarse para que su bebé pueda estar muy bien, espera que todo le salga bien con la ayuda de Dios. A pesar de su estado sigue atendiendo el negocio de la ropa. De las ventas responderá con el pago de la cuota.
texts.en:
Tania is 20 years old and studied up to the ninth grade. She didn't like going to school much, so she decided not to continue on. Her partner works as a mechanical assistant. They don't have kids and they ended up living separately. They are the only ones dependent on their incomes. She has a store in which she sells all kinds of clothing for kids, women, men, etc. When she's not able to sell much, she sells fruit cocktails, which she's done for five years. Out of necessity, she needed to have another independent source of income. Her mom is also a merchant, which is how she learned everything about the business. Before going out on her own, she helped her mother with her business. It's about a kilometer to the market, and she takes a taxi there. Her husband helps her when he's not working as well. She works for 6:00 am to 12 noon.

She also notes that the previous loan made online by Kiva was used to finish the contruction of a roof for her house that she had already started building. Today she needs the loan to pay for some medical bills, as they are expecting their first child. She'll use the rest to pay off what is left of her first loan. For now she's just focusing on getting ready so that her baby will be well. She hope that everything will go well with God's help. Despite her condition, she's still tending to her clothing business. She'll use her sales to pay for her loan.

loans.use: to pay for some medical bills, as they are expecting their first child. She'll use the rest to pay off what is left of her first loan.

loans.name: Maria Amalia

texts.es: Doña María tiene 66 años de edad, es casada, tiene 4 hijos, vive en una aldea de Morazan, Yoro. Hace 10 años vende granos básicos como maíz y frijoles. Estos productos los vende en su casa. El préstamo que solicita es el quinto ciclo con la institución, actualmente solicita 30,000 lempiras para comprar maíz y frijol al por mayor y vender. su propósito es que al comprar en cantidades grandes le queda mayor ganancia. Su plan es seguir con el negocio creciendo para tener mejor vida.
texts.en: Maria, 66, is married and has 4 children. She lives in a small village in Morazan, Yoro. For 10 years she has been selling basic grains such as corn and beans. She sells these products from home. This loan will be her fifth cycle with the field partner. She is asking for 30,000 lempiras to purchase corn and beans wholesale to sell. Her idea is that buying in bulk will provide a better profit for her. Her plan is to keep building her business to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase corn and beans wholesale to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to do maintenance on his fields and to purchase organic fertilizer for his cocoa bean crops.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos: Es un hombre trabajador, originario de Waspam, tiene 58 años de edad, casado, tiene 6 hijos: 4 son mayores de edad y 2 adolescentes que estudian su secundaria. Cuenta con una experiencia de más de 5 años de ser docente. Solicita financiamiento para comprar materiales de construcción: madera, hierro, cemento. Con el propósito de construir su vivienda de concreto. Su sueño es tener una vivienda de dos plantas para que su familia viva de manera segura y cómoda
texts.en: Carlos is a hardworking man and a native of Waspam. He is 58 years old, married and has 6 children: 4 are adults and 2 are teenagers studying high school. He has worked for more than 5 years as a teacher. He is requesting a loan to buy building materials: wood, iron, cement with the purpose of building his house with concrete. His dream is to have a house of two floors so that his family lives safely and comfortably.

loans.use: to buy building materials: wood, iron, cement

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel, aged 35 years, is married with 2 children aged 7 and 10; both of them go to school. He has been selling beer for 15 years. With the loan, he would like to buy more beer for sale. The profits from the business will be used to buy domestic animals such as cows.

loans.use: to buy more beer for selling

loans.name: Ravshanoy

texts.ru: Равшаной родилась в 1977 году. Она жизнерадостная и добрая женщина. Равшаной мать 3 детей. Она разведена и одна воспитывает своих детей. Равшаной занимается изготовлением и продажей лепешек. Она этим бизнесом занимается уже более 10 лет. Равшаной с бизнесом справляется одна. Она трудится упорно с раннего утра до позднего вечера, но ее доход не хватает для обеспечения детей со всеми не обходимыми средствами. Равшаной планирует увеличить оборотный капитал и таким образом увеличить доход и с полученного дохода улучшить условию проживания. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки муки, чтобы увеличить оборотный капитал. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Ravshanoy was born in 1977. She is a happy and kind woman, and the mother of three children. She is divorced and raising her children by herself.  She makes and sells pastries and has been involved in this activity for more than ten years, running her business by herself.  She works very hard, from early morning until late in the evening, but she doesn't make enough money to provide her children with all the necessities of life.  Ravshanoy is thinking of increasing her working capital, which will lead to an increase in her income and will allow her to improve her living conditions.  She is requesting a loan of 5,000 somoni to buy some flour and increase her working capital.  She is awaiting your kindness and relying on your generosity.

loans.use: to buy some flour to increase her working capital.

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en: Prisca, 33 years old, is married and has 3 children aged between 6 and 2 years, one of whom goes to school. Prisca is a veterinarian who has been working for the past 8 years. She would like to use the requested loan to buy more medicines for diseased animals. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption and to reinvest.

loans.use: to buy more medicines for diseased animals.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.en:
Gabriela is 46 years old and lives with her husband and children in a house. She has generated income for her family by running a small diner for teachers. Her dream is to become financially stable and to expand her business into a formal setting. 

She aims to continue and grow her business but she has insufficient capital. For this reason, Gabriela would like a loan of MXN5,000 to purchase ingredients in larger quantities so she can serve more customers.

This is Gabriela's first loan with Konfío and considers herself a very responsible person when managing credits.

loans.use: to buy ingredients in bulk in order to prepare meals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Rajabmo

texts.ru: Рачабмо 53 года. Она добрая женщина и имеет свой бизнес. Рачабмо развевает бизнес купле продажей продуктов питания. Она 10 лет назад начала свой бизнес с маленького оборотного капитала и постепенно с годами она развевала свой бизнес. Данное время она имеет свой продуктовый магазин. Рачабмо продает овощи, фрукты, зерновые культуры, макаронные изделия, мясные изделия и т.п. Она с полученного дохода обеспечивает свою семью. Она замужем и имеет 4 детей. Она планирует увеличить оборотный капитал и развевать бизнес. Рачабмо запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки продуктов питания, чтобы увеличить оборотный капитал. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Rajabmo is 53 years old.  She is a kind woman and she runs her own business which consists in buying and selling food products.  She became involved in this activity ten years ago.  She started with a small working capital and has been able to develop her business gradually over the years.  She now owns a grocery store where she sells vegetables, fruits, grains, pasta, meat products etc.  She uses her income to support her family.  Rajabmo is married and the mother of four children.  She wants to increase her working capital and further develop her business.  She is taking a loan of 3,000 somoni to buy food products and increase her working capital.  She is awaiting your kindness and relying on your generosity.

loans.use: to buy some food products and increase her working capital.

loans.name: Tojiniso

texts.ru: Точинисо родилась в 1971 году. Она вдова и имеет 4 детей. Точинисо пережила много трудности в жизни. После смерти мужа она осталась без кормильца и условия проживания были очень тяжелыми. Потом она начала работать и зарабатывать на жизнь. С надеждой получить доход и улучшить условию проживания, Точинисо 6 месяцев назад начала новый бизнес купле продажей продуктов питания. Точинисо продает продукты питания на местном рынке. Она продает сладости и печенья. Она сама справляется с бизнесом. Точинисо хочет развевать свой новый бизнес и получать выгоду. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки продуктов питания, чтобы увеличить оборотный капитал. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Tojiniso was born in 1971.  She is a widow and the mother of four children.  She has gone through many difficult times.  After her husband passed away, the family was left without a breadwinner, and their living conditions were very difficult.  Since then, Tojiniso has started to work and to make a living.  Hoping to make some money and improve her living conditions, she started her own business six months ago, selling food products.  She now sells food products, particularly sweets and biscuits, at the local market.  She works alone.  She wants to develop her new business and make a profit.  She is taking a loan of 3,000 somoni to buy food products and increase her working capital.  She is awaiting your kindness and relying on your generosity.

loans.use: to buy some food products and increase her working capital.

loans.name: Nyame Tease Group

texts.en:
Comfort, 32 years old, is the leader of the Nyame Tease Group. She is from Kadadwe, in the Assin Fosu District of the Central Region of Ghana. She is married and has 6 children. Comfort has been a cocoa farmer for the past 20 years and is also a petty trader. She earns her living from the sale of her cocoa beans and partly from her petty trading to support her husband in caring for the family. 

Comfort uses 3 stone stoves that use firewood in an open fire. As a result, Comfort and her children have been exposed to excessive heat and smoke in the kitchen during cooking and heating water. Comfort has decided to purchase an Elsa Clean Cook Stove to improve indoor air quality within her kitchen and to facilitate her cooking. She needs a micro-loan of GHS 300 to purchase the clean cook stove. Comfort is grateful to all her micro-lenders for helping her reduce the exposure of her family to excessive heat and smoke in her kitchen.

loans.use: to buy a clean cook stove

loans.name: Los Primos Group

texts.es:
Los primos es un grupo conformado por 7 integrantes los cuales tienen muchas cosas en común dentro de ellas que son trabajadores, amables, responsables ,humildes ,generosos.

Viven en una localidad donde se siembra y cosecha la caña de azúcar, el café y el hule, en la localidad hay un beneficio de café, cerca un ingenio, y una planta de hule, es por ello  que todo el año hay trabajo y la economía no es tan mala debido a la siembra de producto alternativo.

Camino a la localidad se puede apreciar un Cristo arriba de un cerro al cual suelen acudir para apreciar al Cristo, la vista que se tiene desde arriba y el buen clima, además de la paz que se percibe.

Eustaquio- Venta De Café
José Miguel- Venta De Hojas De Plátano
Pablo- Venta De Abarrotes
Angélica- Venta De Abarrotes 
Agustina- Venta De Antojitos 
Juan Marino- Venta De Madera
Eutiquia- Venta De Café 

La señora María está casada con el señor José, tiene 72 años de edad y no estudio pues comenta que antes los tiempos eran diferentes y solo estudiaban los que tenían dinero o eran hijos únicos, hoy en día asiste a una escuela para adultos donde estudia la primaria, desde hace ya 10 años se ha dedicado a la elaboración y venta de tortillas de mano para ello se levanta todos los días a las 5 de la mañana, acude al molino a moler el nixtamal, prende la lumbre en el fogón, se toma un café, prepara el comal y la maza para comenzar a echar las tortillas la cuales guarda en un tenate grande para que se mantengan calientes, inicia su venta a las 7 de la mañana el valor de cada tortilla es de $.50 centavos, con las ganancias obtenidas apoya a su esposo con los gastos de la casa.

El préstamo otorgado por visión fund le será útil para la compra de maíz, leña, cal y un comal de barro para continuar con la venta de tortillas, gracias por brindarnos una nueva esperanza con el préstamo otorgado, no los defraudaremos.

*Doña María es la señora que trae el morral a rayas en la mano.
texts.en:
The Cousins is a group of 7 members who have many things in common. They are hard-working, friendly, responsible, humble, and generous. They live in an area where there is always the planting of sugar, coffee, and rubber. In this area both coffee and rubber are planted, and due to this ingenuity, there is work and income all year round as the plants alternate. En route to this area one sees a Christ above a forest, which provides a peaceful perception of Christ watching over everything.

The members' businesses are
Eustaquio - selling coffee
José Miguel - selling banana leafs
Pablo - selling groceries
Angelica - selling groceries
Agustina - selling snack food
Juan Marino - selling wood
Eutiquia - selling coffee

Maria is married to Jose, is 72 years old and didn't go to school because when she was a child things were different and only those who had money or who were only children went to school. Today she attends a school for adults where she studies elementary level education. For 10 years she has had a business making and selling hand-made tortillas. She gets up every day at 5 AM, grinds her corn, lights the fire, has coffee, prepares the griddle and batter, and then prepares the tortillas which she keeps in a big pot to keep warm. She begins her sales at 7 AM and sells each tortilla for $.50 cents. With the earnings she supports her husband with the household expenses. The loan will be used to buy corn, firewood, lime and a clay griddle to continue making tortillas. Thanks for the support which is giving her new hope for the future. Maria is a woman who works very hard, every day.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, lime, and an clay griddle.

loans.name: Yessica Yamileth

texts.es: Yessica, tiene 25 años de edad, está casada, tiene 1 hijo, vive con su familia en el Municipio de San Pedro Sula. Hace dos años estableció su propio negocio donde vende granos básicos, azúcar, manteca, harina, huevo, café, sal, pan, churros y otros. El préstamo que solicita es por 5,000 lempiras y lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, pan, churros, harina, huevos y otros, para surtir y tener variedad de productos. Su plan es hacer crecer el negocio para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en: Yessica, 25, is married, has one son, and lives with her family in the municipality of San Pedro Sula.  Two years ago, she started her own business where she sells basic grains, sugar, lard, flour, eggs, coffee, salt, bread, fritters, and other things.  The loan she is requesting is for 5,000 lempiras and she will invest it in the purchase of groceries such as rice, beans, sugar, bread, fritters, flour, eggs, and other things in order to stock up and have a variety of products.  Her plan is to make her business grow in order to help her husband with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as rice, beans, sugar, bread, fritters, flour, eggs, and other things.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a set of furniture for his home.

loans.name: Odo Group

texts.en:
Vida is 32 years old. She is married with two children who are four and eight years old. Both of her children are currently attending school. Vida has been a cocoa farmer and earned her living from the sale of the cocoa beans for the past nine years. Vida is also a seamstress by profession. During off seasons she supplements her income by sewing for her customers. Vida always strives to improve the livelihood of her family by working hard to support her husband. 

Vida is very much concerned about the health of her family in the kitchen as they are exposed to excessive heat and smoke from her traditional three stone stove with firewood in an open fire every day. After Community Education by the Field Partner in her community on subjects including indoor/outdoor air pollution, Vida has decided to take advantage of the opportunity to use an Elsa Clean Cook stove, to improve the health of her family within her kitchen. She is however faced with yet another hurdle - the initial amount to purchase the stove. She needs a microloan facility to purchase an Elsa Clean Cook stove to protect her family from smoke and excessive heat in the kitchen. A microloan of GHS 300 will help Vida to purchase her clean cook stove. Supporting Vida in this way also means saving the trees within the forest within her community. Vida thanks all her micro-lenders for their kind support.

loans.use: to purchase a clean cook stove.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, fertilizer, insecticide, plastic bags, cardboard boxes, and other items.

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.es: Juan en esta oportunidad solicita un nuevo crédito, para comprar otro compresor de aire, debido a que el taller le esta dando buenos resultados y ya no da abasto con el que tiene que fue comprado con el primer crédito kiva.
texts.en: Juan is currently requesting a new loan to buy another air compressor, as his workshop is doing well financially, and the one that he bought with the first Kiva loan is not enough.

loans.use: to buy another air compressor, as his workshop is doing well financially, and the one that he bought with the first Kiva loan is not enough.

loans.name: Rutendo

texts.en:
Rutendo, 20, is single and living in the Hurungwe District of Zimbabwe. She is a Camfed Learner Guide, volunteering at schools in her community. 

Over the last year, she has grown her poultry business to its current capacity – producing about 50 broiler birds every six weeks and selling them to local residents. She has one employee. She started the business in 2012 because she wanted to be financially independent. She saw that this type of business was very profitable in her community. 

Rutendo would very much like to increase her sales volume and become a supplier to major supermarkets. She will use this Kiva loan to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production. She hopes to provide for herself and remain financially independent.  If she gets a loan that produces additional profits, her plans are to get back to school.

loans.use: To purchase more broiler chicks, chick feed and drugs to increase production in her poultry business.

loans.name: Gloria Estela

texts.es: Gloria, tiene 44 años de edad, es soltera, tiene 2 hijos, vive con sus dos hijos y una nieta en el municipio de Morazán Yoro.  Su actividad de negocio es la venta de comidas, este negocio lo tiene hace 10 años en su casa. Ofrece variedad de comidas como ser, pollo frito con tajadas, carne asada, pollo asado, baleadas, bebidas naturales y sodas etc. Antes vendía mercadería en forma ambulante. Ha solicitado un segundo préstamo a la institución que es por  21,000 lempiras, este dinero lo invertirá en la compra de insumos como ser, carnes, vegetales, condimentos, aceite, arroz, frijoles etc.para preparar comida para vender. con esta inversión espera tener una fuente de ingreso estable y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Gloria, 44, is single, has two children, and lives with her two children and a granddaughter in the municipality of Morazán, Yoro.  Her business activity is the sale of food.  She has had this business in her house for 10 years.  She offers a variety of meals to include fried chicken with plantain, grilled meat, grilled chicken, tacos, natural drinks, and sodas, etc.  Before that, she sold merchandise on foot.  She has requested a second loan from the institution which is for 21,000 lempiras. She will invest this money in the purchase of supplies such as meats, vegetables, condiments, oil, rice, beans, etc. in order to prepare meals for sale.  With this investment, she hopes to have a stable source of income and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as meats, vegetables, condiments, oil, rice, beans, etc. in order to prepare meals for sale.

loans.name: Despertar Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “DESPERTAR” iniciará el vigésimo tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Jhovanna es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de flores, venta de verduras, venta de repuestos de bicicletas, venta de medicamentos naturales, producción y venta de tomates, venta de pantalones, venta de disfraces, gestora de trámites.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Jhovanna es integrante, ella indica hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su madre que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de gestora de trámites; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años, de un negocio anterior, con el pasar del tiempo decide emprender un negocio independiente. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de papel por mayor) que adquirirá de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo implementará en su espacio de servicio. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "DESPERTAR" ("Awaken") will begin its twenty-third cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Focal Center of Santiago II. The group is comprised of 8 members, and is led by a board in which Jhovanna is President. The group members' businesses are varied and include: flower sales, vegetable sales, bicycle parts sales, natural medicine sales, tomato production and sales, pants sales, costume sales, and procedural management.

The loan they are requesting will benefit small businesses where Jhovanna is integral. Jhovanna says that she joined Pro Mujer three years ago, through her mother's invitation, who is a client of the institution. She currently has a business as an administrative manager. She learned this trade many years ago, from a previous job. With time she decided to open her own independent business. The loan she is requesting is to increase her capital to buy paper at wholesale price, which she will buy from La Paz, and then use in her business. This line of work allows her to generate income to help financially support her family, as she is single and has a child. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the training it offers.

loans.use: to buy paper at wholesale price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase royco, sugar, salt, and bath and washing soap to increase her supplies.

loans.name: Chuguexalense Group

texts.en:
The Friendship Bridge's Trust Bank, “Chuguexalense,” consists of eight hard-working women who average 40 years of age. Other averages include five children per woman and four years of formal education. 

These women are motivated and determined to create better lives for themselves and their families with the “microcredit plus” program of Friendship Bridge. The program combines small loans with educational seminars, so that women can develop their small businesses, educate and empower themselves, and eliminate poverty. 

The Chuguexalense Trust Bank has just welcomed a new member to the group, who is excited to receive her very first loan and participate in the educational components of the monthly meetings. Sebastiana, 28, was only able to receive formal education for two years. She has been unable to speak since she was born, and the school system in her area was unable to meet her needs. Her family was greatly challenged by her condition. 

Nevertheless, Sebastiana forged ahead with a great will to succeed. She considers herself an independent woman. For 10 years, Sebastiana has had a fruit business. She sells oranges, pineapples, watermelon, and mangos. She is requesting a loan to expand her fruit business and offer more variety to her customers. Without a doubt, Sebastiana is a shining example of someone who faces obstacles and is determined to be an empowered entrepreneur. Her family has been extremely supportive and is proud of her success.

The women in the group look forward to the educational components of their monthly meetings. They are eager to learn how to create better lives in their homes, so themes like nutrition, health, and hygiene are quite useful. They want to be successful in their small businesses, so topics like accounting, budgeting, customer service, pricing, and marketing are also quite relevant.

Armed with their new knowledge and small loans, these ladies possess the tools to empower themselves and leave poverty behind. Kiva investors are greatly valued in this effort. Thank you, Kiva investors, for your generosity and kindness in funding loans for Sebastiana and the other women in the Chuguexalense Trust Bank.

loans.use: To expand her fruit business and offer more variety of fruits to her customers

loans.name: Chunima Group

texts.en:
The town of Chunima is located in a remote rural area outside of the town of Chichicastenango. The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Chunima”  Bank is composed of nine women who are Maya Kiché. The majority of them work in textile production and fabricate ornate and traditional belts, blouses and skirts. Last February, the Trust received a loan funded by KIVA investors. The entire loan has been paid back in full and on time. They are applying for an additional loan that will hopefully be funded by KIVA investors. It will be their second loan cycle.

Carmen, the 30-year-old President of the Trust Bank, is unique in the group as she doesn’t work in textile production. She is a practical nurse and because of her knowledge in this field, she has opened a pharmacy and offers basic medical services to the people who live in Chunima. There is no formal health center that is permanently staffed in the town, and so Carmen is held in very high esteem. Her pharmacy is quite busy and she has decided that it is time to open another one. She is requesting a loan to stock the new locale with a complete inventory of supplies. The most common ailments are fever and diarrhea.

Carmen and her husband are keenly aware of the tremendous value of education and their children attend elementary school in Chunima. They understand why a good education is a key to a more successful future. Carmen and the ladies in the Trust Bank participate in educational seminars at their monthly meetings. A Friendship Bridge Loan Officer shares interesting information with the ladies about indebtedness, effective business management practices, as well as hygiene, health and nutrition. They also learn about violence against women, women’s rights and self-esteem. Friendship Bridge calls the combination of loans and education “Microcredit Plus” and it is most effective.

On behalf of the ladies in the Trust Bank, Carmen extends gratitude to KIVA investors for their generosity in funding their loans. They are unable to walk into a bank and secure a loan. Thank you, KIVA investors, for providing the capital so that these ladies can eliminate poverty and face a brighter tomorrow!

loans.use: to purchase more medicines for her little pharmacy.

loans.name: Maya Kiche Group

texts.en:
San Francisco El Alto is a busy, rural town in the Western Highlands of Guatemala. The economy is based on commercial textile production. Many create traditional textiles including blouses called “blusas” or “huipiles”, skirts called “cortes” and ornate belts called “fajas”. Other textiles are sewn including sheets, pillow cases, pants and undershirts. Capital is needed to purchase supplies for the businesses and competition is fierce. Thirteen women banded together to form the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Maya Kiché”. Their goal is to increase sales, generate increased revenue, empower themselves and eliminate poverty for themselves and their families.

Catarina, a single woman who is 30 years old, works in textile production and fabricates pants and shorts with three of her younger siblings. She sells the pieces of clothing by the dozen in border areas where demand is high. Catarina is requesting a loan that she will use to purchase more thread, buttons, fabrics and tags. The revenue that she and her siblings make will help support the family.

The women are very aware of the value of education, both for themselves and their children. They want their children to be able to attend school and work hard so that uniforms, books and other school supplies can be purchased. They also realize that to run their households and businesses most efficiently, they need to be informed and empowered. At the monthly meetings of the Trust Bank, a Friendship Bridge Loan Officer spends part of the meeting sharing timely information about a wide variety of subjects such as indebtedness, effective business practices, health, women’s rights, hygiene and nutrition. Friendship Bridge calls the combination of the small loans and education “Microcredit Plus”. It works!

The ladies of the “Maya Kiche” Trust Bank are most grateful for the opportunity to access credit and education. Kiva investors are wonderful partners in this effort! Thank you, Kiva investors!

loans.use: To purchase more thread, buttons, fabrics and tags

loans.name: Horonya Group

texts.fr:
HORONYA est un groupe de l’association BENKADI de SELINKEGNY. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 27 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne cinq enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de poissons à l’image de FATOUMATA qui est la première personne debout  de la droite vers la gauche  de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à SELINKEGNY dans la Sous-Préfecture de SELINGUE (Région de Sikasso, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités d’achat vente de poissons.
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso, il y a un an. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire. 
FATOUMATA qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à SELINGUE, excelle dans la vente de poissons. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une quantité importante de poissons.  Elle s’approvisionne à SELINGUE auprès des grossistes  et vend ses poissons à SELINGUE, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle mixte.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 20.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et s’investir le reste dans son activité d’achat vente de poissons.
texts.en:
Horonya is a [borrowers] group of the Benkadi association of Selinkegny. The group is composed of women who know each other as relatives and neighbors. They are 27 years old on the average. Married, with five children on the average, they are engaged in various business activities, such as selling fish, which is what Fatoumata does, for example. She is the first one standing from right to left in the photo. They all live in the big traditional families in Selinkegny, in the subprefecutre of Selingue (Sikasso Region in Mali).

They have been working as vendors for some years, and their fish business attracts many customers.
With the goal of meeting growing demand, a year ago the group members have decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. They are on their second solidarity loan. Fatoumata, who is the group's leader and well known in Selingue, excels at selling fish. She plans to use her loan to buy a large quantity of fish. She buys fish from wholesalers in Selingue and resells locally retail, for cash  and on credit, to a mixed clientele.
Fatoumata hopes to earn a monthly revenue of 20,000 West African francs, which will be used to repay her loan and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is 52 years old and married with seven children, two of whom are in school. Ana works very hard to provide for them.

Ana's business was devastated by super typhoon Haiyan that swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Ana is taking out a bridge loan to restart her general store business. Ana has requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF.

She is using the new loan to stock up on a variety of goods to resell. Ana is committed to rebuild, and in future would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Sakali

texts.en:
Sakali is a rural woman who hails from Dhupguri.  She is 26 years old and married to Shridam.  She is blessed with two lovely sons, one of whom is a student of grade three and other too small for school. She is illiterate and unfortunate that she could not get the opportunity to study due to her family's financial crisis; she can only sign her name.  She lives with her family in Raypara, a remote region in Jalpaiguri district.

Sakali's husband (29 years old) is a cycle van puller. But his income is insufficient to cover all the family expenses.  So Sakali has been involved in the business of rearing livestock. She has been engaged in this business for the last few years to provide a financial help to her family.  She somehow developed her business to some extent through her dedication and hard work.   She fattens the goats and sells their milk to the local people. Also sometimes she sells the goats to the butcher when they grow up. In this way she tries to extend her helping hands to her husband to run the family. However, owing to a lack of capital, she is not in a position to take the full advantage of her knowledge of rearing livestock. She wants to grow her business.

Thus she seeks a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS, to utilize as working capital.  The loan will help her to purchase more goats for her business. She is grateful to BJS and Kiva for this financial assistance.

loans.use: To purchase goats for her animal husbandry.

loans.name: Kevin Javier

texts.es:
Kevin de 20 años de edad, es un joven con muchos sueños y deseos de superación, ha terminado sus estudios en educación básica (noveno grado), y esta estudiando el bachillerato, él está soltero, no tiene hijos y vive con sus padres y sus hermanos.

Kevin ayudaba a trabajar en la siembra de maíz, frijol y sorgo a su padre, desde la edad de 12 años, en los tiempos libres que no tenía que asistir a clases. Ya tiene conocimientos en cómo elaborar los trabajos para todo el proceso de producción de dichos cultivos. La necesidad de ayudar a sus padres con los gastos del hogar, lo llevo a tomar una decisión difícil, la cual fue de iniciar a trabajar, lo cual obligo a que abandonara los estudios. Sin embargo, este ha continuado con sus estudios, pero en un turno nocturno. Kevin logro ingresar en una maquila, donde está encargado de la elaboración de elásticos. Sus turnos son de 7:00am a 4:00pm y le toca viajar todos los días, en bus y recorre aproximadamente 20 kilómetros. 


El crédito que esta solicitando, es para comprar semilla, abono, fertilizantes para cultivar 7,000 metros cuadrados de frijol.

El sueño de Kevin es terminar sus estudios en educación media, para luego continuar con su preparación académica en educación superior, y tener un título como profesional, con lo cual podría optar a un mejor empleo y a la vez podrá ayudar a sus padres, para que la calidad de vida mejore.
texts.en:
Kevin, 20 years old, is a young man with many dreams and desires for self-improvement.  He has completed his  basic education (ninth grade) and is studying for a high school diploma.  Kevin is single, has no children, and lives with his parents and his brothers and sisters.

Since he was 12 years old, Kevin has helped his father with the work of planting corn, beans and sorghum in his free time when not attending classes.  He already knows enough about how to do the full process of growing those crops.  The need to help his parents with household costs has led to his making a difficult decision: to begin working, which means he had to leave school.  Nevertheless, he has continued with his studies, but at night.  Kevin was able to get employment in a factory where his job is preparing elastic materials.  His work day is from 7 AM till 4 PM, and he has to travel about 20 kilometers daily by bus.  

The loan he is asking for is to buy seeds, manure, and fertilizers to plan 7,000 square meters of beans.

Kevin's dream is to finish his studies in secondary school, to be able to then continue with his academic preparation in higher education, and to have a professional title, with which he can choose a better job and at the same time help his parents, so that the quality of life for all will be better.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, and fertilizers to grow 7,000 square meters of beans

loans.name: Lilian Flora

texts.es:
Lilian es una mujer de 36 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un niño de 4 años, y su negocio es la confección de chompas.
Ella es emprendedora, comprometida, responsable, buena madre, sacrificada y trabajadora. Su trabajo lo realiza en la zona de villa Adela, un sitio comercial caracterizado por sus frías temperaturas y su altura.
Lilian es de tez morena, estatura mediana, cabello negro largo, viste a la moda pero usa ropa típica (manta, sombrero y pollera) para las fiestas, su lengua materna es el aymara y lo combina con español según las necesidades de comercio. Su labor es la confección de tejidos con lana de oveja, ella realiza; chompas, guantes, gorros, bufandas, pantalones para bebe y todo aquello que sea necesario según su público. Sus inicios fueron como ayudante en una empresa de costura, con la ayuda de su pareja se independizó y compraron una máquina tejedora, ella se encarga del tejido y su pareja del transporte y venta del producto. Su vida la comparte con su pequeño hijo que aún no va a la escuela en una vivienda en alquiler por la misma zona.
Ella sueña ampliar su negocio y tener mayor producción. Por el momento su necesidad es la de comprar lana por mayor para ahorra en gastos de transporte y generar mejores beneficios económicos para su familia.
Es por esos motivos que Lilian solicita un préstamo para la compra de lana por mayor y con los beneficios ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Lilian is a 36 year old woman who lives with her partner, has a 4 year old son, and has a sweater making business. She is entrepreneurial, committed, responsible, a good mother, and hard-working. She works in the area of Adela, a commercial zone known for its cold temperatures and high altitude. Lillian is of dark complexion, medium build, with long black hair. She dresses stylishly, but wears traditional clothing (blanket, hat, and skirt) for holidays. Her native language is Aymara, which she combines with Spanish when she necessary for business. She works weaving sheep wool fabrics. She makes sweaters, gloves, hats, scarves, pants for babies, and anything a customer would request. She began as an assistant at a sewing shop, and with the help of her partner, she created her own business and bought a knitting machine. She makes the fabric and her partner transports and sells the products. 

Lilian lives in a rental home with her small son who does not attend school yet. Her dream is to grow her business and have higher production rates. Currently, she needs to buy wool at wholesale to save on transport costs and to generate a better income for her family. This is why Lillian is requesting a loan to buy Lola at wholesale with the goal of helping her family.

loans.use: to buy wool at wholesale to sell and then support her family.

loans.name: Angeles Del Cielo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ANGELES DEL CIELO” iniciará el décimo primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Claudia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de chompas, venta de lencería, salón de belleza, taller de carpintería, tienda de barrio, venta de bisutería, venta de electrodomésticos, venta de cosméticos, taller de cerrajería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Claudia es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años, por recomendación de sus padres, quienes le apoyaron económicamente para el emprendimiento. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de abarrotes por mayor) que adquirirá de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.

En la imagen una de las señoras no esta presente es por que se encontraba en el consultorio médico.
texts.en:
The group A.C. “ANGELES DEL CIELO” will begin its 10th Pro Mujer loan cycle. As part of the Centro Focal de Santiago II, the group consists of 9 members and is directed by an executive board of which Claudia is the president. The members of the group have various businesses: weaving sweaters, selling underwear, beautify salon, carpentry shop, neighborhood store, selling costume jewelry, selling small appliances, selling cosmetics, locksmith.

The loan will benefit the small businesses of Claudia's group, and for the first time they have a new member who is a friend of a group member. Today she has a neighborhood grocery store business. She learned this business a few years ago at the recommendation of her parents, who support her economically with the business.

The loan will be used to for capital to buy groceries at wholesale in La Paz city and then to sell in her grocery stand. This work will enable her to generate income to support her family, as she is married with two children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health services the organization offers.

In the photo one of the women is not present because she had a medical appointment.

loans.use: to buy groceries at wholesale.

loans.name: Bernie

texts.en:
Bernie is 45 years old and married with four children, who are currently going to school. Bernie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like spices, bread, canned goods, soap, etc.

Bernie has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from rice retailing. Bernie aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like spices, bread, canned goods, soap, etc.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Evelyn works hard to support her family. She has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Evelyn is borrowing 8,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her bicycle transport business.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her bicycle transport business

loans.name: Tomija

texts.en:
Tomija, 43 years old, is married and the mother of two sons.  She is from a small village of West Magurmari in Dhupguri, Jalpaliguri district.  She lives with her husband Ramjan and her sons. One of her son is getting an education and is in grade 8. The other son stays at home. 

Her husband is a farmer by profession, engage in planting, cultivating, and harvesting of crops.  They grow different vegetables in different seasons in their farmland.   Now the family expenses are increasing day by day. They feel the need to further improve their agricultural activities.  They have decided to cultivate paddy which is an all season crop and, being the staple food of the regional people, in great demand throughout the year.  So they think it will be a profitable business which will earn more income.

Currently, Tomija is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy agricultural supplies such as seeds, fertilizers, etc., to start cultivation. She has a lot of faith and hope to get ahead, because her household expenses depend on this work.

With her profits she plans to purchase more land and she conveys her thanks to her lenders for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers for cultivating paddy.

loans.name: Tultuli

texts.en:
Tultuli, 26 years old, is a very committed and hardworking woman who has a lot of dreams for herself and her family. She has one son who studies in grade seven.  They live in the small village of West Magurmari in the district of Jalpaiguri in a small mud house.  
 
Tultuli’s husband Bijay, aged 35 years, engages in agricultural activities.  He mainly grows paddy.  Tultuli helps her husband in different jobs every day to keep their crops healthy, which is an arduous and difficult job that is worthwhile at the end of the season.

Her family's income depends on this agribusiness. Her husband has many years of experience in this job, which he learnt from his father.  The land is his own, an inheritance from his parents.  With the growing expenses of his family, he needs to expand his business by cultivating paddy in larger quantities.  This will not only meet the customers' demands but also earn an additional profit.  They need financial help.

Tultuli is now seeking a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to purchase more quality seeds and fertilizers to better cultivate paddy. She hopes for good revenue to meet all her dreams.  

She wants to support her son in his studies so that he cannot face any problem. Tultuli also aspires to build a concrete made better house for them with the profit because the house in which at present they are living is lacking all the minimum amenities.  She thanks her lenders.

loans.use: To buy agricultural inputs like seeds and fertilizers for cultivating paddy.

loans.name: Ranjina

texts.en:
Ranjina is a 24-year-old woman residing in a remote village West Magurmari in Jalpaiguri district.  She is illiterate and can sign her name only. She is married and is a mother of three sons. Being a housewife, she looks after her husband and children and does all the household work.  Her sons are students of grade 4 and 1 respectively.

Her husband, 32-year-old Fatebul, is a mason by profession and provides services of shuttering work for building-making. Now he wants to improve his shuttering business to satisfy the demand of his customers and to generate more income to financially support his family.

So Ranjina is applying for a loan from Kiva's field partner BJS for her husband so that he can buy more wood to improve his shuttering work. With the profit, she hopes to enhance her husband’s business and earn more, which will increase her family’s financial status. She wants to save money to provide a proper education to her sons. Ranjina is thankful to BJS and Kiva for this financial assistance.

loans.use: To purchase wood for her husband's shuttering business.

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en:
Doreen is a young woman aged 20. She is married and has one child. She lives in Hurungwe District in Zimbabwe, and she is currently volunteering as a Camfed leaner’s guide teaching life skills at a local secondary school. She is a business woman who is engaged in a business buying and selling clothes. Doreen has been doing this for the past ten months.

With the loan Doreen will expand her business and also pay for her younger sister's school fees with some of the profits she would have generated.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en: Liza is a married and the mother of nine children, five of whom attend school. She is 49 years old, hardworking and runs a general store in the Philippines that was damaged by super typhoon Haiyan last November 8, 2013. Liza is requesting a PHP 5,000 bridge loan from NWTF to buy more items to sell to her customers such as canned goods, coffee, milk and sugar. Her goal is to restart her business activities while she supports her family. Liza has been in this business for 20 years and would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, coffee, milk, and sugar.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en: Lourdes is 58 years old, married and the mother of five children. She works hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 8,000 loan from NWTF to buy more items to sell to her customers, including chips, soft drinks, eggs, soap and shampoo. Lourdes has borrowed and repaid four prior loans from NWTF and has been running her general store for ten years. She supplements her income by selling food items that she makes. She hopes to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Adan De Jesus

texts.es: Adán, tiene 42 años de edad, esta soltero, vive con sus 4 hijos, en una aldea del Municipio de Morazán Yoro. Siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura, pero necesitaba estar junto a sus hijos y tener una fuente estable de ingresos, hace 1 año decidió establecer su propio negocio de una pulpería. Ofrece productos alimenticios básicos como ser, arroz, frijoles, manteca, sal, café, huevos, harina, condimentos, churros, dulces y otros. Ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 5,000 lempiras, este dinero lo invertirá para surtir mas el negocio con productos alimenticios como granos básicos, azúcar, harina, pan, café, sal,  etc.para aumentar inventario y los ingresos.  Su plan  es tener una fuente de ingresos estables para la educación y el futuro de sus hijos.
texts.en: Adán is 42 years old. He is single and lives with his four children in a village in the township of Morazán Yoro. He has always worked in agriculture, but he needed to be with his children and have a stable source of income, so he decided a year ago to set up his own grocery store business. He offers basic food products such as rice, beans, lard, salt, coffee, eggs, flour, condiments, churros, sweets, and other items. He has decided to apply for a loan of 5000 lempiras. He will invest this money to stock his business with food products such as basic grains, sugar, flour, bread, coffee, salt, etc., to increase his inventory and his income. His plan is to have a stable source of income for the education and future of his children.

loans.use: to stock his business with products for the basic family food basket, such as basic grains, sugar, flour, bread, coffee, salt, and other items.

loans.name: Los Comerciantes Group

texts.es:
El grupo Los Comerciantes está ubicado en una zona cañera donde además se encuentra uno de los ingenios de mayor producción de azúcar. También se pueden encontrar varias tiendas importantes, sucursales bancarias y un parque en el cual hay tirolesa. Durante los fines de semana, las personas de la tercera edad acuden al parque para bailar danzón como una manera de recreación además de ofrecer un gran espectáculo a los demás visitantes. En el mismo lugar se realizan encuentros de volibol, excelentes momentos para la venta de helados, chicharrones, y demás alimentos. En otras palabras, el parque de la comunidad es un lugar agradable para pasar un buen fin de semana. 

La señora Fanny es uno de los integrantes del grupo; ella es soltera, pero cuida a su nieto de 10 meses, su hijo la apoya con parte de los gastos de la casa. siete años son los que tiene de experiencia en el negocio de videojuegos, en este tiempo ha visto a muchos niños y jóvenes llegar a jugar "maquinitas" (como se les conoce a los videojuegos en las comunidades y cuidades de México). Además, doña Fanny también realiza trabajos de temporada (coronas, guías, piñatas) durante los meses de noviembre, diciembre y enero que vende en el mercado de la localidad. Con las ganancias obtenidas de las maquinitas cubre los gastos de la casa. Comenta que las coronas y guías las elabora simplemente porque se trata de un pasatiempo que le permite obtener algunas ganancias que vuelve a invertir para comprar más material. En esta ocasión, Fanny necesita dar mantenimiento a los videojuegos y comprar las bases para las coronas pues la temporada de Navidad ya se acerca. 

Los demás integrantes y sus actividades son:

Aldo - Venta De Carne
José - Venta De Abarrotes
Diego - Servicio De Taller Mecánico

Si algo tienen en común los 4 integrantes del grupo es que todos son comerciantes  y cada una de sus actividades les dejan una ganancia con la cual solventan algunos gastos, es por eso el nombre del grupo.
texts.en:
The group Los Comerciantes is located in a sugar cane zone where you find one of the plants with the greatest production of sugar.  Also, it is possible to find various important shops, bank branches, and a park in which there is a zip-line.  During the weekends, senior citizens come to the park to dance Cuban dances as a form of  recreation and they offer a big entertainment to the other visitors.  In the same place, there are volleyball games and fine moments for the sale of ice cream, cracklings, and other foods.  In other words, the community park is a fine place to pass a good weekend.

Fanny is a member of the group.  She is single, but she takes care of her ten-month-old grandson.  Her son helps her with part of the household expenses.  She has seven years of experience in the business of video games.  During this time, she has seen many children and young people come to play "little machines" (this is what the video games are known as in the communities and cities of Mexico).  In addition, Fanny does seasonal work (wreaths, beacons, piñatas) during the months of November, December and January which she sells in the local market.  With the profits obtained from the little machines, she covers the household expenses. She mentions that she makes the wreaths and beacons simply because they are a pastime 
that allow her to get some earnings which she turns around and invests in more materials.  These days, Fanny needs to maintain the video games and buy the bases for the wreaths since Christmas time is coming.

The other members and their activities are:

Aldo - Sale of meat
José - Sale of groceries
Diego - Mechanic's shop service

If there is one thing that the four members of the group have in common it is that they are all vendors and each one of their activities leaves them an earning with which they can take care of some expenses, and for this reason the group has this name.

loans.use: to maintain the video games and she will buy bases for the wreaths.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en: Marife is 41 years old, married and the mother of seven children, five of whom are in school, She works very hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan from NWTF to buy additional household goods to sell such as soap, milk, sugar, and coffee. Marife has been in this business for the last year and would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is 55 years old, married and the mother of six children, two of whom are in school. She works hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan from NWTF to buy more items to sell to her customers, including soap, milk, sugar, and eggs. Teresita has borrowed and repaid five prior loans from NWTF and has been running her general store for 21 years. She supplements her income by selling fish. Her goal is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en: Gertrudes is 48 years old, married and the mother of two children. She works hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 19,000 loan from NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo and groceries. Gertrudes has taken out and repaid five prior loans from NWTF and has been running her general store for the last three years. She supplements her income by raising pigs. Her goal is to build and expand her business so her family can have a secure future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Tahima

texts.en:
Tahima is 45 years old and living with her husband and their two sons.  Her husband Saidul, 55 years old, is a farmer and has been involved in the activity of cultivation for a long time.  They live at West Magurmari, a remote village in Jalpaiguri district. Both Tahima and her husband are illiterate and only know to sign their names.  Due to poverty, they could not send their children to school. Her one son is a cycle van puller and other is unemployed. They live in a small mud house that lacks basic facilities like water, electricity, etc.

Tahima's husband started to cultivate vegetables, but later on he started growing paddy.  Now he mainly grows paddy, which has got a good demand in the market, being the staple food for the people of their locality.  He cultivates paddy and with the help of Tahima, he harvests and sells the produce in the local markets. He has a very good relationship with his customers, as he supplies quality products, in cheaper rates and on time.  Now they have a new idea of cultivating paddy on a large scale to improve their economic condition.  But due to shortage of funds he can't fulfill his dream.

To help her husband, Tahima is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to earn more income from her current business to improve their living conditions. She will utilize the loan to purchase agricultural inputs like seeds, fertilizers and pesticides.

She hopes to purchase more lands with the profit generated and she is very grateful to Kiva and BJS for this opportunity.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies for cultivating paddy.

loans.name: Sumita

texts.en:
Sumita is a 40-year-old lady from North Altagram, a small village of Jalpaiguri district.  She is married to Panchanan, a 46-year-old farmer.  They have four children (two sons and two daughters). All of their children go to school. They live in a small kachha house (made of straw, wood and mud).

Sumita's husband works as a farmer in the village to earn an income for the family's household.  He has cultivable land where he grows paddy. He has been engaged in these activities for many years.  Although Sumita is a homemaker, she helps her husband's work.  They sell the produce in the local market.  The major part of their locality is covered with agricultural land and paddy is cultivated widely in the region. So, they have to face competitors in the market. The income generated from this cultivation is insufficient to support the family.

Sumita wants to increase the productivity.  For this reason, she is seeking a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner).  She will use the loan to buy better quality seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides for a good quality product.  She hopes the loan will enable her to earn additional income to provide better education to their children and build a better and decent house for them in the future.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva for this financial support.

loans.use: To purchase paddy seeds and other necessary things to cultivate paddy.

loans.name: María Berta

texts.es:
María de 69 años de edad, estudio hasta 1° grado, dado que sus padres consideraron que era una pérdida de tiempo enviarla a estudiar. Está casada, su esposo es agricultor y pequeño ganadero. Tienen 5 hijos quienes tienen sus familias. María vive con su esposo y dos nietos.

María toda su vida se ha dedicado a los oficios del hogar. Sin embargo, ha aprendido el trabajo de la agricultura, ya que sus padres fueron agricultores y ella iba junto con sus hermanos a ayudarles. Además, su esposo es agricultor y junto con él, y con la ayuda de 1 hijo producen 14,000 metros cuadrados de cultivo de maíz y frijol, además ayuda a su esposo con el cuido de 3 vacas que tienen, y le gusta criar pequeñas especies, como lo son gallinas y cerdos.

El crédito será utilizado, para comprar 2 novillas, así María continuara apoyando a su esposo en la crianza de más ganado, y a la vez que continúen haciendo una de las actividades en la cual poseen mucha experiencia.


María tiene el sueño de mejorar su vivienda, también de tener más ganado y  le gustaría tener una parvada de gallinas ponedoras.
texts.en:
Maria is 69 years old. She went to school through first grade, given that her parents considered it a waste of time to send her to school. She is married. Her husband is a farmer and small-scale cattle rancher. They have five children who have their own families. Maria lives with her husband and two grandchildren.

Maria has worked all her life doing household tasks. Nevertheless, she has learned agricultural work, since her parents were farmers and she went along with her siblings to help them. In addition, her husband is a farmer and along with him and with the help of one son, they produce 14,000 square meters planted in corn and beans. Furthermore, she helps her husband care for their three cows, and she likes to raise small species, such as hens and pigs.

She will use toe loan to buy two heifers. Thus she will continue helping her husband in the raising of more livestock, and at the same time they will continue doing one of the activities in which they possess a lot of experience.

Maris has a dream of improving their house and also of having more livestock. She would like to have a flock of laying hens.

loans.use: to buy two heifers so that she can continue helping her husband to raise more livestock.

loans.name: Bahmal

texts.ru: Бахмал замужем. Она мать 5 детей. Для того чтобы прокормить своих детей, Бахмал где только не проработала. Она пережила много трудностей в своей жизни, так как ее муж не зарабатывал достаточно денег. Бахмал 8 лет назад начала бизнес купле продажей сухофруктов на местном рынке. Бахмал покупает оптом и продает в розницу. Она имеет в этой сфере достаточно опыта. Бахмал очень общительная женщина и она умеет делать индивидуальный подход каждому клиенту. Она хочет увеличить оборотный капитал и развевать бизнес. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 7500 сомони для покупки сухофруктов. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Bahmal is married and the mother of five children.  In order to provide for her children, she has worked just about everywhere! She has gone through many difficult times in her life, especially since her husband did not make enough money.  She started her own business eight years ago, selling dried fruits at the local market.  She buys her goods in bulk quantities and resells on a retail basis.  She has quite a good experience in her field of work.  Bahmal is a very sociable woman and she has a unique way of relating with each one of her customers.  She now wants to increase her working capital and develop her business.  She is taking a loan of 7,500 somoni to buy dried fruits.  She is awaiting your kindness and relying on your generosity.

loans.use: to buy dried fruits in order to increase her working capital.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two head of cattle

loans.name: Roca Fuerte Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROCA FUERTE” iniciará el décimo primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Elizabeth es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: salón de belleza, venta de comida, venta de leche, venta de embutidos, venta de carne de res, venta de cosméticos, venta de bisutería, compra y venta de ganado vacuno, venta de detergentes.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Elizabeth es integrante, ella indica que hace cuatro años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de carne de res; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años, ya que apoyaba en su negocio a su familia, posterior a tener su primer hijo decide emprender un negocio independiente. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de carne por mayor) que adquirirá de las comunidades ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Roca Fuerte" (Strong Rock) will begin its 11th loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Santiago II regional center. It is composed of nine members and is led by a board of directors where Señora Elizabeth is the president. The businesses that the members of the group run are varied. Among them are: beauty salon, selling food, selling milk, selling sausages, selling beef, selling cosmetics, selling jewelry, buying and selling cattle, and selling detergents.

The loan that they will take out will benefit these micro-entrepreneurs, of whom Elizabeth is one. She indicates that she joined Pro Mujer four years ago, entering at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. She now has a business of selling beef. She lets it be known that she began this business a number of years ago, since she was helping her family in their business. Later, after having her first son, she decided to begin an independent business.

The loan that she will take out now is to increase her capital to buy meat wholesale, which she will acquire from the communities of the city of La Paz and later sell in her sales stand. This form of work allows her to generate resources to help her family economically, since she is single and has two children.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the savings that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy meat wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a set of furniture for her house

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
La socia Martina continua con su negocio de  venta de comida, la socia pertenece al banco comunal “Llapallanchis Llankasunchis” ,la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de aceite, arroz entre otros.
La socia  agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Communal bank member Martina continues with her business of selling food. She belongs to the communal bank "Llapallanchis Llankasunchis." She has had her business for quite some time, and it is going well for her thanks to the effort that she puts into it every day. She wants to be able to continue working so that in this way she can support her family.

She is applying for the loan to purchase oil and rice, among other items.

She is grateful for and values the loan, and she promises to make her monthly payments with great responsibility.

loans.use: to buy oil and rice, among other items.

loans.name: Pinky

texts.en:
Pinky is 42 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school. Pinky works very hard to provide for them.

Pinky runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, and sugar.

Pinky has been in this business for 2 years. 

In the future Pinky would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Clementina

texts.en:
Clementina is 56 years old and married with eight children, four of whom are in school.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Clementina is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Clementina has been pig fattening for 3 years and also earns additional income from farming corn.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie is 49 years old and married with two children who are in school. Marjorie works very hard to provide for them.

Marjorie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like shampoo and groceries.

Marjorie has been in this business for 3 years. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn is 24 years old, married, and has two children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Emelyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Emelyn has been raising pigs for 2 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 42 years old, married, and has five children, three of whom are in school.

She is in the agricultural business raising livestock in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to raise.

Jocelyn has been raising livestock for 9 years now, and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to raise

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 58 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school. Elizabeth works very hard to provide for them.

Elizabeth runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries.

Elizabeth has been in this business for 3 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 39 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Emma is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Emma has been raising pigs for 5 years and also earns additional income from buying/selling ready-to-wear clothes.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is 59 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. Valentina works very hard to provide for them.

Valentina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell like canned good, eggs, milk, and sugar.

Valentina has been in this business for 3 years. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Naome

texts.en:
Naome is 33 years old, married, and has two children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business raising livestock in the Philippines. Naome requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her livestock.

Naome has been raising livestock for 6 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: buy feeds and vitamins for her livestock

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice works hard to support her family. Alice is married and has a buy and sell spices business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of spices to sell.

Alice has been in this business for 16 years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested additional loan to further build her business.

In the future, Alice would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of spices to sell

loans.name: Banco Mujer Aracolpa Kañeblocke Añita Group

texts.es:
Marleni es una mujer indígena de 44 años, vive en unión libre y tiene 2 hijas, estudiantes una de ellas en primaria y la otra en secundaria. Su compañero trabaja como oficial de seguridad, y ella trabaja como agricultora en una pequeña finca propiedad familiar donde siembra plátano.
