Su actividad productiva es la que le permite ayudar con los gastos de los estudios de sus hijas, que es lo más importante para ella, ya que con los ingresos de su compañero le hacen frente a los gastos básicos como alimentación y otros. Gracias a los préstamos de Fundación Mujer ella pudo iniciar su emprendimiento, consolidarlo y con el paso de los años extender sus cultivos en más de 2 hectáreas de terreno. Este es su sexto crédito y lo va a invertir en materia prima como semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, insecticidas, bolsas pláticas, cajas de cartón y otros. 
Su grupo Banco Mujer Aracolpa Kañeblocke Añita está conformado por 4 socias, todas la igual q ella van a invertir en actividades agrícolas.
texts.en:
Marleni is a 44-year-old indigenous woman. She lives in free union and has two daughters who are students, one in primary school and the other in secondary. Her companion works as a security official, and she works as a farmer on a small farm that belongs to the family and where she raises bananas. This productive activity is what allows her to help with the school expenses of their daughters, which is the most important thing for her, since with the income of her companion they deal with the basic expenses such as food and other items. Thanks to the loans from Fundación Mujer, she was able to begin her business, strengthen it, and with the passing of the years extend her crops to more than two hectares of land. This is her sixth loan, and she is gong to invest it in basic materials such as seeds, compost, fertilizers, insecticides, plastic bags, cardboard boxes, and other items.

Her communal bank "Banco Mujer Aracolpa Kañeblocke Añita" is formed by four members. All of them, like Marleni, are going to invest in agricultural activities.

loans.use: to buy seeds, compost, fertilizers, insecticides, plastic bags, cardboard boxes, and other items.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en: Marivic signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. Marivic is able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales, these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities, like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her sari sari store

loans.name: Leoncia

texts.en: Leoncia is 50 years old. She is known in the Ozamiz area for her banana and coconut buy and sell business. She is actively participating in the various programs and services that the coop offers. She hopes to live comfortably, with a decent house, for which she applied for a loan to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks. She hopes to maintain her membership in good-standing, with a good repayment record. It matters that she has been given a priority, as a micro finance member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). This is what she is thankful for, when all her financing needs of her retailing business are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase building materials for her house.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia makes a living through her coconut retail business. She runs her business in Ozamiz and earns a promising income to support her family. She has signed up her membership with PMPC to gain access to capital. She wants to increase her inventory. She requested a loan to purchase more coconut bundles to sell. Virginia hopes to sustain her business and dreams to send all her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more coconut bundles for resale

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Gemma is a businesswoman from Ozamiz. She is 31 years old, married and has expertise in selling. She runs a little sari-sari store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family. Gemma is a full fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. Now, she applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. Gemma continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr:
-   
 Demeurant  à  Lomé  dans  le quartier tokoin,  Kossiwa  est  âgée de 71 ans. elle est mariée  mère  et  mère  de 5 enfants. Kossiwa  vend  les  fruits et  s’approvisionne  4 fois par  mois  au  grand marché de lomé et   est  ambulante  . Kossiwa sollicite un prêt pour agrandir  son commerce et faire plus bénéfice
texts.en: Residing in Lomé in the Tokoin district, Kossiwa is 71 years old and a married mother of five children. She sells fruit and gets her supplies four times a month at the big market of Lomé. She is requesting a loan to expand her commerce and to make more profit.

loans.use: to purchase 2 boxes of apples and grapes

loans.name: Serieux Group

texts.fr:
SERIEUX est un groupe de l’association BENKADI de SELINKEGNY. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne quatre enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de condiments à l’image de MASSITAN qui est la première personne debout de la gauche vers la droite  de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à SELINKEGNY dans la Sous -Préfecture de SELINGUE (Région de Sikasso, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités d’achat vente de condiments : tomate, oignon et choux.
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso, il y a cinq ans. Elles sont à leur septième prêt solidaire. 
MASSITAN qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à SELINKEGNY, excelle dans la vente de condiments. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10 paniers de tomate et 2 sacs d’oignons.  Elle s’approvisionne à SELINGUE et sur place auprès des grossistes. Elle vend ses condiments à SELINGUE en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle mixte.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 40.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et s’investir le reste dans son activité d’achat vente de condiments.
texts.en:
SERIEUX is a group of the association BENKADI de SELINKEGNY. It is composed of women who know one another through ties of kinship and community. The women average 41 years of age. Married and having four children on average, they run different businesses, such as the buying and selling of condiments, as does MASSITAN, who is the first person standing at the left in the photo. The women live in large traditional families in SELINKEGNY, in Sous-Préfecture de SELINGUE, Région de Sikasso (Republic of Mali). They have been working in small-scale commerce for several years and are much in demand for their trade in condiments: tomatoes, onions, and cabbages. 

Concerned about satisfying the growing needs of their customers, the group members decided to join the loan program of the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso five years ago. They are now on their seventh solidarity loan. 

MASSITAN, who is the group’s president, is well-known in SELINKEGNY. She excels in selling condiments. She intends to use her loan to purchase 10 baskets of tomatoes and 2 sacks of onions. She gets her supplies in SELINGUE and locally from wholesalers. Her sales of condiments are made retail, cash or credit, to a mixed customer base in SELINGUE. 

She is hoping for a monthly profit of 40,000 francs CFA that will enable her to pay back the loan and to invest the rest in the condiments trade.

loans.use: to purchase condiments

loans.name: Baragnouma Group

texts.fr:
BARAGNOUMA est un groupe de l’association KOSSALA de DANGASSA. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 29 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne trois enfants. Elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente d’ustensiles à l’image de NENE qui est la troisième personne debout de la gauche vers la droite de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à DANGASSA dans l’Arrondissement de KOUROUBA, préfecture de KATI (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités d’achat vente d’ustensiles : cuillère, fourchette et assiette. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso, il y a trois ans. Elles sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire. 
NENE, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à DANGASSA, excelle dans la vente d’ustensiles. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 20 douzaines de cuillère et 10 douzaines de fourchette. Elle s’approvisionne à BAMAKO et sur place  auprès des grossistes  et vend ses objets  à DANGASSA, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle mixte.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 30.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et s’investir dans son activité ci-dessous.
texts.en:
BARAGNOUMA is a group of the association KOSSALA de DANGASSA. It is composed of women who know one another through ties of kinship and community. The women average 29 years of age. Married and having three children on average, they run different businesses, such as the buying and selling of utensils, as does NENE, who is the third person standing at the left in the photo. The women live in large traditional families in DANGASSA, in Arrondissement de KOUROUBA, Préfecture de KATI, Région de Koulikoro (Republic of Mali). They have been working in small-scale commerce for several years and are much in demand for their trade in utensils: spoons, forks, and plates. 

Concerned about satisfying the growing needs of their customers, the group members decided to join the loan program of the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso three years ago. They are now on their sixth solidarity loan. 

NENE, who is the group’s president, is well-known in DANGASSA. She excels in selling utensils. She intends to use her loan to purchase 20 dozen spoons and 10 dozen forks. She gets her supplies in BAMAKO and locally from wholesalers. Her sales of these goods are made retail, cash or credit, to a mixed customer base in DANGASSA. 

She is hoping for a monthly profit of 30,000 francs CFA that will enable her to pay back the loan and to invest in her business below.

loans.use: to purchase utensils

loans.name: Koladiya Group

texts.fr:
KOLADIYA est un groupe de l’association KOSSALA de DANGASSA. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne trois enfants. Elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de pots de jarre à l’image de MASSARAN qui est la première personne  debout de la gauche vers la droite de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à DANGASSA dans l’Arrondissement de KOUROUBA, préfecture de KATI (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités, d’achat vente de pot de jarre : canari.
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso, il y a trois ans. Elles sont à leur cinquième  prêt solidaire. 
MASSARAN, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à DANGASSA, excelle dans la vente de pots de jarres. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10 canaris.  Elle s’approvisionne à DANGASSA et environnant auprès des grossistes  et vend ses objets à DANGASSA, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 40.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et s’investir dans son activité d’achat vente de pot de jarre.
texts.en:
KOLADIYA is a group of the association KOSSALA de DANGASSA. It is composed of women who know one another through ties of kinship and community. The women average 30 years of age. Married and having three children on average, they run different businesses, such as the buying and selling of pots and other containers, as does MASSARAN, who is the first person standing at the left in the photo. The women live in large traditional families in DANGASSA, in Arrondissement de KOUROUBA, Préfecture de KATI, Région de Koulikoro (Republic of Mali). They have been working in small-scale commerce for several years and are much in demand for their trade in containers: earthenware jars. 

Concerned about satisfying the growing needs of their customers, the group members decided to join the loan program of the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso three years ago. They are now on their fifth solidarity loan. 

MASSARAN, who is the group’s president, is well-known in DANGASSA. She excels in selling  containers. She intends to use her loan to purchase 10 earthenware jars. She gets her supplies in and around DANGASSA from wholesalers. Her sales of these goods are made retail, cash or credit, to men and women customers in DANGASSA. 

She is hoping for a monthly profit of 40,000 francs CFA that will enable her to pay back the loan and to invest in the household containers trade.

loans.use: to purchase pot and other containers

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.en: Cornelia makes a living through her retailing business. She runs a sari-sari store in Poblacion, Sibutad ZDN, and earns a promising income to support her family. She has signed up for her membership with PMPC to gain access to capital. She wants to increase her inventory so she has availed herself of a loan to purchase more basic commodities and other consumable items. Cornelia hopes to sustain her business and dreams to send all her children to school.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase peanuts and corn

loans.name: Auring

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Auring works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Auring is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell for her general store business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested additional loan to further build her business.

Auring has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream - to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: Mario es separado y tiene dos hijos Mario vive en la comunidad de Palomar Mario tiene una casa de cemento y ladrillo con luz y agua Mario es agricultor y tiene que soportar agotamiento fisico por que la mayoria del tiempo se pasa agachado Mario quiere un credito para comprar un par de torillos para el engorde Mario es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar pero goza de buena salud y su evaluacion de credito es buena
texts.en: Mario is separated and has two children. He lives in the community of Palomar. Mario has a house made of cement and bricks. He has electricity and water. He is a farmer and has to put up with physical exhaustion because he spends most of his time bending over. Mario is applying for a loan to buy a few bulls for fattening. Mario is the only source of income in his household, but he enjoys good health and his credit rating is good.

loans.use: to buy a couple of bulls for fattening.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase grains

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en: Julieta, 53 years old, is married and a resident of Poblacion, Sibutad, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. Her husband is a fisherman. The fish he catches are sold at the public market or to their neighbors. They have been in this business for many years already. Since she wants to be more productive, she has now decided to enter into business herself, purchasing fish in bulk for resale at the market. Last May 14, 2008 both Julieta and her husband agreed to join Paglaum MPC to avail themselves of a loan because they wanted to buy fishing nets. Aside from the financial assistance they received, they say that they also enjoyed the add-on benefits like insurance and savings. She has now applied for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy fish for resale. She is hoping that with Paglaum’s help, and with the patience & diligence of her husband, she will be a successful vendor someday and will own a stall in the public market.

loans.use: to buy more fish for resale.

loans.name: Wallatas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “WALLATAS” iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por diez  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora María es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de jugos, venta de frutas, venta de ropa, tienda de barrio, venta de verduras y coca, venta de refrescos, venta de chamarras, servicio de comida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora María es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de refrescos y cerveza; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su madre, quien realizaba el mismo negocio. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de cerveza y refrescos por mayor) que adquirirá de las agencias mayoristas y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es soltera.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "Wallatas" Communal Bank is beginning its fifth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Senkata Regional Hub. This group is made up of ten members and is run by a board of directors, of which María is the president. The members' businesses are varied and include juice sales, fruit sales, clothing sales, a neighborhood store, vegetable and coca leaf sales, soft drinks sales, jacket sales, and a food service.

This loan will benefit small business owners like María. She says that she joined Pro Mujer three years ago by invitation from a friend who is a client of the institution. She currently has a business selling soft drinks and beer. She says that she learned about this business activity from her mother, who was in the same business.

She will use this loan to increase her working capital by buying wholesale beer and soft drinks from wholesale agencies. She will then sell the products in her business space. This work allows her to earn an income to support her family, as she is single. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answered that she likes the workshops offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy wholesale beer and soft drinks.

loans.name: Diego

texts.es:
El medio ambiente forma parte importante en el planeta y es bueno saber que aun hay personas que se dedican a cuidar el medio ambiente como un actividad productivo tal es el caso de Diego que desde muy pequeño tiene ese deseo de plantar en su comunidad, el tiene 52 años de edad  que tiene 3 hijos el primero es de 9 años de edad es estudiante en su comunidad, el segundo de 6 años de edad también estudiante y un último de dos años de edad que aun no estudia.

La actividad que Diego ha venido realizando desde hace 21 años es la plantación de café y Banano, el lo aprendió de sus padres ya que es la única herencia que ellos le dejaron y es por ello que el se a dedicado de la plantación de los mismos para poder tener un ingreso económico para su familia e obtener ganancias para el sustento de su familia, la segunda actividad que el realiza es jornalero en la comunidad donde el vive.

El propósito de la realización del préstamo de Diego es para la compra  de terreno que le están ofreciendo ya que desde hace un tiempo el a querido realizar esa compra de terreno para ampliar el cultivo de café y banano para tener mejores ingresos económicos.

Diego quiere ser diferente que sus padres y uno de sus más grandes aspiraciones es la construcción de casas para sus hijos para que ellos tengan las condiciones de vida adecuada y bridarles estudios a sus hijos para que lleguen a profesionales en la vida.
texts.en:
The environment is an important part of the planet, and it's good to know that there are still people who are dedicated to caring for the environment as a productive activity, such as Diego. From a young age, he had a desire to plant in his community. He is 52 years old and has three children. His oldest is nine years old and studies in his town, the middle child is 6 and also a student, and the youngest is 2 years old and is not in school yet.

Diego's business activity, which he has had for 21 years, is planting coffee and banana trees. He learned about this activity from his parents, as it is the only inheritance which they left him. Therefore, he has worked on the farm to earn a financial income and profits to sustain his family. He has a second job as a day laborer in the town where he lives.

Diego's goal with this loan is to buy land which has been offered to him. He has wanted to make this purchase for quite some time to expand his coffee and banana crops in order to earn a better income.

Diego wants to be different from his parents, and one of his biggest dreams is to build houses for his children so they have adequate living conditions. He would also like to offer his children an education so that they can become professionals later in life.

loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Yalgash

texts.ru: Ялгаш живет вместе со своей семьей в отдаленном регионе. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 5 детей. Он занимается скотоводством. Ялгаш откармливает и коров и баран. Он этим бизнесом занимается с юных лет. Ялгаш имеет более чем 20 летний опыт в этой сфере. Ялгаш данное время имеет 10 коров и 40 баран. Его жена и дети помогают ему введению бизнеса. Они продают молоко от коровы, шерсть барана, а также самих баранов и коров. Ялгаш живет очень в отдаленном регионе, и каждый месяц привозит на центральный базар своего района скот и продает их. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 15000 сомони для покупки скота, чтобы увеличить оборотный капитал. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Yalgash lives with his family in a remote area of Tajikistan. He is married and the father of five children.  He works in animal husbandry, fattening both cows and sheep.  He has been involved in this activity since his youth and he has more than 20 years of experience in this field of work.  He currently owns ten cows and ten head of sheep.  His wife and children help him run the business.  They sell the milk they get from the cows and the wool from their sheep.  They also sell the cows and sheep themselves.  The area where Yalgash lives is very remote.  Every month, he takes some livestock to the central market of his district and sells a few animals.  He is taking a loan of 15,000 somoni to buy some cattle in order to increase his working capital.  He is awaiting your kindness and relying on your generosity.

loans.use: to buy cattle in order to increase his working capital.

loans.name: María Antonia

texts.es:
María de 48 años de edad, estudio hasta 4° grado, ya que sus padres no tenían los recursos económicos,  para que asitiera a estudiar. Es madre soltera de 3 hijos de 30, 22 y 18 años de edad, ya que su esposo la abandono y le toco criar sola a sus hijos, quienes hoy trabajan.

María es una persona que ha enfrentado muchas dificultades en su vida, desde pequeña, inicio a trabajar junto a su madre y le ayudaba a vender frutas y verduras. También trabajo vendiendo pan francés durante aproximadamente 6 años. Hace dos años y medio inicio con el negocio de venta de ropa, actividad a la que decidió trabajar, ya que una amiga le enseño. Trabaja todos los días de 7:00 am a 3:00 pm y viaja en bus a los pueblos vecinos.

El crédito será utilizado para invertirlo en la compra de más mercadería (ropa), y así tener más producto para ir a vender, así María podrá continuar con su trabajo.

María tiene el sueño de tener un local estable, donde vender su mercadería, sin necesidad de andar de pueblo en pueblo, ya que es una actividad muy pesada.
texts.en:
María, 48, studied up until the 4th grade, as her parents did not have the financial resources for her to continue studying. She is a single mother of three children, ages 18, 22, and 30. Her husband abandoned her and she had to raise her children alone. They are now working.

María has faced many difficulties in her life from a young age. She started working alongside her mother, helping her to sell fruit and vegetables. She also worked selling French bread for about 6 years. Two and a half years ago, she started her business selling clothing. She decided to work in this business activity because a friend taught her about it. She works every day from 7:00am to 3:00pm and travels to neighboring towns by bus.

She will use this loan to invest in the purchase of more merchandise (clothing) in order to have more products to sell. María will then be able to continue with her work.

María's dream is to have a stable business location where she can sell her merchandise without having to go from town to town, since this is a tiring activity.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise (clothing) in order to have more products to sell and continue with her work.

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en: Emerita signed up for her membership with PMPC to avail herself of the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital it extends to a small-time borrower like her. Emerita was able to turn the tide in her favor and makes good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Therefore, she recently availed herself of a loan to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future she hopes to mount a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Gavhar

texts.ru: Гавхар трудолюбивая женщина. Она замужем и имеет одного сына. Ее сына зовут Шероз. Гавхар работает преподавателем в средней школе. Она очень умная женщина и всегда заботилась об обучении своего сына Шероза. Шероз в этом году успешно окончил среднюю школу и поступил в Политехнический Институт Технологического Университета Таджикистана. Он поступил в экономический факультет. Гавхар мечтает о том, чтобы ее сын стал высококвалифицированным специалистом после окончания университета. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Gavhar is a hardworking woman. She is married and has one son, named Sheroz. Gavhar works as a teacher in a secondary school.  She is a very intelligent woman and she has always cared very much about her son's education.  This year, Sheroz successfully graduated from secondary school and entered the Polytechnical Institute of the Tajik Technical University.  He is taking courses from the School of Economics.  Gavhar's dream is that her son completes her studies and becomes a highly-qualified university graduate.  She is awaiting your kindness and is relying on your generosity.

loans.use: to pay for her son's university tuition.

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en:
Benedicta is 47 years old and lives in Lumbia, Pagadian City. She is married with four children.

Benedicta has a shop that sells rice. She has had this business for one year. She requested a loan to add capital to her retail business so she can buy five sacks of rice.

Benedicta has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future Benedicta hopes to have a big shop for her business.

loans.use: to buy five sacks of rice for her retail business.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en: In 2003, Rosalina learned about Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. Rosalina tried her luck on starting a business focusing on her farming activities. She feels she owes her fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as capital. Rosalina has now borrowed another amount to purchase farm inputs. This will help give her farming income a big boost. Rosalina looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en: Sylvia, 67 years old, lives in Poblacion, Sibutad, Zamboanga del norte with her husband and two children. Her husband is a construction worker. Unable to sustain the needs of the family with only her husband’s income, she has found ways to attain income through snack and food vending. It began with selling a small amount of viand and snacks to their neighbors. She joined Paglaum Cooperative, which helped her in the capitalization of her sari-sari (small grocery) store in January of 2004. She became a MIGS member, which is why she has received loans several times already. Now, she is applying for 14,900 PHP to buy merchandise for her sari-sari store. She hopes that her business will continue and someday become a mini-grocery.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 49 years old and lives in Lumbia Pagadian City. She is single.

Josephine has a sari-sari store that sells different types of food. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan to restock the store with basic commodities.

Josephine has been a member of PMPC for one year and five months. In the future she wishes to build a big store.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities.

loans.name: Efipania

texts.en:
Efipania is 62 years old and lives in Sto. Niño, Pagadian City. She is married with three children.
Efipania has a shop that sells various types of products that we commonly use in our daily living.
She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan to restock her store.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities.

location.town: Pagadian-Sto. Nino, Pagadian City, Zamboanga Del S

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 56 years old and lives in Lumbia, Pagadian City. She is married with four children.

To earn a living, Gemma has a business selling puso/rice (rice wrapped in coconut leaves). She earns about 9,000 PHP a month doing this type of work.

Gemma has a requested a loan to buy raw ingredients for her food vending business. She has been a member of PMPC for eight months. In the future, she would like to have her own carenderia.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for food vending

loans.name: Mireille

texts.en:
Mireille, a native of Leyogan, is a single mother of three children. She is a self-made Haitian businesswoman. She has been one of the most influential women artisans in Port-au-Prince, Haiti.  It is obvious that everyone could see Mireille's passion and spirit for the artisan sector since she was a kid. Moreover, this activity was her family’s primary hobby and passion. In 1987, Mireille joined a textile factory in Port-au-prince. Unfortunately, the factory closed down three years later. Being unemployed, she decided to open her own business in which she would be able to live her passion and interest for handicrafts. She decided to sell purses, bags, flags, napkins, dresses and bottles that represent the beauty of the Haitian rich culture and heritage. 

In 2004, the business solicited a loan from Fonkoze to stabilize its financial performance. The business owner has participated and displayed the business products to the Haitian Diaspora in New York and Miami. In 2010, the shop became a member of the Union Artistique pour la promotion de l’artisanat (UAPA), which helps the artisan business to increase their customer base and gives them an opportunity to participate in cultural fairs. The business is in need of more supplies to increase production and to be well-prepared for the big sales at the upcoming Smithsonian Folklife Festival. The business is in need of a third loan, which will make a significant impact to its financial performance.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to make drums, hang bags, and purses

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 33 years old and lives in Nazareth, Pagadian City. She is happily married with four children. Marissa has a "lechon" (roasted pig) retail business. She had this business for 10 years.

Marissa has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Marissa hopes to have another stall outlet for display.

loans.use: to buy lechon (roasted pig) to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is married with five children. She is 53 years old and lives in Sto. Niño, Pagadian City.

Elizabeth make and sells clothes, potholders and other items to earn a living and has had this business for one year. She has requested a loan to purchase materials for her tailoring business.

Elizabeth has been a member of PMPC for eight years. In the future, Elizabeth hopes to build her own shop and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her tailoring business

location.town: Pagadian-Sto. Nino, Pagadian City, Zamboanga Del S

loans.name: Dolores Porfirio

texts.es: Dolores de 46 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 3 hijos una joven de 12 años y 2 varones de 19 y 8 años de edad. Él es un hombre que cada día se esfuerza por ir sacando adelante a sus hijos apoyado en su trabajo de pescador en el cual también le apoya su hijo mayor, además entre los meses de noviembre y abril aprovecha la zafra, época que los ingenios muelen la caña, por lo que buscando tener buenos ingresos Dolores se desempeña como jornalero. Dolores a falta de la madre de sus hijos ha tenido que dar un esfuerzo mayor, pero a pesar de ello no se deja vencer y cada día busca mejorar la calidad de vida de su hogar, por lo que desea encementar el piso de su vivienda y las paredes de la misma ya que actualmente el piso es de tierra y las paredes de adobe por lo que desea mejorarlas, pero al no contar con los fondos económicos necesarios solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava y mano de obra necesaria para encementar el piso y  las paredes de su vivienda.
texts.en: Dolores is 46 years old and lives in a privately-owned house with his three children, one girl, age 12, and two boys, 19 and 8 years old. Dolores is hard-working and every day puts in the effort in order to help his family to move ahead. He works as a fisherman, a job where he also receives help from his eldest son. In addition, from November to April every year, Dolores takes advantage of the sugar season, when the sugar mills grind the cane, in order to earn another income as a labourer. With no mother present, Dolores has had to put in a greater effort but, in spite of this, he will not let himself be defeated and, every day, is looking for ways to improve the quality of life in his household. As a result he now wants to cement the floors and walls of his home as the floor is currently of earth and the walls of adobe. He wants to make these improvements but, without the money he needs to do it, is applying for a loan from FUSAI in order to invest in cement, sand and gravel, and to pay labourers to carry out the work.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and gravel, and to pay labourers to cement the floor and walls of his home.

loans.name: Rosa Lina

texts.es: Rosa de 50 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su madre y su hermano de 35 años de edad. Ella es una mujer que todos los días sale desde muy temprano a ganarse la vida apoyada por su madre, la cual junto a ella se dedica a la venta de verduras como: tomates, cebollas, papas, chile verde, etc. Los cuales distribuye en el mercado central desde hace mucho tiempo, además su hermano la apoya con la economía del hogar gracias a su trabajo como lustrador de zapatos. Rosa es una mujer humilde que se esfuerza por mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y es por ello que desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda y encementar el piso de la misma, pero no ha logrado cumplir su deseo por falta de fondos, es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, lamina y madera para encementar el piso y cambiar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en: Rosa is 50 years old and lives in her own home with her mother and 35-year-old brother. Rosa goes out very early every day to earn a living. With support from her mother, Rosa sells vegetables such as onions, potatoes, tomatoes, green chillis and more. She has been selling these items at the central market for a long time. Rosa's brother also supports the household economy thanks to his work as a shoeshiner. Rosa is a humble woman who is putting in the effort to improve her family's quality of life. To do just this, she wants to cement the floors and replace the roof of her home but she has not been able to do this due to a lack of money. She is therefore applying for a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, gravel, metal sheeting and wood in order to cement the floor and replace the roof of her house.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, metal sheeting and wood in order to cement the floor and replace the roof of her house.

loans.name: Domingo

texts.es: Domingo de 56 años de edad habita en la vivienda de una prima. Él es un hombre que a pesar de haber perdido a su esposa no se ha dejado vencer y todos los días sale a ganarse la vida como agricultor, pero cuando no encuentra trabajo de agricultor se desempeña como albañil logrando así mantener la economía de su vivienda. Domingo tiene el deseo de construir un cuarto en el cual el pueda llegar a descansar después de sus arduos días de trabajo, pero no cuenta con el presupuesto necesario, por lo que se acerco a FUSAI para solicitar un crédito para invertir en: lamina galvanizada, madera y clavos para construir un cuarto de lamina en su vivienda lo antes posible.
texts.en: Domingo is 56 years old and lives in a house owned by his cousin. Even though he lost his wife, Domingo has not allowed himself to be beaten and, every day, he goes out to earn a living as a farmer. When there is no farming work, he works as a builder, thus managing to support the household economy. Domingo wants to build a room where he can rest after hard days at work. He does not, however, have enough money to build it and so has come to FUSAI to apply for a loan. He will use this loan to buy metal sheeting, wood and nails in order to build a room in his home as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy metal sheeting, wood and nails in order to build a room in his home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a set of furniture for his son.

loans.name: Germie

texts.en:
Germie is 34 years old and lives in Nazareth, Pagadian City. She is married with two children.

Germie has had a "lechon" (roasted pig) retail business for 12 years and she requested a loan for retail purposes.

Germie has been a member of PMPC for four years and she has a plan to expand soon.

loans.use: To buy lechon (roasted pig) to sell

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 60 years old and lives Sto. Niño, Pagadian City. She is married with five children.

She has been buying recycled items for her junk store business for almost 15 years. She requested a loan for additional capital to buy more recycled item. 

Delia has been a member of PMPC for three years and has a plan to continue this kind of business for family savings.

loans.use: to buy more recycled items for her junk store business

location.town: Pagadian-Sto. Nino, Pagadian City, Zamboanga Del S

loans.name: Isabina

texts.en: In the year 2007, Isabina learned about Paglaum MPC and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. As a farmer in Ozamiz City, she tried her luck and borrowed a loan to jump start her corn production. After several months, she was able to return her borrowed capital. To this day, Isabina feels she owes her good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used for her business. Recently, she took a loan to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer for the next cropping season. Isabina wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply corn in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer

loans.name: Korotoumou

texts.fr:
Née en 1970 à OUELESSEBOUGOU, KOROTOUMOU vit avec ses 4 enfants et son époux dans une  famille nucléaire à BANANKABOUGOU qui est l’un des quartiers de OUELESSEBOUGOU commune du dit lieu, Préfecture de KATI (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Korotoumou n’a pas eu la chance de progresser à l’école, très vite s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus auprès de sa  grande sœur qui faisait le commerce de produit de beauté. KOROTOUMOU, après des années d’expériences  avec cette dernière, opta pour  les mêmes activités à savoir l’achat vente de produit de beauté : boucle d’oriel, bijoux et bracelet.    
Après avoir correctement remboursé le cinquième prêt individuel précédent, KOROTOUMOU est à son sixième  prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso qui sera utilisé pour acheter,  une quantité importante de produit de beauté de différente sorte (boucle d’orielle, bijoux et bracelet). Elle s’approvisionne avec les  grossistes de BAMAKO  et effectue ses ventes au comptant, à crédit et en détail, à domicile et dans les foires  environnantes à une clientèle composé d’hommes et de femmes. 
KOROTOUMOU espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 60.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour   aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et s’investir dans les activités d’achat vente de produit de beauté.
texts.en:
Born in 1970 at OUELESSEBOUGOU, Korotoumou lives with her husband and four children as a single family unit in BANANKABOUGOU, which is one of the districts in OUELESSEBOUGOU, KATI (the Koulikoro region, Republic of Mali). 
Korotoumou didn't have the opportunity to continue her education, and soon became interested in her elder sister's income generating activity, being the selling of jewelry products.
After several years experience with her sister, Korotoumou opted to conduct the same business - the purchase and sale of jewelry products : Earrings, jewels and bracelets.
Having fully repaid her fifth individual loan, Korotoumou is on her sixth loan with Soro Yiriwaso, which she will use to buy a large quantity of various beauty products (earrings, jewels and bracelets). She buys her stock at wholesalers in Bamako, and sells the merchandise for cash and credit, door to door and also at various local markets, to both men and women. 
Korotoumou hopes to generate a monthly profit of 60,000FCFA which will be used to help her husband meet the family's needs, to repay the loan, and to develop her beauty product business.

loans.use: to buy various jewelry products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food products.

loans.name: Wendlarelgda Djipo Group

texts.fr:
Mr Mathieu est le représentant du groupe WENDLARELGDA DJIPO. Il se porte très bien. Marié, il est père de 03 enfants, le plus âgé a 7ans et le moins âgé a 9mois. 01 va à l’école. Il a 2 personnes en charge
Monsieur est jardinier depuis 15 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants. Ses clients sont les commerçants des villes voisines.
Il  veut s’acheter 05 boites de semences de choux, 05 boites de semences d’oignons, et 10 sacs d’engrais.
Mr Mathieu veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour accroitre  son activité et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mathieu is the representative of the WENDLARELGDA DJIPO group. He is doing very well. He is married and the father of three children - the eldest is seven, and the youngest just nine months old. One of them goes to school. He has two other dependent people, and has been a gardener for fifteen years.
He buys his equipment in the local markets. His clients are businesspeople from the neighbouring towns.
He wants to buy five boxes of cabbage seed, five boxes of onion seed, and ten bags of fertiliser.

Mathieu wants to use his profits to grow his business and to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase seed and fertiliser.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en: Sally is a businesswoman from Ozamiz. She is 37 years old, married with three kids, and has an expertise in selling. She runs a small sari-sari store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family. Sally is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken out several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without a record of default. Now, she has applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. Sally continues to look for better business opportunities, which is proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items

loans.name: Thắm

texts.en:
Thắm works in agriculture farming food. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. Thắm is 30 years old and is married with three children. Thắm lives in Bim Son town, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a  toilet and bathroom. This is Thắm's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. In the future, Thắm hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet and bathroom.

loans.name: Lily

texts.en: In 2011, Lily learned about Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. Lily tried her luck on a business focusing on her farming activities. She feels that she owes her fortune to PMPC for having trusted her with the money she used as capital. Lily has borrowed another amount to pay for seedlings and compost. This will help give her farming income a big boost. Lily looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and compost

loans.name: Marcelita

texts.en:
Marcelita is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marcelita is 30 years old and all of her children are in school.

Marcelita has a business selling dry goods in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of dry goods like combs, mirrors, lighters, etc. to sell to her customers.

Marcelita has been in this business for six years. Marcelita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock like combs, mirrors, and lighters to sell to her customers

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 28 years old and has three children. She is married and two of her children are currently in school.

Maricel is in the agricultural business fattening pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Maricel has been in pig fattening for six years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Maricel would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ethel

texts.en:
Ethel is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her as she was able to buy additional stock of bridal gown products. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her youngest child and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to purchase more bridal gowns, dresses and other products needed in her business. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her child. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Ethel dreams of more success in her business and she hopes that her child will complete his studies. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more bridal gowns and dresses to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Phy's Group

texts.en:
Living in a thatched roof house in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Phy is aged 50 years old and married. She and her husband have four children. They earn a living through farming rice and they have been in this business for almost 25 years. With her current business, she is able to earn approximately 40,000 KHR per day to support her family.

This is the fourth loan for Phy with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to have a bigger crop yield and sell it for a good price to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Emmylou

texts.en:
Emmylou is 30 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Emmylou runs a rice retail business in the Philippines and has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy sacks of rice to sell. Emmylou has been in this business for two years. In the future, Emmylou would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additonal sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 33 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Marilou is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional livestock, feed and other supplies for her business.

Marilou has been raising livestock for six years and earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock, feed and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es: Blanca de 29 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su padre y su hija de 11 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que buscando la manera de sacar adelante a su hija y brindarle estudios decidió colocar una venta de tortillas en su vivienda, por lo que todos los días se levanta muy temprano a cocer el maíz y preparar todo para elaborar las tortillas, además su padre la apoya con el maíz ya que es agricultor y actualmente tiene una manzana de tierra sembrada. Blanca buscando siempre la manera de mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia desea encementar el piso de su vivienda y cambiar el techo de la misma, pero no cuenta con los recursos económicos necesarios por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, lamina y madera para encementar el piso y cambiar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Blanca, 29, lives in her own house with her father and her 11-year-old daughter.  She is an enterprising woman who sells tortillas from her home in order to support her daughter and give her an education.  Every day Blanca gets up very early to cook the corn and start making the tortillas.  Her father also helps out with the corn since he is a farmer and has a patch of land planted.

Blanca is always looking for ways to improve her family's living conditions.  She wants to put down a cement floor in her hosue and change the roof but does not have the necessary economic resources.  Therefore, she is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy cement, sand, gravel, metal sheeting and wood to put down a cement floor and change the roof of her house.

loans.use: To buy cement, sand, gravel, metal sheeting and wood to put down a cement floor and change the roof of her house.

loans.name: Mauricio Antonio

texts.es: Mauricio de 32 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus 2 hijos de 10 y 3 años de edad. Él es un hombre trabajador que desde hace 10 años se gana la vida elaborando estructuras metálicas en un taller cercano, pero al no ser un trabajo constante decidió buscar trabajo también como motorista en una empresa que vende gas propano para darle una mayor seguridad económica a su familia. Mauricio siempre buscando lo mejor para su familia desea colocarle techo a su vivienda, ya que como se observa en la fotografía, su vivienda carece de techo, puertas y ventanas por lo que el solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, polines, pines, puertas y ventanas para colocar techo, puertas y ventanas a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mauricio, 32, lives in his own home with his common-law wife and their two children, ages ten and three.  He is a hard-working man who has worked for ten years in a nearby workshop making metal structures.  But the work is not continuous so he also sought a job working as a driver for a propane gas company in order to give his family a more stable economy.

Mauricio is always looking for ways to give his family the best and he wants to put a roof over his house.  As seen in the photograph, the house does not have a roof, doors nor windows.  Therefore, he is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy metal sheeting, beams, nails, doors and windows to finish his house.

loans.use: To buy metal sheeting, beams, nails, doors and windows for his house.

loans.name: Nohemy De Los Angeles

texts.es: Nohemy de 23 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijos un varón de 10 meses y una niña de 5 años de edad. Ella es una mujer que gracias a su esfuerzo y tenacidad ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos apoyada por su compañero de vida que se desempeña como vendedor ambulante, al igual que ella en una plaza municipal, dicha actividad tiene alrededor de 3 años de realizarla. Nohemy desea mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir un muro y encementar el piso de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Nohemy, 23, lives in her own home with her common-law husband and their two children, a 10-month old boy and a five-year-old girl.  Thanks to her efforts and tenacity, Nohemy has been able to support her children with the help of her husband who works as a street vendor, like her, in the municipal plaza.  They have been in business for around three years.

Nohemy wants to improve her family's quality of life and is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron to build a wall and put down a cement floor in her house.

loans.use: To buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron to build a wall and put down a cement floor in her house.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
Raquel de 34 años de edad, estudio hasta 9° grado, es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos de 15 y 5 años de edad, a quienes con mucho amor cuida todos los días para sacarlos adelante.

Raquel es una persona trabajadora y sobre todo emprendedora, a pesar que padecio de una enfermedad mortal, nunca perdió la esperanza de salir adelante, y es por eso de que ahora, tiene una pequeña tienda y ademas tiene un negocio de venta de tortillas, ambos están en su casa, y desde las 9 de la mañana empieza a elaborar tortillas hasta las 2 de la tarde y el negocio de la tienda esta habilitado desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche.


El préstamo sera utilizado para invertir en los dos negocios, y se distribuirá  para comprar mas mercadería para la tienda como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, sal, aceite, jabón, productos del cuidado personal, etc y para comprar maíz, el cual es la principal materia prima, para elaborar las tortillas.  De esta forma, Raquel podrá tener la oportunidad de continuar trabajando y poder sacar adelante a sus hijos.

El deseo de Raquel es tener salud, ya que de esta manera, podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y de sus hijos y a la vez podrá guiarlos, ademas se esforzara para que estudien y se preparen para enfrentar las adversidades de la vida. También le gustaría comprar un terreno.
texts.en:
Raquel is 34 years old and studied until the 9th grade.  She is a single mother of two children who are 15 and 5 years old, who she cares for with lots of love every day so that they can get ahead.  

Raquel is a hard-working person and above all an entrepreneur.  Even though she suffered from a deadly disease, she never lost hope of moving forwards, and that's why today she has a small store and a business selling tortillas.  Both businesses are in her home, and she makes tortillas from 9 in the morning to 2 in the afternoon.  The store is open from 6 in the morning until 8 at night.  

The loan will be used to invest in her two businesses, and it will be divided between buying more merchandise for the store such as rice, beans, sugar, salt, oil, soap, personal care products, and other items and buying corn, the principal ingredient used in making tortillas.  This will give her the opportunity to continue working and allow her children to get ahead.  

Raquel wishes to be healthy, improving her own quality of life and that of her children and at the same time to give her children guidance, so she will work hard to that they can study and prepare to confront life's challenges.  She would also like to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy things for the store such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, soap, personal care products, and other items, and to buy corn to make tortillas

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa tiene 40 años de edad, esta casada y vive con sus tres hijos, su esposo vive en estados unidos.

Teresa es una mujer trabajadora quien se gana la vida honradamente y siempre con entuciasmo trata de salir adelante, uno de sus hijos trabaja y colabora con los gastos del hogar, su esposo trabaja en la agrucultura cosechando maiz, frijoles, maicillo, ayotes, guisquiles, etc.

El préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar arena, cemento, bloque, para construir una habitación a sus hijos. Teresa sueña con que sus hijos salgan adelante trabajando duro y dignamente para ganarse el pan de cada dia y que dispongan de sus cosas y que sepan valorar y apreciar lo que cuesta ganarse la vida.
texts.en:
Teresa is 40 years old, married, and lives with her three children. Her husband lives in the United States.

Teresa is a hard-working woman who earns her living honestly and, always with enthusiasm, tries to get ahead. One of her children works and helps with the household expenses, her husband works in agriculture, harvesting corn, beans, sorghum, squash, guisquiles (chayote), etc.

The loan that she is requesting is to purchase sand, cement, and concrete blocks, to build a room for her children. Teresa dreams of having her children get ahead through hard and dignified work to earn their daily bread and have their things, and that they know to valor and appreciate what it costs to earn a living.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and concrete blocks to build a room for her children.

loans.name: Rafaela

texts.es:
Rafaela  es una señora de 56 años de edad, casada madre de 4 hijos tres hembras y un varón, los cuales ya están casados, ella se dedica a los oficios del hogar ya que no tubo la oportunidad de estudiar.

El esposo trabaja en una cooperativa en el cultivo del café, una de sus hijas esta casada pero  vive en su misma casa tiene dos hijos, aparte de ello cuida de dos nietos de otra de sus hijas que trabaja en la capital, la cual le ayuda para la manutención de sus hijos. 

Rafaela tiene una pequeña tienda desde hace 30 años, ella debido a la necesidad que tenia en ese momento decidió poner una tienda, al principio era poco lo que vendía; pero luego obtuvo mas clientes y con la ganancia que este le genero pudo surtir mas su tienda la cual la tiene en su propio hogar y la trabaja todo el día.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar aceite, golosinas, galletas, embutidos, artículos del cuidado personal, frijoles,azúcar,etc para surtir mas su tienda.
  
En el futuro ella desea tener mas surtida su tienda y de la cosecha de granos poder tener a la venta y de ahí obtener mas ganancias y poder mejorar su vivienda ya que por el momento es de adobe.
texts.en:
Rafaela  is a 56-year-old woman, married, and mother of 4 children, three girls and a boy, who are married. She takes care of the household tasks since she did not have the opportunity to go to school.

Her husband works in a cooperative that harvests coffee, one of her daughters is married but lives in the same house and has two children. Apart from them, she cares for the two grandchildren of another of her daughters, who works in the capital, which helps support her children.

Rafaela has had a small store for the last 30 years; due to the needs she had at the time, she decided to open a store. At first she sold very little, but later she got more customers and with the profits that this generated, she could increase the store's stock, which she has in her own home and where she works all day. 

The loan that she is requesting from CREDICAMPO is to purchase oil, candies, cookies, cold meats, personal care products, beans, sugar, etc. to increase the store's stock.  

In the future, she wants to have more stock in her store and be able to have some of the grain harvest for sale, and from there get more income and be able to improve her house, which currently is made of adobe.

loans.use: to purchase oil, candies, cookies, cold meats, personal care products, beans, sugar, etc. to increase her store's stock.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Construyendo el país de la eterna primavera y del desarrollo, Antonio de 59 años de edad soltero con cinco hijos los dos primeros ya tiene familias separadas y los tres últimos son estudiantes en la escuela de su comunidad, Antonio está decidido a luchar por la vida no importando los obstáculos que la vida le pone el está dispuesto a superarse.

La actividad principal de el es la albañilería en la comunidad donde el vive, desde niño el tomo la decisión de aprender a construir casas de su comunidad dicha profesión a la venido trabajando desde hace 20 largos años de sacrificio pero que lo ha hecho con mucho orgullo parque lo hace por su familia porque necesitan de un ingreso económico para la satisfacción de las necesidades de su familia y para el desarrollo de su comunidad donde vive.

El propósito del crédito que el desea realizar es para la compra de herramientas de construcción en la albañilería ya que es de importancia para el y sin esas herramientas el no podrá trabajar para seguir construyendo en su comunidad.

Uno de los más grandes sueños de Antonio es ver crecer a su hijo y darle educación para que llegue a ser un profesional y poner una constructora para el servicio de su comunidad y el desarrollo en un futuro.
texts.en:
Antonio is building the country of eternal spring and its development.  He is 59 years old and single with five children, the first two who have their own families, the the last three are students in the community school. Antonio is firm on fighting for a life regardless of the obstacles it puts in front of him; he is ready to overcome them. 

His primary work is masonry in the community where he lives. As a boy, he decided to learn how to build houses in his community. He has been working in this profession for 20 long years of sacrifice, but has done it with great pride since he does it for his family because they need an income to meet the family needs and for the development of the community where he lives. 

The purpose of this loan that he wants to take out is to purchase construction tools for masonry since they are important for him and without these tools, he won't be able to work to continue building his community. 

One of Antonio's greatest dreams is to see his son grow and provide him with an education so that he becomes a professional and to establish a construction company to serve his community and development for the future.

loans.use: to purchase construction tools.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator to keep his food.

loans.name: Aguilas De Escoma Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AGUILAS DE ESCOMA” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Achacachi, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lupa es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de fruta, venta de ropa, venta de polleras y mantas, venta de pescado, venta de comida, servicio de construcción.
 
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lupa es integrante, ella indica que es el segundo año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio costura de mantas y chompas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su padre, quien trabajada hace varios años con este negocio, con el pasar del tiempo decide independizarse.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para alimento en tiempo de sequía (compra telas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.

En la imagen una de las socias no esta presente por razones familiares se marcho rraudamente
texts.en:
The A.C. Aguilas de Escoma will be starting its third cycle at Pro Mujer as a part of the Centro Focal de Achacachi.  It is made up of 8 members and it is led by a board of directors of which Lupa is the secretary.  The members of this community association lead various kinds of businesses, such as fruit, clothing, food, fish, skirt and blanket sales and construction.  
 
The loan that they will take out will benefit small micro-enterprises where Lupa is a member.  She says that this is the second year that she is a part of Pro Mujer, which she joined through the invitation of a promotor of the institution who came to visit her at her home.  Currently she has a business sewing blankets and sweaters.  She says that her father worked for many years in this business and taught it to her.  WIth the passage of time, she decided to become independent.  

The loan that she will take out is for food in a time of drought (buying wholesale fabric) that she will get from the wholesale vendors in the city of La Paz and subsequently for producing the clothing that she will sell in her place of business.  This kind of work allows her to generate the income to support her family, since she is married and has children.

If you ask her what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the credit and the healthcare that the institution offers.  

One group member is absent in the photo because she had to leave for family reasons.

loans.use: to buy wholesale fabric

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Mary Jane works hard to support her family.

She has a pig fattening business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a machine shop. Mary Jane is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs for her pig-fattening business.

Mary Jane has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 26 years old and married with one child, and she works very hard to provide for her family.

Mary Jane runs a direct-selling business with Avon products in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of Avon products. She has been in this business for 1 year. 

In the future she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of Avon products

loans.name: Grupo Flor Del Cafe Group

texts.es:
Herlinda tiene 54 años de edad, es casada y tiene tres hijos,  dos de ellos ya tienen familias diferentes, el tercero vive con ella e estudia primero básico en un colegio de su comunidad y todos ellos viven en Suchitepéquez. (Herlinda es la que se encuentra en la fila de  atrás con una blusa blanca de izquierda a derecha en la fotografía) 

La actividad principal que realizan es la venta de tortillas ya que es una buena actividad para tener un ingreso económico para poder satisfacer las necesidades de su familia, la segunda actividad que realiza Herlinda es la venta de refacciones en su comunidad para satisfacer las necesidades de las personas  que habitan por el lugar.

Los fines con que ella desea realizar un préstamo, es para  la ampliación de la venta de tortillas que ella tiene para así poder tener mejores ingresos económico para poder satisfacer las necesidades de su familia. 

En conjunto con un grupo de mujeres emprendedoras  que desean salir adelante decidieron formar parte del grupo de Herlinda para tener un futuro mejor y de sus familias.

 Una de las más grandes aspiraciones de ella es ver que su hijo se convierta en un profesional en su comunidad y que tenga una vida mejor y un futuro de éxito.
texts.en:
Herlinda is 54 years old and married with 3 children.  Two of them already have different families, and the third lives with her and goes to 7th grade at a local school.  They all live in Suchitepéquez.  Herlinda is the woman in the back with a white blouse from left to right in the photo.

Her principal business is selling tortillas, since it's a good business for making enough profits to be able to meet the needs of her family.  Herlinda also sells light refreshments in the community to satisfy the needs of the people who live there.

Her goal in taking out the loan is to expand her business selling tortillas to be able to make better profits to meet the needs of her family.

Herlinda decided to form a group with other entrepreneurial women who want to get ahead to have a better future for themselves and their families.  One of her greatest aspirations is to see her son become a professional in their community and that he has a better life and a successful future.

loans.use: to expand their business selling tortillas

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for 10 years, and also earns more income from raising pigs and food vending.

Teresa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase manure and fertilizer among other supplies to support the pineapple crop.

loans.name: Miller Lay

texts.es:
Miller es una mujer con toda la energía y disposición para enfrentar el mundo y superarse.

Desea iniciar un negocio de venta de mercancía variada como ropa y cosméticos, con este negocio podría obtener ingresos para poder mantener y sostener a su hijo.
Es una mujer muy aplicada y responsable pues cuida mucho a su hijo y tiene deseos de sacarlo adelante y que sea profesional.

Solicita un crédito para la compra de surtido de ropa y cosméticos para empezar con sus ventas.

Con este préstamo puede cumplir su sueño de ser independiente y darle a su hijo todo lo que necesite, además de poder pagar sus estudios y progresar.

Apoya el proyecto de una madre emprendedora Colombiana!
texts.en:
Miller is a woman with all the energy and disposition to confront the world and improve herself. 

She wants to start a business selling a variety of merchandise such as clothing and cosmetics. With this business, she will be able to get income to be able to support and sustain her child.

She is a very diligent and responsible woman, since she cares a lot for her child and has the desire to get him ahead and that he become a professional.

She asks for this loan to purchase a supply of clothing and cosmetics to begin her sales.

With this loan, she can realize her dream of being independent and giving her son everything he needs, in addition to being able to pay for his schooling, and to progress. 

Support this project of an enterprising Colombian mother!

loans.use: to purchase a supply of clothing and cosmetics to begin her sales.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 54 years old and married with three children, who are all in school. Zenaida works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, eggs, etc. She has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future Zenaida would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase agricultural suplies to support her coffee crop.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
El medio ambiente forma parte importante en el planeta y es bueno saber que aun hay personas que se dedican a cuidar el medio ambiente como un actividad productivo tal es el caso de Manuela que desde muy pequeña tiene ese deseo de plantar en su comunidad, ella tiene 28 años de edad  que tiene 3 hijos el primero es de 9 años de edad es estudiante en su comunidad, el segundo de 6 años de edad también estudiante y un último de dos años de edad que aun no estudia.

La actividad que Manuela ha venido realizando desde hace 10 años es la plantación de café y Banano, ella lo aprendió de sus padres ya que es la única herencia que ellos le dejaron y es por ello que ella se a dedicado de la plantación de los mismos para poder tener un ingreso económico para su familia e obtener ganancias para el sustento de su familia, la segunda actividad que ella realiza es cultivo de maíz en la comunidad donde ella vive.

El uso respectivo que Manuela le dará al préstamo que ella solicita es para el mantenimiento de banano  para que produzcan sus frutos y sean llevados en los mercados de la comunidad para su respectiva venta.

Manuela quiere ser diferente que sus padres y uno de sus más grandes aspiraciones es la construcción de casas para sus hijos para que ellos tengan las condiciones de vida adecuada y bridarles estudios a sus hijos para que lleguen a profesionales en la vida.
texts.en:
The environment is an important part of the planet and it is good to know that there are still some people who are dedicated to taking care of the environment while being productive.  Manuela is one of these people, and since she was very young she wanted to plant things in her community.  She is 28 years old and has 3 children.  The oldest is 9 years old and studies in the community, the second is 6 years old and also a student, and the third is 2 years old and doesn't study yet.  

Manuela has been making a living growing coffee and bananas for 10 years.  She learned the business from her parents and this is the only inheritance that they left her, so she plants the same crops as they did and in this way she can gain income to support her family.  She also plants corn in the community where she lives.  

Manuela will use the loan to care for her banana crops so that they can produce fruit and be taken to the markets in the community to be sold.  

Manuela wants to be different from her parents and one of her greatest aspirations is to build homes for her children so that they can live in adequate conditions and allow them to study so that they can become professionals in their lives.

loans.use: to care for her banana trees

loans.name: Doris Onelia

texts.es:
La joven Doris de 34 años de edad, tiene dos hijos de 9 y 15 años de edad y actualmente residen en la colonia Venecia de Tegucigalpa.
Doris ha podido mantenerse estudiando gracias al apoyo de su esposo, quien con mucho sacrificio se hace cargo de sus pagos a la universidad, debido al aumento de los costos en el centro universitario, Dla joven solicita un apoyo económico para terminar sus estudios en la carrera de Gerencia de Negocios en la universidad Tecnológica de Honduras.
Doris se caracteriza por ser una persona muy entregada a sus estudios, es sumamente responsable en sus labores de madre, esposa y estudiante, sobre todo le gusta colaborar y ayudar a los demás.
Su motivación inicial es poder brindar un buen ejemplo a sus hijos, y a la vez brindarles mejores condiciones de vida y oportunidades de trabajo.
Doris comparte el siguiente mensaje: Si todos tuviéramos la oportunidad de educarnos, el país tomaría rumbos diferentes y progresivos en todos los aspectos, especialmente en el ámbito socio cultural.
Como aprendizaje; recuerda al inicio de sus clases haberse desmotivado, debido a la situación económica que se atraviesa hoy en día, ella pensó no poder lograr lo que hoy en día esta obteniendo y es llegar a la recta final de su carrera, agradece a las personas que se toman el tiempo de apoyar a la juventud para que esta pueda culminar con sus estudios.
Doris desea graduarse y así poder obtener un buen puesto dentro de una empresa que le permita crecer y mostrar sus habilidades y conocimientos.
texts.en:
Doris is a 34-year-old young woman, has two children ages 9 and 15, and they currently live in the colony of Venecia de Tegucigalpa. 

Doris has been able to continue studying thanks to the support of her husband, who, which great sacrifice, has taken on paying the university costs.  Due to the increase in the costs of the university, she asks for economic support to finish her degree in business management at the Technological University of Honduras.
