Doris is characterized as being a person very invested in her studies, she is extremely responsible in her work as a mother, wife, and student; above all she likes to support and help others. 

Her initial motivation is to be able to offer a good example to her children, and at the same time, offer them better living conditions and work opportunities.  

Doris shares the following message: If we all had the opportunity to educate ourselves, the country would take different and progressive paths in all aspects, especially in the social and cultural aspect. 

As for learning, she remembers at the beginning of her courses being unmotivated, due to the economic situation that she confronts these days. She thought that she couldn't manage to achieve what she is doing today, and this is to arrive at the end of her degree work. She thanks the people who take the time to support youth so that they can finish their studies. 

Doris wants to graduate, and in this way, be able to get a good job within a business, that will allow her to grow and show her skills and knowledge.

loans.use: to pay for her university education.

loans.name: Cabañitas Dos Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CABAÑITAS DOS” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rosmery es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de papa, venta de comida, tienda de barrio, venta de mantas, tejido de mantas, costura de polleras, venta de llantas, servicio de construcción.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Rosmery es integrante, ella indica que hace diez años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una asesora de la institución que la visito en su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de papa; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió con el primer crédito que obtuvo en Pro Mujer, ya que anteriormente analizó el amplio comercio que tenía este producto. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de papa por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros y el crédito que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “CABAÑITAS DOS” group will begin its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Senkata. It is comprised of eight members and is led by officers, of whom Rosmery is the president. The businesses that the group members carry out are varied, and among those are: potato sales, food sales, a neighborhood store, blanket sales, weaving blankets, sewing polleras (traditional skirts), selling tires, and a construction service. 

The loan that they are taking out will benefit the small businesspeople, of whom Rosmery is one. She says that ten years ago, she joined Pro Mujer, joining at the invitation of a staff person who visited her home. Currently, she has a business selling potatoes; she says that she learned this business with the first loan that she got from Pro Mujer, since she had previously analyzed the wide business that this product has.

The loan that they are now taking out is to increase the capital (purchase potatoes in bulk) that she will get from the wholesale vendors and later will sell in her retail space. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family, since she is married and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the savings and the loans the the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes in bulk.

loans.name: Gloria Ines

texts.es:
Gloria es una mujer humilde dedicada al cuidado de sus parientes, ya que estos son enfermos y requieren de una persona que siempre este pendientes de ellos, a base de esto no pudo realizar libremente su vida y es apenas que hace 2 años cuando monto su negocio de tienda de productos de la canasta familiar. 
Motivada por la aceptación de sus vecinos y viendo como mejoran las cosas en su hogar ay que pueden comprar más víveres para una comida que antes era muy restringida y limitada por los pocos recursos que tenían quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de una nevera panorámica con la intención de comenzar a exhibir y vender bebidas en su negocio. 
La inclusión de la nevera en el negocio representara un aumento considerable en las ventas pues muchos clientes se lo piden, su sueño es seguir siempre adelante y cuidar su familia.
texts.en:
Gloria is a humble woman dedicated to the care of her relatives, since they are sick and require a person who is always near.  Because of this, she couldn't freely realize her life and merely 2 years ago she undertook her business which is a store selling food staples.

Motivated by the acceptance of her neighbors and seeing how they improve things in her household, and that she can purchase more goods for a diet that was very restricted and limited due to the few resources that she had, she wants to ask for a loan to purchase a display refrigerator with the intention to begin to display and sell drinks in her business.

The inclusion of a refrigerator in her business will represent a considerable increase in the sales since many of her customers have asked for it.  Her dream is to always continue onward and to care for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator to display and sell drinks to her customers who have been asking for them.

loans.name: Amilcar

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Beira Província de Sofala tem 36 anos de idade casado oficialmente pai de 3 filhos menores de idade apenas 2 frequentam a escola, não responsabiliza-se por ninguém.
Trabalha como Ajudante Aduaneiro na Tirona a mais de 2 anos onde aufere um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa e nos seus negócios. Com empréstimo solicitado pretende aumentar o volume da sua criação  de frangos adquirindo pintos ,ração e vitaminas. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo na hluvuku. 
Futuramente pretende criar poedeiras e tem como desafio garantir o ensino dos seus filhos até ao nível superior
texts.en:
Amilcar was born in Beira, in the Sofala province of Mozambique. He is 36 years old and is married with 3 children, two of whom are in school. He is not financially responsible for anyone other than his family.

For more than 2 years, Amilcar has worked as a customs agent at the international rail terminal in Namaacha, earning money that he uses to cover household expenses and help with his business. With this loan he would like to increase production in his chicken raising business by buying chicks, feed and vitamins. This is his fourth loan with Hluvuku [Kiva Field Partner].

In the future, Amilcar would like to start raising laying hens, and his goal is to ensure that his children will be able to stay in school through college.

loans.use: increase production in his business raising chickens by buying chicks, feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Angelo

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Zavala Província de Inhambane tem 59 anos de idade vive maritalmente pai de 4 filhos maiores de idade responsabiliza-se pelo seu neto e uma sobrinha que vivem em sua casa. 
É proprietário de um estabelecimento comercial a mais de 9 anos ganha um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa e no seu negócio. Com o empréstimo solicitado pretende aumentar o volume do seu negocio adquirindo produtos da primeira necessidade como: feijão, arroz, açúcar, amendoim e outros que forem necessários. Este é o seu 7º empréstimo na hluvuku.
Futuramente pretende melhorar o seu estabelecimento comercial ampliando para satisfazer as necessidades dos clientes e construir dependências para aluguer. O seu principal desafio é  adquirir uma viatura para  transportar a sua mercadoria.
texts.en:
Angelo was born in Zavala, in the Inhambane province of Mozambique. He is 59 years old and is married with 4 grown children. He also helps care for his niece and a grandson, both of whom live in his house.

For more than nine years Angelo has owned a store that allows him to earn money that he uses to cover household expenses and run the business.  With this loan he would like to increase sales by buying everyday staples such as rice, beans, sugar, peanuts and other products as necessary. This is his seventh loan with Hluvuku [Kiva Field Partner].

In the future, Angelo would like to improve his business by expanding, in order to better satisfy his customers' needs, and to build outbuildings on his property to rent. His main goal is to buy a vehicle he can use to transport his merchandise.

loans.use: increase sales by buying everyday staples such as rice, beans, sugar, peanuts and other products as necessary.

loans.name: Corcino

texts.es:
Corcino es un hombre de 44 años de edad, vive con su pareja, padre de 6 hijos de 21,17, 13, 10, 6, 4 años y una hija de 15 años, y su negocio es la agricultura.
Él es independiente, paciente, responsable, comprensivo, fuerte, luchador y muy trabajador. Su trabajo lo desarrolla en ‘Villa Tunari’ que se encuentra ubicado entre los andes y la Amazonía, este territorio ofrece increíbles paisajes, provistos de una exuberante vegetación y una hidrografía abundante en ríos, arroyos, caídas de agua y pozas naturales.
Corcino es de tez morena, estatura mediana, cabello corto negro, complexión delgada, su lengua materna es el quechua y habla un poco de español. Su negocio es el cultivo de la tierra, él se dedica a sembrar y cosechar frutas y verduras de temporada, como; lechuga, tomate, ají, habas, etc. Su trabajo lo realiza junto a su pareja y ya llevan más de 20 años en el negocio, todos sus hijos estudian en la escuela de villa Tunari y también colaboran con el trabajo de la tierra.
El sueño de su vida es poder brindar un hogar estable y seguro para su familia, realizando la instalación de agua en su domicilio.
Es por esos motivos que Corcino solicita un préstamo para la instalación de agua en su casa y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Corcino is 44 years old. He lives with his partner and has six sons aged 21, 17, 13, 10, 6 and 4, and a daughter, who is 15. Corcino works in agriculture.

Corcino is a patient, responsible, understanding, strong, hardworking and independent person. He works in “Villa Tunari”, which is located between the Andes and the Amazon region. This area has amazing landscapes, lush vegetation and plenty of water: rivers, creeks, waterfalls and ponds.

Corcino is of medium height, thin, dark-skinned, and has short black hair. His native tongue is Quechua, but he speaks a little Spanish. He works in agriculture, growing seasonal fruits and vegetables such as lettuce, tomato, chili and beans. He has been working together with his partner for more than twenty years. His children study at the local school and also contribute with their work.

He dreams of being able to give his family a stable and safe home. He wants to connect his house to the water distribution system. This is why he is requesting a loan to perform the necessary works and improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to have running water in his home.

loans.name: Camilo

texts.en:
This is Camilo. He previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that he utilized to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in his business. His earnings were a big help in their personal, house hold and business expenditures.

He would like to apply for another 22,000 PHP loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to his inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain their daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Camilo hopes to prosper more in his business. He dreams to give his children a better future through all his hard work. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God he studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in his business.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 62 years old and married with three children.  She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Norma requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been in pig fattening for five years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Norma would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Maria Marieta

texts.en:
Maria Marieta has been a really busy entrepreneur for many years. She is managing and operating a food vending business, a variety store and rooms for rent in her village, earning well for her family. Maria Marieta used the income from her previous loan to buy the raw ingredients for her food stall and she successfully repaid her loan. 

Maria Marieta is now requesting a new loan to purchase more groceries to sell, and this time amounting to PHP 14,000. She will use her loan to improve her sales and her additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family. Maria Marieta appears here in a photo with her variety store and food stall.

Maria Marieta hopes to grow her business as well as improve the living conditions of her family and give her children better education. She meets up with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Cherlyn

texts.en:
In 2012, Cherlyn learned about Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. Cherlyn tried her luck on doing a business focusing on her farming activities. She feels she owes her fortune to the cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as capital. 

Cherlyn borrowed another amount to pay for seedlings and compost. This will help give her farming income a big boost. She looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and compost.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 46 years old and married with four children. With two children in school, Gina works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy-and-sell bicycle materials business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for her buy and sell business.

Gina has been in this business for one year. 

In the future, Gina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her buy and sell business.

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby is 58 years old and married with four children. With one child still in school, Ruby works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items such as canned goods, soft-drinks, coffee, cereals, sanitary pads, etc. to sell.

Ruby has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft-drinks, coffee, cereals, sanitary pads, etc. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items such as canned goods, soft-drinks, coffee, cereals, sanitary pads, etc. to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia works hard to support her family. Virginia is married and has a furniture making business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years now.

Virginia requested a PHP 60,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more materials like wood, nails, etc. for her business.

Virginia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more materials like wood, nails, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Lillian

texts.en:
Lillian is a single mother who lives in Ruharo, with her five children, all in school. Her husband deserted her many years ago and she has been struggling to keep afloat and take care of her children. She operates a retail shop in the outskirts of Mbarara town in which she sells some childrenswear as well as other daily hosuehold use items like sugar, toothpaste, body jelly among other items. 

She used her previous loan to buy more items for selling to her customers. The previous loan enabled her to make a major milestone and she is confident she will make more profit with this loan. She will also use a portion of it to clear the balance on tuition for her children. She thanks Kiva lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to increase the working capital of her childrenswear business and to pay tuition.

loans.name: Celestino

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Zavala Província de Inhambane tem 27 anos de idade, vive maritalmente pai de 2 filhos menores de idade apenas 1 frequenta a escola responsabiliza-se pela sua cunhada que vive em sua casa.
Trabalha no Município como Agente de Serviço a mais de 5 anos onde aufere um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa. Com empréstimo solicitado pretende dar continuidade a sua obra de residência adquirindo material de construção como: areia, cimento e varões. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo na Hluvuku.
Futuramente pretende terminar  a sua obra de residência e continuar com os  estudos.
texts.en:
Celestino was born in Zavala, in the Inhambane province of Mozambique. He is 27 years old and is married with two young children, one of whom is in school. He also helps to support his sister-in-law, who lives with his family.

For more than five years, Celestino has worked as a administrative assistant for the city government, earning money that he uses to cover household expenses. With this loan he would like to continue with his home construction project by buying materials like sand, cement, and poles. This is his second loan with Hluvuku [Kiva Field Partner].

In the future, he would like to finish the construction project and continue with his schooling.

loans.use: buy construction materials like sand, cement, and poles.

loans.name: Magdalina

texts.en:
Magdalina raises pigs at her own backyard. This is what she does to earn a living. She is 66 years old, married and lives at Ozamiz City, Philippines. Through Paglaum PC she obtained the capital to purchase her original piglets and feed. 

Now she requests a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy additional feed. She really hopes and prays that her business will grow and benefit her family, in addition to the income of her husband. Someday, she wants to build a concrete pig cage to easily keep more sanitary conditions.

loans.use: To buy additional bags of feeds.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a strong-willed woman who pushes her ability when it comes to her piggery business. She is a hands-on businesswoman and mother who never gets too tired to support her family. 

Recently, she availed a loan to purchase bags of animal feeds. Aside from her project of concreting the pig pens, she thought of adding heads of pigs for commercial sale. Someday she hopes to open a meat shop in a nearby town.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feeds.

loans.name: Noraina

texts.en:
Noraina is 49 years old and lives in Guipos, ZDS. She is married and has three children.                               

Noraina has a shop that sells rice and assorted groceries. She has had this business for 10 years. 

She requested a loan to buy 10 sacks of rice and assorted groceries.                                                

Noraina has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Noraina hopes to avail bigger size loans to have more stock in her business.

loans.use: to buy 10 sacks of rice and assorted groceries.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
She is Helen, 42, a resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. She is married to Renan, a boatman, and they have four children. Two are in high school and the other two are in elementary level.

She manages her household while operating the business. She works hard to augment their income to meet her family’s daily personal and household needs. 

Helen operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages to the local neighborhood. She also sells frozen processed foods like processed sweetened marinated pork, hot dogs, "longanisa" (wrapped ground marinated meat). She also sells fresh pork meat for added income. Filipinos love to buy these frozen marinated foods for their sweet and garlic taste and they are easily cooked. Her regular customers are her neighbors, friends and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business and increase her sales, she is requesting a PHP 40,000 loan that she will use to buy additional quantities of frozen foods and other grocery items. She is positive she will get a good return on her investment. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. Her earnings from her store are their source of income to send her children to school and meet their daily needs.

Helen hopes to be able to grow her business so she could send all her children to college. She values unity and love in her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for processed foods, rice and other grocery items to sell at her general store.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia lives in Balamban, Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur, and supports her three daughters by building houses from the ground up. She has successfully repaid her whole loan after which she availed herself of another one to buy building materials and paints, and to pay her workers. 

She wants her daughters to get an education and escape the life of backbreaking work she has had to endure.

loans.use: to buy building materials and paints, and pay her workers

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is married with four children. Corazon is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines.                       

Corazon is a farmer and grows palay (rice) crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She requested a loan to pay for 10 sacks of fertilizer and chemicals.                                                      

Corazon has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Corazon hopes to harvest more palay crops.

loans.use: to pay for 10 sacks of fertilizer and chemicals

loans.name: Annalie

texts.en:
Annalie is 35 years old. She is known in the Balamban Mahayag, ZDS, area for her sari-sari (variety) store. She is actively participating in the various programs and services that the co-op offers. 

She hopes to live comfortably, with a decent house, for which she applied for a loan to purchase plywood, nails and sticks. She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing, with a good repayment record. It matters that she has been given a priority as a microfinance member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). This is what she is thankful for, when all her financing needs of her retailing business are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails and sticks for her house.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan, 51 years old, lives in Balamban, Mahayag, ZDS, with her husband and three children. Her husband is a construction worker. Unable to sustain the needs of the family with only her husband’s income, she has found ways to attain income through snack and food vending. It began with selling a small amount of viands and snacks to their neighbors. 

She joined Paglaum Cooperative, which helped her in the capitalization of her sari-sari (small grocery) store in January of 2004. She became a MIGS (member in good standing) member, which is why she has received loans several times already. Now, she applies for 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy merchandise for her sari-sari store. She hopes that her business will continue and someday become a mini-grocery.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her sari-sari (variety) store

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en: Corazon has always dreamed of opening her own flower shop business to support her four children. She used her loan to buy fertilizers for the flower business. She is now on her way to repaying the loan with her new profits.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her flower business.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
In 2012, Lorna learned about Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. Lorna tried her luck on doing a business focusing on her farming activities. She feels she owes her fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as capital. 

Lorna borrowed another amount to pay for seedlings and compost. This will help her farming income have a big boost. Lorna looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and compost

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Namaacha Província de Maputo tem 31 anos de idade vive maritalmente pai de 2 filhos menores de idade todos frequentam a escola, responsabiliza-se pelos seus pais que vivem em Namaacha. 
Trabalha no Conselho Municipal  como Técnico de Administração a mais de 5 anos aufere um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa. Com o valor solicitado pretende dar continuidade a sua obra de residência adquirindo material de construção como areia, cimento, blocos e pedras. Este é o seu 6º empréstimo na hluvuku.
Futuramente pretende terminar a sua obra de residência e dar continuidade com os seus estudos até ao nível superior
texts.en:
Ernesto was born in Namaacha, in the Maputo province of Mozambique. He is 31 years old and is married with 2 children, both of whom are in school. He also helps to support his parents, who live in Namaacha, financially.

For more than five years, Ernesto has worked as an administrative technician for the city government, earning money that he uses to cover household expenses. With this loan he would like to continue with a home construction project by buying construction materials like sand, blocks, cement, and stones. This is his sixth loan with Hluvuku [Kiva Field Partner].

In the future, Ernesto would like to finish the construction project and go back to school to study through college.

loans.use: buy construction materials like sand, blocks, cement, and stones.

loans.name: Xenia

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Namaacha Província de Maputo tem 39 anos de idade vive maritalmente, mãe de 5 filhos, apenas 1 maior de idade todos frequentam a escola e não responsabiliza-se por ninguém.
Trabalha no Colégio Maria Auxiliadora como Costureira a mais de 10 anos onde aufere um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa. Com empréstimo solicitado pretende concluir a sua obra de residência adquirindo chapas de zinco. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo na Hluvuku.
Futuramente pretende terminar a sua obra e realizar o matrimónio.
texts.en:
Xenia was born in Namaacha, in the Maputo province of Mozambique. She is 39 years old and lives with her common-law husband and five children. One of her children is already an adult, but all of them are still in school. She is not financially responsible for anyone outside her family.

For more than ten years, Xenia has worked as a dressmaker for a school, earning money that she uses to cover household expenses. With this loan she would like to finish her home construction project by buying zinc plates. This is her first loan with Hluvuku [Kiva Field Partner].

In the future, Xenia would like to finish the construction project and get married officially.

loans.use: finish her home construction project by buying zinc plates.

loans.name: Alonzo De Mendoza Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ALOZO DE MENDOZA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Vicenta es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de coca por mayor, venta de turriles, venta de tenis, servicio de construcción, venta de comida, venta de CD’s.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Vicenta es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de coca; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace diez años. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de coca por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es soltera y tiene cuatro hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y los ahorros que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Alozo de Mendoza communal bank will begin its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Senkata regional center.  It is comprised of nine members and led by a board of directors.  Vicenta is the president.  The businesses that the members carry out are varied and include selling coca wholesale, selling barrels, selling tennis shoes, construction services, selling food, and selling CD’s.

The loan that they will take out will benefit small businesswomen where Vicenta is a member.  She says that this is her first time as a member of Pro Mujer.  She joined by invitation from a friend, a client of the institution.

She now has a business selling coca.  She says that she learned this business ten years ago.  The loan she will now take out is to buy coca wholesale.  She will get it from the wholesale vendors in the city of La Paz.  She will later sell it at the location where she sells.  This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family.  She is single and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the health services and the savings that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy coca wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to  buy contruction materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed and more pigs to expand her business.

loans.name: Laureta

texts.en:
Laureta is 55 years old and lives in Balintawak, Pagadian City. She is widowed with three children.                      

Laureta has a shop that sells canned goods and assorted groceries. She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan to pay for assorted groceries.                                                                 

Laureta has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business through the help of Paglaum Cooperative.

loans.use: to pay for assorted groceries.

loans.name: Luz Mery

texts.es:
Luz es una reconocida estilista del sector que a base de trabajo y esfuerzo saco su salón y lo fue adaptando para convertirlo en algo bello su fuente de inspiración y ganas de trabajar la saca diariamente de sus dos hijas de 19 y 10 años de edad las cuales crió, protegió y les brindo estudio con la ayuda de su salón.
 Ella ama su trabajo, le gusta hacer que otras personas luzcan hermosas, pues su sonrisa y su gratitud la hacen sentir la flor más bella y admirada del jardín. 
Hoy en día quiere solicitar un crédito con la intención de comprar una silla nueva, ya que la existente es muy vieja y requiere un cambio, también comprara surtido en productos de belleza para comercializar en su salón. 
Sueña con poder comprar una casa y darle estudio profesional a sus hijas y seguir siendo una familia unificada.
texts.en:
Luz is a well-known stylist in her area and due to her hard work she was able to open a beauty salon and remodel it to create a beautiful space. She draws her inspiration and her strong work ethic from her two daughters, ages 10 and 19, who she has raised, protected and provided with an education thanks to her salon.

Luz loves her work, she loves making other people look beautiful, because their smiles and their gratitude make her feel like the most beautiful and admired flower in the garden.

Today she is asking for a loan to buy a new chair for her salon, because her current one is very old and needs to be replaced. She also wants to buy a variety of beauty products to sell in the salon.

Luz dreams of buying a house and allowing her children to stay in school in order to learn a profession, and she also wants to continue to have a close-knit family.

loans.use: buy a new chair and a variety of products for her beauty salon, in order to work towards her dream of buying a house and keeping her children in school.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is married with six children. She is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines.                                                                                                    

Maria is a farmer and grows palay crop to earn a living. She has requested a loan to pay for six sacks of fertilizer.                                                                                                     

Maria has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, she hopes to harvest more palay crop.

loans.use: to pay for six sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario is 55 years old and lives in Dicoloc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is married with three children now at their school age. 

Mario is engaged in operating a single-sitter motorcycle-for-hire business, and also a hog fattening and hog raising activity for three years already. He earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month from doing this type of work. 

He has requested a loan to purchase ten sacks of booster feed and three sacks of lactating mash for his hog fattening and raising business. 

Mario has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, he hopes to build additional cages for his existing hog fattening business.

loans.use: to purchase ten sacks of booster feed and three sacks of lactating mash.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her as she was able to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Thelma still hopes to have more patrons and she wants for her family to be always free from any sickness. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Ronward

texts.en:
Ronward is a 33-year-old resident of Cavite, Philippines and he is married to Beverly. They manage their household while operating the business. The couple is working hard to provide income for their everyday needs and for their children.

Ronward maintains a direct selling business. He sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customers order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing on as their income. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community.  He earns a minimum of PHP 1500 in sales every week.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products needed in his business. 

Ronward dreams that his business will continue to operate and grow for he hopes to give his children a good life and quality education. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase pigs and supplies to make her homemade dishes to sell in the market.

loans.name: Lagemtaaba Iii Granghin Group

texts.fr:
Mr Joanny est le représentant du groupe LAGEMTAABA III GRANGHIN. Il se porte très bien. Marié, il est père de 05 enfants, le plus âgé a 16 ans et le moins âgé a 05 ans. 04 vont à l’école. Il a 2 personnes en charge
Monsieur est jardinier depuis 05 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants. Ses clients proviennent des villes voisines.
Il  veut s’acheter 05 sacs d’engrais et 10 rouleaux de grillage.
Mr Joanny veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour accroitre  son activité et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Joanny is the representative of the Lagemtaaba III Granghin group. He is doing well. He is married and the father of five children ranging from 16 to five years of age. Four of his children attend school. He has two [additional] dependents. For five years, Mr. Joanny has been growing vegetables. He stocks up  at the local markets. His customers come from the nearby towns. He would like to buy five bags of fertilizers and 10 rolls of wire mesh.
He would like to use his profits for expanding his business and improving his family’s life conditions.

loans.use: to buy five bags of fertilizers and 10 rolls of wire mesh.

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PRIMAVERA iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Daniela es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de dulces, servicio de internet, venta de pantalones, servicio de transporte, tejido de mantas, venta de fertilizantes agrícolas, venta de tunta y chuño.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Daniela es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de regalos para fiesta; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años por recomendación de su madre, quien le incentivo a la apertura de este negocio. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de utensilios por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la facilidad del área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "Primavera" (Spring) lending group is in its fifth cycle in Pro Mujer as part of it's Santiago II regional office.  The group is made up of eight members and it is led by board of directors of which Daniela is the president.  The members are involved in a variety of businesses including: candy sales, internet services, pants sales, transportation services, blanket sales, fertilizer sales, and freeze-dried potato sales.  

The loan that they are seeking will help small businesses of the group members.  Daniela states that she joined Pro Mujer a year ago, after having been invited by a friend who is a client of the institution.  Currently, she has a business selling party favors.  She started this business a few years ago based on her mother's advice.

The loan that they are seeking with help her purchase equipment in bulk that she will purchase from wholesalers in the city of La Paz, and later resell in her store.  This line of work allows her to earn an income with which to support her family financially as she is married and has two children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she states that she likes the healthcare facility offered by the institution.

loans.use: purchase equipment in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy maize and peanuts for resale.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Daisy works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and a pig fattening business. Daisy is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF in order to buy more items such as snack foods, canned goods, and other groceries.

Daisy has been sustaining her business activities through her past 25 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items such as snack foods, canned goods, and other groceries.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Rosita works hard to support her family.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Rosita is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Rosita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cereals for resale.

loans.name: Juan Estheban

texts.es:
Juan es un joven soltero de 22 años, tiene muchos deseos de superación y trabaja como recepcionista en un Hospedaje en su ciudad natal, Ica. También, con los ingresos que obtiene por su gran trabajo está estudiando una profesión. Sabe que estudiar y trabajar es un poco duro, pero está más que contento con este desafío porque quiere convertirse en un gran profesional.
Debido al gran deseo que tiene de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, Juan va a comprar una nueva cocina para su mamá para reemplazar la que tiene que ya está en malas condiciones. Está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva por su generosidad porque con esto su familia vivirá de manera más segura. Más adelante espera abrir su propio negocio para seguir apoyando a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan, age 22, wants very much to excel in life. 

He works as a receptionist in a hotel in his native city of Ica, and with the money that he earns through his hard work he is studying a profession.  He knows that studying and working is difficult, but he is more than happy to take on this challenge, as he wants to become a great professional.

Owing to his desire to improve his family’s quality of life, Juan is going to purchase a new stove for his mother in order to replace the one that she has, which is in very bad condition.

He is very grateful to the Kiva lenders for their generosity, because through it, his family will live more securely. 

In the future he hopes to open his own business in order to keep supporting his family.

loans.use: to purchase a new stove for his house.

loans.name: Las Intocables Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS INTOCABLES” iniciará el trigésimo primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Tejada, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Martha es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: servicio de internet, venta de víveres, venta de celulares, venta de mantas, servicio de internet, venta de mantas, venta de cosméticos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Martha es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de elaboración de embutidos; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años aprendiendo el negocio de su familia, que trabajaba con ese producto, cuando se casa emprende un negocio independiente con un capital pequeño y con el apoyo de su esposo.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de carne por mayor) que adquirirá de los vendedoras mayoristas de las comunidades del Departamento de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar económicamente a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones y el área de salud que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “LAS INTOCABLES” communal bank is starting their thirtieth cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Villa Tejada regional office. It is made up of 8 members lead by a board of directors with Martha serving as the treasurer. The businesses of the members of the communal bank are varied amongst them are: internet services, selling food, selling cellphones, selling blankets and selling cosmetics.

The loan they are taking will help all these micro-entrepreneurs, Martha being one. She says that she joined Pro Mujer 5 years ago on the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. The business that she has is making sausages. She learned how to do this a number of years ago learning the family business which worked with this product. When she got married she started her own business with a small amount of capital and the help of her husband.

The loan she is now requesting is to increase her capital (buying meat wholesale) that she will acquire at the wholesale vendors in the communities of the Department of La Paz. Then she will make and sell them in her sales space. Working in this way allows her to generate resources to economically support her family as she is married and has two children. When asked what she liked about Pro Mujer she replied that she liked the training and the health services that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy meat wholesale.

loans.name: Ciro Alfonso

texts.es:
El señor Ciro un hombre independiente pero solitario trabaja en la venta de productos de catálogo como lo son productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumes, chocolates, ropa, etc. 

La profesión la ejerce hace dos años y es que encontró las ventajas de ser independiente y que genera más ingresos pues al estar solo no tiene una persona lo ayude con los gastos y todo corre por cuenta de él.

Solicita un crédito para la compra de mercancía ya que así podrá tener una mejor utilidad que le ayudara para los gastos

Su sueño es poder tener una persona con quien compartir apoyarse en los momentos difíciles con quien envejecer y disfrutar de una tranquila vida.
texts.en:
Ciro is an independent and single man who works selling catalog products such as beauty products, cosmetics, chocolates, clothing, etc.  He has worked in this field for two years because he enjoys the benefits of working independently, and earns a greater income, which he needs since her does not have anyone to help him with his expenses.  

He is seeking a loan to purchase merchandise because it will allow him to generate greater revenue to help with his expenses.  His dream is to have a person with whom he can share and support one another in difficult time, as well as grow old together and enjoy a relaxed life.

loans.use: purchase products from a catalog.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a large amount of sweet potatoes to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Esleidi Marilin

texts.es:
Ella es Esleidi, una mujer de carácter y buena voluntad, con deseos de progresar y salir adelante con su esposo y su hijo de 9 años.

Ella se decidió por iniciar su negocio de preparación y venta de comidas rápidas y bebidas desde hace aproximadamente 2 años en un pequeño puesto de comidas con muchas ganas y empuje. 

Este oficio lo aprendió trabajando en muchos restaurantes en meses pasados y esto le permitió obtener gran experiencia.

Hoy en día desea darle un pequeño impulso a su negocio, por esta razón requiere un préstamo para comprar surtido de insumos e ingredientes para capitalizar su negocio y mejorar sus ventas.

Es una mujer que asume retos y los enfrenta con valentía por su familia.
texts.en:
Esleidi is a woman of character and goodwill, with dreams of succeeding and getting ahead with her husband and nine-year old son.  Two years ago, with a lot of enthusiasm and effort, she decided to start a business preparing and selling fast food and beverages in a small food stall.  She learned this trade by working in many restaurants in the past, which allowed her to gain a lot of experience.  

She now wants to give her business a boost, which is why she is seeking a loan to purchase an assortment of supplies and ingredients to stock her business and improve her sales.  She is a woman who takes on challenges and faces them bravely for her family.

loans.use: purchase an assortment of supplies and ingredients to stock her business and improve her sales.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DANAYA est constitué de  5 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles  élargies dans le quartier  DIALANIKORO de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 1er prêt. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  chaussures à l’image de FANTA qui est la 1ère femme assise devant dans la photo. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 10 paires de chaussures pour hommes, 20 paires de chaussures pour femmes et 10 paires de chaussures pour enfants  avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Danaya group is composed of five married women averaging 45 years of age, with four children. They live in traditional extended families in the Dialanikoro region of the town of Bougoni. They know each other as neighbors or friends as well as through their work. In order to bolster their financing and better manage their businesses, they have joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution and are now on their first loan. 

This group of women sells shoes, which is the case of Fanta, for example. She is the first one seated in front in the photo. With this loan, she plans to buy 10 pairs of men’s shoes, 20 pairs of women’s shoes and 10 pairs of children’s shoes from wholesalers in Bougoni. She sells retail at the market and out of her home, for cash and on credit, to a mixed clientele.
She plans to earn an average monthly revenue of 15,000 West African francs, which will be used to invest in her business and repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
This is Emily, 52, a resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. She is married to Renato, a fisherman, and has four children.  She manages her own household while operating the business. She works to augment their income to meet her family’s daily personal and household needs. 

Emily operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a general store store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighbors. It is the place to go buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by  buying supplies at wholesale prices, and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. She serves within the local community. Emily earns a minimum of Php 2000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business and increase her sales, she is requesting a Php 20,000 loan which she will use to buy sacks of rice, sugar, gasoline, biscuits, instant noodles and beverages to add to her product inventory.  She is positive that her sales and income will increase as she expands her business. 

Emily hopes to be able to grow her business. She dreams of a more comfortable and better life in the future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, beverages, and toiletries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase recycled materials to recuperate his business a little, which will give him the minimum income needed to sustain his family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase agricultural supplies to care for her crops and coffee plant nursery.

loans.name: Tahmina

texts.ru: Тахмина родилась в 1996 году. Она трудолюбивая и жизнерадостная девушка. Она не замужем и живет с родителями. Тахмина окончила среднюю школу успешно и поступила в университет. Она студентка первого курса. Тахмина учится упорно и регулярно посещает библиотеку. Она хочет получить хорошее образование и в будущем стать высококвалифицированным специалистом. Она должна оплатить за учебный договор, но ее родители не имеют денег. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 900 долларов США для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Tahmina was born in 1996. She is a hard-working and optimistic young woman. She is single and lives with her parents. Tahmina has graduated from high school with good grades and was admitted to the university. She is in her first year of study. Tahmina studies hard and regularly visits the library. She would like to obtain good education and become a highly qualified professional in the future. She needs to pay for her tuition, but her parents lack the funds for this. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 900 USD to pay for her tuition. She is counting on your kindness and hoping for your compassion.

loans.use: to pay for tuition.

loans.name: Kankele Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe KANKELE est constitué de  4 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 55 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles  élargies dans le quartier  DOUGOUNINA de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 10ème prêt. Les 9 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  céréales à l’image de YAMA qui est la 1ère femme debout dans la photo de la gauche vers la droite. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 500kg de maîs et 400kg de mil avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The group KANKELE is composed of four married women, who average 55 years of age and five children each. The women live in traditional extended families in the DOUGOUNINA district of Bougouni City. They know one another through ties of community, friendship, and commerce. To bolster their financing capacity for better commerce, they joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their 10th loan with it. The 9 previous loans were correctly paid back. 
 
This group of women does commerce in grains, just like YAMA, who is the woman standing first from the left in the photo. With her loan, she intends to purchase 500 kg of corn and 400 kg of millet from wholesalers in Bougouni. She makes her sales retail to a mixed customer base paying with cash at the market and at her home.

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 30,000 francs CFA that will be invested in her business and used to pay back the loan.

loans.use: to purchase grains

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Zohran

texts.en:
Zohran, age 42, is a widow. After the death of her husband it was very difficult for her to run her household activities. It compelled her to initiate her business manufacturing “waan” (which is a material used in making a bedstead of woven webbing or hemp stretched on a wooden frame on four legs, common in Pakistan). 

She operates the machine at home and over the time, she has become famous in providing good quality waan material in her community. In this way, she is able to manage the needs of her family members. 

She requires improving her business, so she applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy another waan-making machine to provide good quality material in her town. She dreams of spending her income on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy another waan-making machine (which is a material used in making a bedstead of woven webbing or hemp stretched on a wooden frame on four legs, common in Pakistan).

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJEKAFO est constitué de  9 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles  élargies dans le quartier  TORAKABOUGOU de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 1er prêt. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  condiments à l’image de DJENEBA qui est la 1ère femme  debout dans la photo de la gauche vers la droite. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 10 sacs de sel iodé, 2 cartons de pattes de tomates et diverses qualités de condiments avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The group DJEKAFO is composed of nine married women, who average 45 years of age and five children each. The women live in traditional extended families in the TORAKABOUGOU district of Bougouni City. They know one another through ties of community, friendship, and commerce. To bolster their financing capacity for better commerce, they joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their first loan with it. 
 
This group of women does commerce in condiments, as does DJENEBA, who is the woman standing first from the left in the photo. With her loan, she intends to purchase 10 bags of iodized salt,  2 boxes of tomato paste, and various qualities of condiments from wholesalers in Bougouni. She makes her sales retail to a mixed customer base paying with cash or credit at the market and at her home.

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 15,000 francs CFA that will be invested in her business and used to pay back the loan.

loans.use: to purchase condiments, such as salt and tomato paste

loans.name: Ngailut Group

texts.en:
Kimjahat is a 36-year-old homemaker. Her family includes her husband, son, daughter, and her grandmother. Her daily activities include cooking, dropping off and picking up her children at school, looking after her sick grandmother, and other household activities. Her husband is the village chief, and they sustain their family from the village business he does. 

The area they live in has a shortage of power supply. Mostly, their household business is performed in the evenings under candlelight due to frequent power cuts. Sometimes they have to bear the power cut for more than three consecutive days, which disturbs their daily activities. Her husband being the village chief, meetings are frequently held in the evenings at their house by village elders to discuss matters related to their village. Most of the villagers are employed in agricultural work and have spare time only in the evenings; therefore, they hold the meetings in the evenings. 

At the same time, the children study under the dim light. Their mother serves the village elders in meetings, and at the same time teaches her children their lessons and also takes care of her grandmother. This makes it very uncomfortable for her under the dim light. In order to overcome all these difficulties, she wanted to avail herself of the mini solar loan so that she could do the household chores comfortably under the solar light and let her children study in a better environment after sunset. 

After accessing the solar loan, she performs household chores swiftly, and her sick grandmother also stays in a comfortable home environment. Also, the children get to study in a brighter room with better concentration. She thanks WSDS and Kiva for the loan, which brought changes to their lives.

loans.use: to buy a mini solar home lighting system.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks and re-bar.

loans.name: Yeredon Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe YEREDON ont en moyenne 35 ans,4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à YANGASSO/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des habits, des condiments et des produits divers.  Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe YEREDON sont à leur 3èmeprêt solidaire. ALIMA, 2ème femme de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10Kgs de lait en poudre, 5 boîtes de lait concentré, 20Kgs de sucre, 1 carton de savon, 15Litres d’huile et 5 paquets de bonbon.Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes.Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 25 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the group YEREDON average 35 years of age and four children each, all living in traditional extended families in YANGASSO/SEGOU (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). These women know one another through ties of kinship, and they have businesses buying and selling clothing, condiments, and a variety of goods. After having correctly paid back their previous loans, the women of the group YEREDON are now on their third solidarity loan. 

ALIMA, the woman second from the left in the photo, intends to use her loan to purchase 10 kg of powdered milk, 5 boxes of condensed milk, 20 kg of sugar, 1 box of soap, 15 liters of oil, and 5 packets of candies. She gets her supplies locally from wholesalers. She makes her sales to men and women customers paying with cash and often credit. 

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 25,000 francs CFA that will be used to cover expenses related to healthcare, food, clothing, and schooling costs. The rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of goods to resell

loans.name: Sadokat

texts.ru:
Эту женщину зовут Садокат, что в переводе с таджикского значение ее имени означает верность, преданность, искренность. Безусловно Садокат свойственны эти черты характера. Она верная жена, преданная своему Родину и долгу, и искренняя женщина. 
Садокат в августе этого года исполнилось 26 лет. У нее двое детей в возрасте 5 и 3 лет. Ее муж по сезонам ездит в Россию на заработки и сейчас он находится там. Сама Садокат как и многие жители ее сельского района Спитамен занимается сельским хозяйством и одновременно ведет животноводство. Она начала разводить скотов два года назад, чтобы приобрести дополнительный источник дохода. Сейчас она предает этому своему бизнесу особое значение. Садокат хочет расширить его. Она берет кредит для купли еще одного крупнорогатого скота, чтобы увеличить их поголовье. Она нуждается в финансовой поддержке.
texts.en:
This woman’s name is Sadokat. In Tajik, her name means faithfulness, loyalty, sincerity. Without a doubt, Sadokat displays all these character traits. She is a faithful wife, loyal to her country and her duty, and a sincere person.

In August of this year, Sadokat turned 26. She has two children, five and three years of age. Her husband is a seasonal worker in Russia, which is where he is now. As to Sadokat, as many inhabitants of her rural region, Spitamen, she grows farm produce and at the same time raises livestock. She started raising livestock two years ago as an additional source of income. At present she is particularly focused  on this business and would like to expand it. She is taking out a loan to buy an additional head of cattle to increase her headcount. She needs your financial support.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Sakeena

texts.en:
44-year-old Sakeena deals in selling animals with the support of her husband. She looks after the cattle and is responsible for feeding them, while her husband sells them to different markets in the city. Their business is providing them with enough income to support their family. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. 

However, she needs to earn much more to meet their different expenditures such as utility bills and food expenses. In order to expand their earnings, Sakeena has requested a loan amount of 30,000 PKR to buy more cattle for resale purposes. She is hopeful that expanding the business will help in improving her family’s living standards. She is in her 3rd loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy more cattle.

loans.name: Najma

texts.en:
Najma is a 42-year-old married woman who has three children. She is a vigorous lady, and for the past 20 years has been running a cloth purchase and sale business. She buys cloth in various fabrics and in different colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates, and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. 

Now, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan. She expects a boost in her earnings with the loan, and she plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs

loans.name: Nieta Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe NIETA est constitué de  10 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles  élargies à MASSABILA, un village de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 1er prêt. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  condiments à l’image de SARAN qui est la 2ème femme debout dans la photo de la gauche vers la droite. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 10sacs de sel iodé, 1 cartons de concentrée de tomates et 50 kg de poudre de gombo avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Nieta Group is made up of ten women who are married and are, on average, 35 years old and have 4 children. They live in traditional families established in MASSABILA, a village in Bougouni. They were neighbours, friends or colleages when they all met. 

To strengthen their economic capacities in order to do better trade, they joined the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso, from whom they have received their first loan. This group of women sells food ingredients. 

Saran, who is the second woman from the left, standing in the photo, plans to use her loan to buy 10 bags of iodine salt, one box of tomato concentrate and 50kg of gombo powder, from wholesalers in Bougouni. She sells her merchandise at the market and from home, for cash or on credit to a varied clientele. 

Saran hopes to make an average monthly profit of 25.000 francs CFA, which will be invested in her business and used to pay back the loan.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients for resale.

loans.name: Liliana Patricia

texts.es:
Liliana es una vendedora ambulante lleva más de 10 años de experiencia en la venta de mercancía como lo es ropa, electrodomésticos y accesorios se le mide a todo reto que tenga por delante y no parara hasta superarlo. 

Hoy en día tiene la mentalidad de montar su propio negocio y dejar de ser ambulantes pues no solo se expone a riesgos de robo de mercancía si no que el desgaste es mucho por eso quiere solicitar un crédito el cual invertirá en la compra de mercancía, desde ropa, accesorios y electrodomésticos buscando ingresos para ir formando su idea de negocio y tener su local propio.
texts.en: Liliana is an itinerant vendor who has more than 10 years experience in selling merchandise like clothing appliances and accessories. She has meet every challenge that she has faced and hasn't stopped until she has overcome it. Today she has it in her mind to open her own business and to quit selling itinerantly. Then she would not expose herself to the risk of getting her merchandise stolen and there is a lot of wear and tear. So she is requesting a loan to invest in buying merchandise like clothing, appliances and accessories looking for income to formulate her idea of a business and have her own store.

loans.use: to buy appliances, clothing and accessories.

loans.name: Ram Keshari

texts.en:
Ram Keshari is 28 years old. She is married and has one child who is three. Many year ago, she established her vegetable farming business. Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid two loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy seeds and fertilizer for her business. In the future, Ram Keshari plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal) and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seeds and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Sunita

texts.en:
Sunita is 31 years old. She is married and has one child who is seven. Many years ago, she established her business selling cow milk. Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid three loans from Patan BPW, and she used her most recent loan to buy a young milk-giving cow. In the future, Sunita plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal. Cows are never raised for beef, but for their milk from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made. Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking. On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day. In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about USD 0.51. In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction and as fuel for fires, and which can be captured in methane storage tanks. The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over.

loans.use: to buy a young cow

loans.name: Tari Mai

texts.en:
Tari Mai is 40 years old. She is married and has one child who is 18. Many years ago, she established her business making statues. Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid seven loans from Patan BPW, and she used her most recent loan to buy raw materials for her business. In the future, Tari Mai plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

Nepal has a long and rich history of traditional handicrafts. Throughout the Kathmandu Valley, skilled artisans produce unique pieces of art that reflect Nepal's cultural diversity. Terra cotta pottery comes from the red clay of the surrounding Himalayan foothills. Bronze and silver statuettes are formed using wax molds and intricate hand tool finishing. In Patan, Newari culture and traditions are reflected in the images and symbols etched into metal or formed in stone. With the help of a Kiva loan, Nepal's artisans are able to purchase raw materials in greater volume. This increase in volume allows a single artisan to work on several pieces at the same time while increasing her profit margin.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her business

loans.name: Obenkina 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe OBENKINA 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à SANKINEKAN, un des villages de la commune de KAVA cercle de SAN de la  4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur 5ème prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : l’arachide avec MAIMOUNA , 2ème femme debout de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir : 1  hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à KAVA, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 140 000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Obenkina 2 are married women who, on average, are 36 years old, have three children and are all living in traditional families in Sankinekan, one of the villages in the commune of Kava, San circle of the fourth administrative region of Mali. They joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to better run their agricultural businesses during the rainy season. They are on their fifth loan with the institution, the previous loans having been paid back in full. 

The crops cultivated by Maimouna, the woman standing second from the right to the left in the photo, are peanuts. With this loan, she expects to buy fertilizers, soil enriching agents, seeds, and small agricultural equipment, and to pay for labor costs for one hectare of land. The produce will be sold at the village level in Kava after the harvest, to a clientele made up of men and women. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 140,000 francs CFA at the end of the season. This profit will allow her to pay back her loan and also to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay for the costs of labor, fertilizers, soil enriching agents, small agricultural equipment, and seeds.

loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe SABALI est constitué de  5 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles  élargies à MASSABILA, un village de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 1er prêt.
