Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  céréales à l’image de MAÏMOUNA qui est la 1ère femme debout dans la photo de la gauche vers la droite. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 200kg de mil et 250kg de maïs avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Sabali Group is made up of five women who are married and are, on average, 36 years old and have five children.  They live in traditional, extended families in the village of Massabila, in Bougouni.  They know one another as neighbours, friends and colleagues.

In order to improve their working capital, the women work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso, this will be their first loan.

Maïmouna (standing on the far left in the photo) sells cereals.  She plans to use her loan to buy 200 kilos of millet and 250 kilos of maize from wholesalers in Bougouni.  She will then sell her cereals at the market and from home, for cash or on credit to both men and women.

Maïmouna expects to make an average monthly profit of 25,000 francs CFA, which will be invested in her business and used to repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy cereals for resale.

loans.name: Obenkina 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe OBENKINA 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à SANKINEKAN, un des villages de la commune de KAVA cercle de SAN de la  4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur 5ème prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : l’arachide avec TATARA, femme assise au milieu sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir : 0,75 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à KAVA, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 130.000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

The ten members of the Obenkina 1 are married women who, on average, are 40 years old, have four children and are all living in traditional families in Sankinekan, one of the villages in the commune of Kava, San circle of the fourth administrative region of Mali. They joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to better run their agricultural businesses during the rainy season. They are on their fifth loan with the institution, the previous loans having been paid back in full.

The crops cultivated by Tatara, the woman seated at the middle of the photo, are peanuts. With this loan, she expects to buy fertilizers, soil enriching agents, seeds, and small agricultural equipment, and to pay for labor costs for .75 hectares of land. The produce will be sold at the village level in Kava after the harvest, to a clientele made up of men and women. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 130,000 francs CFA at the end of the season. This profit will allow her to pay back her loan and also to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay for the costs of labor, fertilizers, soil enriching agents, small agricultural equipment, and seeds.

loans.name: Badegna Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BADEGNA est constitué de 6 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles  élargies dans le quartier    MASSABLACOURA de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 12ème prêt. Les 11 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  condiments à l’image de DJENEBA qui est la 1ère femme  debout dans la photo de la droite vers la gauche. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 10 sacs de sel iodé, 5 cartons de pattes de tomate et diverses qualités de condiments avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Badegna Group is made up of six women who are married and are, on average, 35 years old and have five children.  They live in traditional, extended families in the district of Massablacoura, in Bougouni.  They know one another as neighbours, friends and colleagues.

In order to improve their working capital, the women work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso, this will be their twelfth loan.  The previous loans were all fully and correctly repaid.

Djeneba (standing on the far right in the photo) sells food ingredients.  She plans to use her loan to buy 10 sacks of iodized salt, 5 boxes of tomato paste and various other food items from wholesalers in Bougouni.  She will then retail her products at the market and from home, for cash or on credit to both men and women.

Djeneba expects to make an average monthly profit of 50,000 francs CFA, which will be invested in her business and used to repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients for resale.

loans.name: Gita

texts.en:
40-year-old Gita lives in a remote village of North Bairatiguri in Jalpaiguri district. She is married and a mother of three children (two sons and one daughter). Her daughter is a student in grade 9 and the sons are working as masons. She attended school till grade 3, and after that had to give up education as her parents could not afford it. 

Her husband, 49-year-old Gopal works in agriculture and the family has their own house. His business and source of income is the production of paddy; he has been in agriculture for many years, which he learned from his ancestors. He decided to grow paddy upon seeing that his family had its own plot. He is a good and hardworking fellow who does his business honestly. His customers like him for his good and polite behavior and the quality products he sells. To satisfy the customer needs and as well as to earn a better income he wants to grow more paddy. His goals are to expand his paddy cultivation and to look after them well enough so as to obtain a better yield and to increase his income when what he has planted begins to produce grain. 

Gita is asking for a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS which will be used to assist her husband to purchase seeds and fertilizers to improve his agribusiness not only to meet the demands of his customers, but so he can earn better and hence overcome the financial hurdles which the family is facing now. 

She wants to construct a decent house with the profit. She conveys her thanks to her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies for her husband's paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Obenkina 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe OBENKINA 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à SANKINEKAN, un des villages de la commune de KAVA cercle de SAN de la  4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur 5ème prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : l’arachide avec AMI, 2ème femme debout de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir : 0,5  hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à KAVA, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 75.000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The Obenkina 3 Group is made up of ten women who are married and are, on average, 32 years old and have three children.  They live in traditional families in the village of Sankinekan, in the commune of Kava (San district which is the fourth administrative region of Mali).

In order to improve their farming businesses during the winter months, the women work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  This will be their fifth loan.  The previous loans were all fully and correctly repaid.

Ami (standing second from the right in the photo) grows peanuts.  She plans to use her loan to buy seed and other farming supplies, and pay labour costs to work half a hectare of land.  She will sell her produce in the village and in Kava to both men and women.

Ami  expects to make an average profit of 75,000 francs CFA over the loan period.  This will be used to repay her loan and help her husband provide for their day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to pay labour costs and buy seed and other supplies for her agriculture business.

loans.name: Dangtha Group

texts.en:
Seephanom's village takes water from wells and from the local streams. Some people in the village are able to buy bottles water. The water in this area is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment. The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water. 

Seephanom is excited that he and his neighbors were able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; this is because the filter removes bacteria and other waterborne diseases. The water filter also increases disposable income and available working days due to the decreased cost of purchasing charcoal or foraging for wood and/or purchasing bottled water. The filter is guaranteed for two years, though most find the filter works from three to five years.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so he can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
“A new leaf has come up for me after getting this job,” said Monica, pictured with her mother. A new beginning has started in her life after she was selected for cabin crew. She is overjoyed. Monica is 19 years old and the eldest among four. Their mother supported them alone after her father passed away from a serious illness. She has been dedicating her life to helping her parents in household matters, even though she was at her young age. 

This profession is special to her because of the hospitality they render to the passengers across the world. Her academic performance was excellent and she has always been among the top in her class. However, their family financial condition worsens, and she was in an urgent search for a job. She decided to work and support her family by joining the cabin crew. 

Her mother’s undying spirit to nurture and support in shaping her career is her greatest inspiration. “The credit goes to my mother,” says Monica. Ever since her childhood, she always had dreams to become an air hostess when she grew up. In her childhood days, she would act like an air hostess in the house and play with friends and family, while the others would act like her passengers. She loves the discipline the cabin crew maintains while rendering service to their passengers. 

She got the selection when the cabin crew interview was conducted in Imphal. It was a dream come true to be among the few who were selected. Now that she is in a position to join the crew, she is in need of financial assistance to pay for the security deposit, which is mandatory for all the successful candidates for the aviation training. She was anxious about where she will get the deposit fee. Fortunately, her friends who are members of Kiva recommended WSDS for education loans to those who need financial assistance. She was overwhelmed to hear such good news. 

After availing herself of the loan, she will be able to fulfill her dreams to fly high without any financial pressure and pay the security deposit without any delay. She expresses her immense gratitude to Kiva and WSDS for helping her to break the financial barrier she had, and wishes to pay back the loan amount once she starts earning. 

She said, “Thank you Kiva and WSDS for being part of molding my career to achieve my goals and aspirations.”

loans.use: to pay the security deposit charges for cabin crew training.

loans.name: Phonekham Group

texts.en:
Peuy's village takes water from wells and from the local streams.  Some people in the village are able to buy bottled water.  The water in this area is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment.  The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water.   

Peuy is excited that she and her neighbors were able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; this is because the filter removes bacteria and other water borne diseases. The water filter also increases disposable income and available working days due to the decreased cost of purchasing charcoal or foraging for wood and/or purchasing bottled water. 

The filter is guaranteed for 2 years, though most find the filter works from 3-5 years.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is 36 years old and married. She has been doing a business of bangles sales for many years. She buys bangles from the wholesale markets at lower rates and then sells them to the people of her community at a profit. Her husband’s income is not enough to fulfill the family needs. Therefore she started her own business to contribute to the family income. 

Kousar has requested a loan of PKR 45,000 to buy the latest variety of bangles in different colors and designs. This will help her to increase her sales. She is in her 5th loan cycle with good repayment history. She wants to expand her business to provide a better standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to buy the latest variety of bangles in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Alema

texts.en:
Alema, 42 years, is married and the mother of three children (two sons and one daughter). Her oldest child is in grade 11, the second one is in grade 10, and her youngest child is in grade 9. Alema makes the sacrifice and effort to give each one of them the best and to allow them to keep on attending school. 

Her husband's main and only job as a source of income for her family is growing paddy. She helps her husband up to the cutting and selling of the crops because she's responsible for the household chores. Both of them are involved when it's time to cut or collect the grains because their children are too young to be able to give them the help they need. Both work tirelessly, but are unable to provide financial sustenance to their family.

Alema is requesting financing from BJS (Kiva’s partner) so that she can purchase agricultural inputs such as paddy seeds and fertilizer to get a good quantity harvest.

Her goals are to keep on growing more paddies and to create a good legacy for her children. Her biggest desire is to see her children educated. She also aspires to acquire more plots of land in the future. She is really thankful to her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs for her paddy cultivation business.

loans.name: Bong Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Joy's village takes water from wells and from the local streams. Some people in the village are able to buy bottled water. The water in this area is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment. The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water.    

Mrs. Joy is excited that she and her neighbors were able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; this is because the filter removes bacteria and other water borne diseases. The water filter also increases disposable income and available working days due to the decreased cost of purchasing charcoal or foraging for wood and/or purchasing bottled water. 

The filter is guaranteed for 2 years, though most find the filter works from 3-5 years.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Hera Devi

texts.en:
Hera Devi is 44 years old. She is married and has two children who are 25 and 22. Many years ago, she established her grocery store business. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid three loans from Patan BPW. She used her most recent to buy grocery goods for her business. In the future, Hera Devi plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margains. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 square feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods for her business

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe DJIGUISSEME ont en moyenne 41ans,5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à Yangasso /SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de ventedes céréales, des condiments et des produits divers.
Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe DJIGUISSEME sont à leur 6ème prêt solidaire. MINATA, 2ème femme de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 40Kgs de riz, 10Kgs de fonio, 10Kgs de maïs, 10Litres d’huile, 2Kgs de beurre de karité, 1paquet de Cube Maggi et 5Kgs de sel.Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de30 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the DJIGUISSEME group are women who average 41years of age and five children each. They all live in extended traditional families in Yangasso, SEGOU (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

These women share ties of kinship. They buy and sell cereals, condiments and various other products.

Having repaid all previous loans without incident, they are now in their 6th group loan cycle. MINATA, second from the right in the group photo, plans to use her loan to buy 40 kg of rice, 10 kg of fonio, 10 kg of maize, 10 litres of oil, 2 kg of shea butter, 1 carton of Maggi bouillon cubes and 5 kg of salt. She buys her stock from local wholesalers, and she sells to a clientele consisting of men and women, cash or credit. 

Minata expects to earn an average monthly profit of 30,000FCFA, which she will use to pay for healthcare, food, clothing and tuition. Any remainder will be reinvested in her activity.

loans.use: to buy cereals and condiments for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a game for the bedroom of her daughter.

loans.name: Obenkina 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe OBENKINA 4 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à SANKINEKAN, un des villages de la commune de KAVA cercle de SAN de la  4ème région administrative du Mali.

La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à KAVA, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 250 00FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

In order to improve their farming businesses during the winter months, the women work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  This will be their fifth loan.  The previous loans were all fully and correctly repaid.

Binta (sitting second from the right in the photo) grows peanuts.  She plans to use her loan to buy seed and other farming supplies, and pay labour costs to work one and a half hectares of land.  She will sell her produce in the village and in Kava to both men and women.

Binta  expects to make an average profit of 25,000 francs CFA over the loan period.  This will be used to repay her loan and help her husband provide for their day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to pay labour costs and buy seed and other farming supplies for her agriculture business.

loans.name: Martir

texts.es: Martir de 51 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su hija de 25 años de edad. Ella es una mujer que gracias a su esfuerzo y tenacidad ha logrado sostener la economía familiar, por medio de la venta de chocolate artesanal el cual compra como semilla y lo pone a tostar, para mezclarlo con azúcar y canela, después lo lleva al molino, lo moldea y lo vende como tabletas. La entrada de la vivienda de Martir está deteriorada por lo que ella desea renovarla colocándole gradas a la entrada su vivienda pero no cuenta con los fondos económicos necesarios por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir unas gradas en la entrada de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Martir is 51 years old and lives in her own house with her 25-year-old son. She is a woman who has been able to support her family finances thanks to her hard work and tenacity, selling handmade chocolate. To make this she buys the beans and roasts them, then mixes them with sugar and cinnamon. After this she mills the mixture, puts it in moulds and sells it in blocks.

The entrance to Martir's home is in a poor condition and she wants to update it by putting steps at the entrance to her home. However, she does not have the necessary funds and so she is asking FUSAI for a loan to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron to build some steps at the entrance to her home.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron to build some steps at the entrance to her home.

loans.name: Obenkina 5 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe OBENKINA 5 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à SANKINEKAN, un des villages de la commune de KAVA cercle de SAN de la  4ème région administrative du Mali.

Baniouma (standing on the far right in the photo) grows peanuts.  She plans to use her loan to buy seed and other farming supplies, and pay labour costs to work one hectare of land.  She will sell her produce in the village and in Kava to both men and women.

Baniouma  expects to make an average profit of 125,000 francs CFA over the loan period.  This will be used to repay her loan and help her husband provide for their day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to pay labour costs and buy seed and other supplies for her farming business.

loans.name: Eloisa

texts.en:
Eloisa is 49 years old and married with seven children, two of whom are in school. Eloisa works very hard to provide for them.

Eloisa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional household goods to sell like noodles, coffee, sugar, etc. She has been in this business for 3 years. 

In the future Eloisa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional household goods to sell like noodles, coffee, sugar, etc

loans.name: Rosa Maribel

texts.es:
Rosa de 46 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado de educación básica por motivos de escasos recursos económicos ya no pudo continuar y  decidió dedicarse mejor al trabajo de la jarcia, que es la elaboración de hamacas. Ella es casada y su esposo se dedica al trabajo de la agricultura, ellos tienen 2 hijos y son los que dependen de ellos.

Ella tiene 20 años de experiencia en la jarcia y lo aprendió gracias a sus padres que se lo enseñaron, cuando ella estaba pequeña, y decidió dedicarse a este trabajo ya que es una forma de la cual ella se gana la vida diariamente, y a la vez obtiene sus ingresos para cubrir otros gastos de su hogar; su trabajo lo realiza en su casa de 8 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar hilo, para poder hacer hamacas y abono, semilla y fertilizantes para cultivar maíz; ya que ella además de dedicarse al trabajo de la jarcia se dedica al trabajo de la agricultura. Con esto pretende obtener mayores rendimientos de su cosecha,  para darles una mejor alimentación a su familia. 

Rosa a futuro desea tener una milpa que le permita, tener la alimentación necesaria para su familia, y a la vez tener un buen negocio que le permita, generar sus ingresos para cumplir otras necesidades de su hogar,
texts.en:
Rosa, 46, has a 6th grade education.  Due to a lack of financial resources she could not continue in school.  Instead, she decided it would be better to devote herself to the work of making hammocks.  She is married, and her husband works as a farmer.  They have 2 dependent children.

Rosa has 20 years of experience making hammocks.  She learned this trade from her parents when she was young, and she decided to specialize in this type of work, which is a way for her to earn a living and also obtain the income needed to cover some of the household expenses.  She works in her home, from 8am until 4pm.

The loan that Rosa is requesting from CREDICAMPO will be used to buy string to make hammocks, and also to buy compost, seeds, and fertilizers to cultivate corn.  In addition to making hammocks, Rosa also works in agriculture.  With this loan, she will be able to get a better harvest so that she can better feed her family.

In the future, Rosa wants to have a corn farm that would enable her to have the food she needs for her family and have a good business that would allow her to generate income for other household needs.

loans.use: to buy string to make hammocks, and agricultural supplies to grow corn

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is 25 years old. She is a housewife who lives with her four daughters and husband in their own mud and straw-made house at West Magurmari village in Jalpaiguri, West Bengal. Two of her daughters are attending primary school, and two are below school-going age. Both Amina and her husband are illiterate. They can only sign their names.  

Her husband Rabiul, 28, is a cultivator by profession. He has a lot of experience in growing potatoes, beans, and other seasonal vegetables. In her free time, Amina does different activities in the fields such as cleaning, collecting grains, fertilizing, and more. They sell their harvest to rice dealers in nearby areas, grocery stores, and sometimes to intermediaries who resell the product in other areas. The income from this vegetable cultivation is insufficient to bear the expenses of such a large family. So, they have decided to cultivate paddy. As it is the staple food of the local people, the crop has a very good demand.

She has requested a loan from BJS to purchase supplies, including fertilizer, paddy seeds, and other items, to start cultivation and maintain her crops. Her future plans are to improve and expand her farmland and to strengthen it so she can grow more products. As a mother, she wants to offer a better quality of life to her children and achieve her goal of leaving them a strong heritage. She also wants to purchase a plot of land with the profit. Amina conveys her thanks to her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Aloka

texts.en:
Aloka hails from Dhupguri. She is 24 years old and the mother of one daughter. She has a secondary education, and her husband, Pankaj, studied only up to grade seven. Her main challenge is her daughter's education, and she is sending her daughter to school; she is in grade two. They live in West Magurmari in Jalpaiguri dustrict. 

Her husband, who is 27 years old, is a worker in a jewelry shop. Due to his scant income, he can't bear all the costs of the family. So, Aloka has been running a business of selling milk for many years. She initiated her own business by buying a dairy cow to support her family. Her husband was the only breadwinner at that time. With the passage of time, her sales have increased and also her income. Aloka sells their milk in her local community. This all happened due to her courage and determination. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters, as well as financial matters.

 Aloka has applied for a loan from Kiva's field partner BJS to purchase one more cow. She hopes to increase the production capacity of milk, which ultimately helps in generating more cash. She thanks her lenders for this financial help.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for her milk supply business.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 42 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 28000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more soap, shampoo, eggs, and other items to sell. 

Elena has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 6 years and also earns an income from seaweed harvesting and fishing.

Elena aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more soap, shampoo, eggs, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Nongbone Group

texts.en:
Keoxai's village takes water from wells and from the local streams. Some people in the village are able to buy bottled water. The water in this area is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment.  The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water.    

Keoxai is excited that she and her neighbors were able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; this is because the filter removes bacteria and other water borne diseases. The water filter also increases disposable income and available working days due to the decreased cost of purchasing charcoal or foraging for wood and/or purchasing bottled water. 

The filter is guaranteed for 2 years, though most find the filter works from 3-5 years.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is 30 years old. She is married and has one child, age 13. Many years ago, she established her furniture making business. Working six days a week and eight hours a day, she supports her family. 

She has already received and successfully repaid three loans from Patan BPW, and used her most recent to buy wood and timber for her business. In the future, Asha plans to uplift the economic conditions of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

In Nepal, furniture is still made the old-fashioned way. Using little more than basic hand tools, skilled artisans form raw lumber into beautifully finished pieces of furniture.  With precision and an eye for detail, furniture makers produce shelves, bed frames, and cabinet sets.  With the help of a Kiva loan, a furniture maker is able to increase the volume of their lumber purchases or hire additional labor.  This additional leverage allows an entrepreneur to increase productivity and profitability.

loans.use: to buy wood

loans.name: Shoirajon

texts.ru: Шоирачон честная женщина. Она является повторной клиенткой в ИМОН и имеет хорошее кредитное досье. Она замужем и имеет 3 детей. Шоирачон 10 лет назад начала свой бизнес купле продажей мужской одежды. Она начала свой бизнес с маленького оборотного капитала. Постепенно с годами она развевала свой бизнес. Шоирачон каждый сезон обновляет ассортимент товара и таким образом привлекает покупателей. Она должна обновить товар для нового осеннего сезона и поэтому она запрашивает займ на сумму 7500 сомони для покупки мужской одежды. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Shoirajon is an honest woman and a repeat client of IMON who has a good credit rating. She is married with three children. 10 years ago she started her own business buying and selling men's clothing with a small amount of working capital. Gradually through the years she has developed this business. Every season Shoirajon refreshes her assortment of goods to attract buyers. She needs to buy new inventory for the fall season and therefore is requesting a loan of 7,500 somoni to buy men's clothing. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: to buy new clothing inventory for the fall season

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Jenifer works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Jenifer is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing nets for her fishing business.

Jenifer has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is 57 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Mila runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Mila has been in this business for 7 years. 

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
Nimfa is 29 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Nimfa is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Nimfa has been pig fattening for 3 years and also earns additional income from fishing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca  is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice for her rice retailing business.

Rebecca has been in this business for three years. She earns more income from food vending.

Rebecca has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice

loans.name: Rodora

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Rodora works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Rodora  is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance for her motorcycle business.

Rodora has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat.

Rosalinda has been in this business for 30 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Rowena works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell clothing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a seaweed plantation and fishing.  Rowena is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of clothing to sell for her buy and sell clothing business.

Rowena has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of clothing

loans.name: Elne

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Elne works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice. Elne is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like soap, milk, sugar, etc for her general store business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Elne has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like soap, milk, sugar, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an overlock sewing machine in order to reduce her production time and improve the finish of her garments.

loans.name: Nakhor Group

texts.en:
Noy's village takes water from wells and from the local streams. Some people in the village are able to buy bottled water. The water in this area is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment. The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water. 

Noy is excited that she and her neighbors were able to purchase water filters. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; this is because the filter removes bacteria and other waterborne diseases. The water filter also increases disposable income and available working days due to the decreased cost of purchasing charcoal or foraging for wood and/or purchasing bottled water. The filter is guaranteed for two years, though most find the filter works from three to five years.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so she can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Sangita

texts.en:
Sangita is 47 years old. She is married and has three children who are 27, 20 and 24 years old. Many years ago, she established her grocery store business. Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW. She used her most recent to buy grocery goods for her business. In the future, Sangita plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margains. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 square feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods for her business

loans.name: Sandra Veronica

texts.es: Sandra de 30 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 2 hijos de 6 y 2 años de edad. Ella es una mujer que gracias a su esfuerzo y tenacidad ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos ella sola apoyada en su negocio de venta de pupusas la cual tiene mucho tiempo de realizar por lo que ya cuenta con una buena cantidad de clientes. Sandra ha iniciado con la construcción de su vivienda pero el presupuesto con el que contaba no era suficiente por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: ladrillo, cemento, arena, grava, lámina y polines para terminar de construir su vivienda.
texts.en: Sandra is 30 years old and lives in her own home with her two children ages 6 and 2.  She is a woman who, thanks to her efforts and tenacity, has succeeded in helping her children get ahead. She runs a pupusas business (traditional salvadoran dish of thick handmade tortilla filled with a delicious mixture of cheese, meat and beans) which she has had for many years and thus she counts on a large number of customers.  Sandra has begun building her home but the budget that she had was not sufficient, which is why she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner FUSAI in order to invest in bricks, cement, sand, gravel, laminate, and runners to finish construction.

loans.use: to invest in bricks, cement, sand, gravel, laminate, and runners to finish the construction of her home.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of three children, Rebecca works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Rebecca is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to  purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her rice retailing business.

Rebecca has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Rosie works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice.  Rosie is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell for her buy and sell charcoal business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Rosie has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business. She is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like sugar, milk, flour, etc for her food vending business.

Melanie has been in this business for two years. She earns more income from buying and selling nipa roofing.

Melanie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like sugar, milk, flour, etc

loans.name: Maria Rita

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Maria Rita works hard to support her family.

She has a Business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Maria Rita is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she is requesting an additional loan to further build her business.

Maria Rita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell for her business

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a meat butcher business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy meat to sell for her business.

Sarah has been in this business for 20 years. Sarah earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Sarah has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy meat to sell for her business

loans.name: Helina

texts.en:
Helina is 48 years old and married. Helina has six children, and three of the children are in school.

She is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. Helina requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilzer and other farm supplies.

Helina has been farming rice for 10 years now, and she has borrowed 24 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Helina would like to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilzer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Louisita

texts.en:
Louisita is 53 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries to sell.

Louisita has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from food vending.

She aspires to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries to sell

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is a 25-year-old married woman and has been running a business of milk selling with her husband for many years. She has one cow and one buffalo, which she uses for milk selling to the people of her locality. She also sells butter and cheese to generate an extra amount of profit. 

She has become famous for providing good-quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently she is in her 6th loan cycle and has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000. This will allow her to purchase one more cow. She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her and will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en: Shamim has successfully built her business selling animals with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. By this time she has attained good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. Previously, with the help of Kiva, she was able to expand her business. Now she is in her 5th loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase more livestock. It will help her to increase her sales and her profits as well.

loans.use: to purchase more livestock

loans.name: Waheedan

texts.en: Waheedan is a 35-year-old married woman having five children. She is been in the business of selling animals such as goats for the past ten years. She buys baby goats at low prices, brings them up, and sells them near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslim countries). She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation; currently she has requested a loan of Rs. 40,000 to purchase more baby goats. She is in her 5th loan cycle with good repayment history.  She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats.

loans.name: Caridad

texts.en:
Caridad is 64 years old and married with ten children, six of whom are in school, Caridad works very hard to provide for them.

Caridad runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Caridad has been in this business for three years. 

In the future Caridad would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Julie works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish. Julie is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy items to like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell for her general store business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Julie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice farming business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies for her rice farming business.

Elma has been in this business for six years. Elma earns additional income from buying and selling rice.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, so she requested additional loan to further build her business.

Elma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilzer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 29 years old and married. Luzviminda has five children, three of whom are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Luzviminda requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Luzviminda has been pig fattening for four years, and she has borrowed 15 times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Luzviminda would like to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 22 years old and single.

She is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Maricel requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fertilizer and other farming supplies.

Maricel has been farming rice for five years, and she has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizer and other farming supplies

loans.name: Madjaila

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Madjaila works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling split bamboo.

Madjaila is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell for her business buying and selling charcoal.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Madjaila has been sustaining her business activities through her past 25 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Norlie

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Norlie works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling young coconut.  

Norlie is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Norlie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college and for business expansion.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell for her business.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es: Catalina de 63 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo. Ella es una mujer que gracias a su esfuerzo y tenacidad ha logrado sostener la economía familiar, por medio de las  ventas que realiza de antojitos típicos y tamales de gallina. Catalina está preocupada por que el corredor de su vivienda se encuentra deteriorado por lo que desea realizar las reparaciones necesarias lo antes posible. Por lo anterior Catalina solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, hierro y ladrillos para construir unos pilares, las gradas y encementar el piso del corredor de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Catalina, 63, lives with her husband in her own home.  Thanks to her effort and determination, she has managed to support her family financially, by selling traditional snacks and chicken tamales. 

Catalina is worried because the porch of her home is deteriorated, and she wants to make the necessary repairs as soon as possible. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI.  She will purchase cement, sand, gravel, iron, and nails, in order to construct pillars and steps, and to cement the floor of her home's porch.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, iron, and nails, in order to construct pillars and steps, and to cement the floor of her home's porch.

loans.name: Puerta Del Sol Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PUERTA DEL SOL” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rosmery es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de manta de alpaca, bordado de trajes folklóricos, venta de víveres, costura de polleras, tejido a macramé, elaboración de abarcas, venta de polleras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Rosmery es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción masiva de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de víveres por mayor; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años cuando ella era soltera, posterior a su matrimonio decidió seguir desarrollando el proceso. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de víveres por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará a solicitud del cliente. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “PUERTA DEL SOL” communal bank is about to start its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Santiago II centre. The group is made up of eight members and is run by a board of directors of which Rosmery is the Secretary. The businesses which the members of the communal bank run are varied and include: knitting alpaca blankets, embroidering traditional costumes, selling groceries, sewing skirts, macrame knitting, making sandals and selling skirts. 

The loan they are taking out will benefit small micro-businesswomen of which Rosmery is a member. She says she joined Pro Mujer three years ago after being invited through a mass publicity campaign by the institution.

Currently she has a business selling groceries wholesale. She says she started this business several years ago when she was single and after she got married she decided to continue developing the business.

The loan she is taking out now is to have capital for buying groceries wholesale. She will buy these from the wholesale vendors in the city of La Paz and will then sell them through customer orders. This kind of work enables her to generate an income to support her family financially, as she is married and has three children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says she likes the health area provided by the institution.

loans.use: to buy groceries wholesale.

loans.name: Karen Yasmin

texts.es: Karen de 24 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a sus abuelos de 68 y 70 años de edad y su grupo familiar. Ella es una mujer que gracias a su esfuerzo y tenacidad apoya a sus abuelos en la economía familiar, apoyada en su trabajo de mecánico de mantenimiento en una empresa cercana. Karen es una joven con aspiraciones que desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda ya que este se encuentra actualmente deteriorado, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera, clavos y mano de obra para cambiar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Karen is 24 years old and lives in her own house with her grandparents, who are 68 and 70 years old, and her family group. She is a woman who through hard work and tenacity helps her grandparents with the family finances, helped by her work as a maintenance mechanic in a nearby firm.

Karen is a young woman with aspirations. She wants to replace the roof of her home as it is currently in a poor condition, and so she is asking FUSAI for a loan to buy galvanised sheets, wood and nails and to pay for labour to replace the roof of her home.

loans.use: to buy galvanised sheets, wood and nails and to pay for labour to replace the roof of her home.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 58 years old and married with seven children, one of whom is in school.

She earns a living by planting flowers in the Philippines.  Julieta has been planting flowers for 7 years and also earns additional income from buy and sell charcoal and general store.

Julieta is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy different varieties of flowers to plant.  She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested additional loan to further build her business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy different varieties of flowers to plant

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 59 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Elena has been pig fattening for 8 years and also earns additional income from selling vegetables.  

Elena is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.  She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested additional loan to further build her business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Elizabeth works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell fish business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling vegetables.  Elizabeth is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell for her business.

Elizabeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Rheena May

texts.en:
Rheena May is 24 years old, single, and works hard to support her parents.

She has a buy-and-sell dried fish business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling vegetables.  Rheena May is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy dried fish to sell for her business for her business.

Rheena May has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy dried fish to resell for her business

loans.name: Lovella

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Lovella works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling young coconuts and charcoal.  Lovella is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell for her general store business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Lovella has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Gemma works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Gemma is borrowing PHP 20,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle for her motorcycle transport business.

Gemma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe BENKADI ont en moyenne 35ans,3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à Santoro I l’un des quartiers de SAN/SÉGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des céréales et des produits divers.
Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe BENKADI sont à leur 2ème prêt solidaire. ADAM, 1ère femme debout de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 40Kgs de riz, 10Kgs de fonio, 20Kgs de mil. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes.Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de15 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the BENKADI group are women who average 35 years of age and three children each. They all live in extended traditional families in Santoro I, a district of SAN/SEGOU (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). 

These women share ties of kinship. They buy and sell cereals and various other products. Having repaid their first loan without incident, they are now in their 2nd group loan cycle. ADAM, standing first from the left in the group photo, plans to use her loan to buy 40 kg of rice, 10 kg of fonio, and 20 kg of millet. She buys her stock from local wholesalers, and she sells to a clientele consisting of men and women, cash or credit. 

Adam expects to earn an average monthly profit of 15,000FCFA, which she will use to pay for healthcare, food, clothing and tuition. Any remainder will be reinvested in her activity.

loans.use: to buy cereals for resale.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 50 years old and married with five children.  She works hard to provide for her family.

Angelita has been running a general store for 10 years and also earns income from buying and selling dried fish.

She has requested a PHP 29000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.  Angelita has borrowed and paid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Angelita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is 48 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school,  Mercedita works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for 10 years.  Mercedita requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

In the future Mercedita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita is 59 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines.  Estelita has been farming rice for 10 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice. She is borrowing PHP 29500 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 48 years old and married with seven children, four of whom are in school.

Nida works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy-and-sell charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell for her business.

Nida has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the charcoal business for seven years and also earns an income from farming rice.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Nida aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell for her business

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 53 years old and  has seven children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, etc.

Marilou has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from buying and selling fish.

Marilou aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, etc

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 33 years old and married with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, etc.

Roselyn has borrowed and repaid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 11 years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice and charcoal.

Roselyn aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, etc

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Editha works hard to support her family.

She farms rice as a business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling nipa roofing.  Editha is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of fertilizer for her farm business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Editha has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Lita

texts.en: Lita is 47 years old, married and the mother of twelve children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines, and has requested a loan for PHP 10,000 from NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. Lita has been farming rice for the last four years and earns additional income from food vending. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Ledgelyn

texts.en:
Ledgelyn is single and works hard to support her parents.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending.  Ledgelyn is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her general store business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Ledgelyn has been sustaining her business activities using her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy shampoo and groceries to sell

loans.name: Tokusarona

texts.en: Tokusarona is 28 years old, single and the mother of one child. She earns a living by making and selling a variety of foods at a cafeteria in her community and in the local village school. She has seven years of experience in this line of work, and is requesting a loan to buy a second hand pick-up to easily deliver goods to her business and to buy a large oven in which to do her baking. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses and help with the expansion of her business. Tokusarona has been a member of SPBD since 2007.

loans.use: to buy a secondhand pick-up for her business and to buy a large oven

loans.name: Sisi

texts.en: Sisi is a 43-year-old married mother of five children. She runs a small taxi business to earn an income. She has seven years' experience with this business. Sisi needs a loan to buy a taxi sign indicator, taxi stickers, new tires, a new gear box and rims. She will use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Sisi joined SPBD in 2007 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a taxi sign indicator, taxi stickers, new tires, a new gear box and rims

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Cecilia works hard to support her family.

She has a butcher shop business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from prepared food vending. Cecilia is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase more meat to sell for her butcher shop business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Cecilia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more meat to sell

loans.name: Evelita

texts.en:
Evelita is 35 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell.

Evelita has borrowed and repaid 28 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the charcoal business for five years and also earns an income from her general store.

Evelita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 16,500 through NWTF to buy fishing materials like fishing net, gasoline, etc. for her fishing business.

Janet has been in this business for eight years. She earns more income from food vending.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Janet has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like fishing net, gasoline, etc

loans.name: Dally

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Dally works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling dried coconut meat in the Philippines and also earns additional income from working in the general store. Dally is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of dried coconut meat to sell through her business.

Dally has been sustaining her business activities through her past twenty-nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase dried coconut meat to sell

loans.name: Erna Leigh

texts.en:
Erna Leigh is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice mill operator business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts and pays for laborers' salaries for her rice mill operator business.

Erna Leigh has been in this business for three years. She earns an additional income from working in a general store and raising livestock.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now has requested another loan to keep building her business.

Erna Leigh has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and pay for laborers' salaries

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is forty-seven years old and married with six children, one of whom in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Josephine is borrowing PHP 17,500 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of feed for her pigs.

Josephine has been raising pigs for four years and also earns an additional income from photography.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now has requested another loan to keep building her business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can establish a new general store.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of feed for her pigs

loans.name: Lie

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Lie works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell fish business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Lie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF.  She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested additional loan to further build her business.  Lie is borrowing PHP 24000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her business.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios works hard to support her family. Remedios is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.  Remedios has been in this business for 6 years now.

She requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional food to sell.

In the future, Remedios would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional food to sell

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 36 years old and is married with seven children, all of whom who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 10 years.  She has borrowed 25 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.  Rosalinda requested a PHP 12500 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of feed and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Rosalinda would like to save money to put up new business like general store.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Menime

texts.en: Menime is 23 years old and married with one child. She makes and sells elei printed material to earn a living and has been doing this for four years. Menime has requested a loan to buy fabric paint, material, rollers, stencils, wooden carved designs and rubber designs. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy fabric paint, material, rollers, stencils, wooden carved designs and rubber designs

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en: Daisy is 64 years old and married with six children. She owns and operates a small flea market selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for 12 years. Daisy needs a loan to buy material and fabric paint. She'll also be buying a second-hand car to ease the difficulty of traveling to her business. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses and help with the expansion of her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2002 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy material and fabric paint, and also to buy a second-hand car to ease the difficulty of traveling to her business

loans.name: Siaulaina

texts.en:
Siaulaina is 42 years old and married with seven children. 
She has a 9-acre plantation where she grows taro and bananas and a variety of vegetables which she sells in her village and at the market. She has been doing this for three years. Siaulaina needs a loan to buy two machetes, chemicals, a tiller, sprayers and a second-hand pickup truck for transportation. 
She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. Siaulaina will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy two machetes, chemicals, a tiller, sprayers and a second-hand pickup truck for transportation

loans.name: Veronika

texts.en:
Veronika is 27 years old and married with 4 children. 

She owns and operates a shop, selling a variety of items and she also runs a taxi service to earn extra income. She has been doing this for 5 years. 

Veronika needs a loan to buy drinks, snacks, canned items, frozen goods and a large freezer for her store, and for her taxi she'll also be buying new tyres and renewing her taxi's license. 

She hopes to use her profits to pay for the renovation of her house and help pay for her children's education. 

She became a member of SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital for her business.
