loans.use: to buy drinks, snacks, canned items, frozen goods and a large freezer for her store, and for her taxi she'll also be buying new tyres and renewing her taxi's license

loans.name: Ivoga

texts.en:
Ivoga is 38 years old and divorced with 4 children.  She has a flea market selling vegetables, printed material, sodas and snacks in the town market.  She has been doing this for 5 years. 

Ivoga needs a loan to buy a large cooler, 15 trays of soda, 20 boxes of bongo's, rolls of material, vegetable seeds, bags of ice and a business license.  She has been a member of SPBD since 2009.  

Ivoga will use the profits from her sales to pay for her families weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy a large cooler, 15 trays of soda, 20 boxes of bongo's, rolls of material, vegetable seeds, bags of ice and a business license

loans.name: Sileiloa

texts.en: Sileiloa is 24 years old and divorced with five children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. Sileiloa needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, and a machete. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Sileiloa will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, and a machete

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en: Rosalina is a 34-year-old married mother of seven children. She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. Rosalina needs a loan to buy bags of flour, sugar, a large frying pan, a new oven, cooking oil, strainer and yeast. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Rosalina has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, sugar, a large frying pan, a new oven, cooking oil, strainer and yeast

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en: Winnie is 30 years old, married and the mother of two children. She owns and operates a pest-control business which serves the public as needed. She has four years of experience in this line of work, and is seeking a loan to buy a car to move her sprayers and chemicals around and also to buy a new air compressor. She will use the additional profits she expects to earn to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Winnie joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a car to move her sprayers and chemicals around and also to buy a new air compressor.

loans.name: Alberto Gabino

texts.es:
Alberto es un hombre muy afortunado con una maravillosa esposa con quien fundó un hogar lleno de amor con 4 hijos por quienes se esfuerza al máximo ya que son su motor en la vida. Desde hace muchos años se dedica al cultivo de papa en un terreno que con mucho empeño ha podido comprar, cree que les está yendo bien por su dedicación y arduo trabajo.
Alberto está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá cubrir los gastos de limpieza y riego de su terreno así como comprar abono orgánico para sus plantaciones, con ello su producción mejorará y con estos ingresos adicionales ganados más adelante podrá construir su casa de material noble.
texts.en:
Alberto is a very fortunate man. He has a wonderful wife and a family full of love. He has four children and works as hard as he can for them, because they are the engine that keeps him running. He has been growing potatoes for many years in a piece of land that he bought after working very hard. He believes that their hard work and dedication has resulted in good things.

Alberto appreciates the help that Kiva lenders have given him. He will be able to cover the cleaning and irrigation expenses and buy organic fertilizers for his crops. This will result in a better production. With the additional income, he will be able to build a house with solid materials in the future.

loans.use: to cover the cleaning and irrigation expenses.

loans.name: Normalita

texts.en:
Normalita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines.  Normalita has been in this business for 3 years. Normalita earns more income from buying and selling fish.

Normalita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.  She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested additional loan to further build her business.  She is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials for the maintenance of her fishing business.

She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college and expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for the maintenance of her business

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: As the married parent of five children, Gina works hard to support her family by running a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling fish. She is requesting a loan for PHP 10,000 from NWTF to  buy additional fishing nets to use in her business. She has successfully repaid four previous loans from NWFT, and is requesting this new one to further expand her business. She hopes that her hard work will allow her to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing nets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy silk and polyester thread for making hammocks.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: As the married parent of four children, Charity works hard to support her family. She earns a living by buying and selling dried fish in the Philippines, and earns additional income from raising pigs.  Charity has requested a loan for PHP 12,000 from NWTF to buy additional dried fish to sell. She has sustained her business with help from three prior loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her provide a secure future to her family.

loans.use: to buy additional dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Akala

texts.en: Akala is a 63-year-old widow with three children. She has a a large plantation and vegetable farm as well as a greenhouse nurturing a variety of beautiful flowers which she sells in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for five years. Akala needs a loan to buy a large roll of barbed wire for protection of her produce, timber for the fence, screen wire, petrol, nails, fertilizer and two wheelbarrows. She has been a member of SPBD since 2009. Akala will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy a large roll of barbed wire for protection of her produce, timber for the fence, screen wire, petrol, nails, fertilizer and two wheelbarrows

loans.name: Katrina

texts.en: Katrina is 30 years old and married with five children. She makes and sells elei printed material and hand-made carved furniture to earn a living and has been doing this for five years. Katrina has requested a loan to buy a compound saw, timber, plywood, 10 cans of varnish, material, 10 cans of fabric paint and rollers. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a compound saw, timber, plywood, 10 cans of varnish, material, 10 cans of fabric paint and rollers

loans.name: Mukadam

texts.ru: Мукадам в течение 18 лет занимается бизнесом. Она продает ткани. Мукадам покупает ткани из центрального рынка и продает на рынках кишлаков. Она ездит по кишлакам и продает ткани местным жителям. Она замужем. Ее муж строитель. Мукадам имеет 3 детей. Она имеет большой опыт в данном бизнесе. Мукадам планирует увеличить оборотный капитал и таким образом развевать бизнес. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки ткани. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Over the course of 18 years, Mukadam has been engaged in business. She sells fabrics. Mukadam buys fabrics from the central market and sells them in the village markets. She goes to the villages and sells fabrics to the local inhabitants. She is married. Her husband is a construction worker. Mukadam has three children. She has a lot of experience in this trade. Mukadam plans to increase her working capital and in this manner to develop her business. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 somoni to purchase fabrics.

loans.use: to buy fabrics to increase her working capital.

loans.name: Hayde

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Hayde works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling fish in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Hayde is borrowing 29,500 Philippine pesos through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell.

Hayde has been sustaining her business activities through 12 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen is a 44-year-old married mother of six children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. At present, she has two buffaloes and one cow. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. She is currently requesting a loan of PKR 45,000 to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales which will ultimately help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Asma

texts.en: Asma is a 24-year-old married woman. For about five years she is been doing machine embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the income of her home. To help her to continue her operation, she has requested for a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy reels of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones for its embellishment. In this way she would be able to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful to get increase her income by targeting more customers. Asma dreams of improving her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones

loans.name: Ella

texts.en:
Ella is 39 years old and married with two children. 

With both of her children currently in school, Ella works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 14,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her store.

Ella has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items, such as soft-drinks, snack foods, canned goods, noodles, cereals, milk, juice, seasonings, etc. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Tuhfaniso

texts.ru: Тухфанисо замужем за мастера отделочника. У них один ребенок. Тухфанисо в свои 43 года занимается торговым бизнесом. Она начала этот бизнес два года назад. Тухфанисо на рынке своего города Худжанд имеет торговую точку, где занимается продажей женской обуви. Этим бизнесом она занимается самостоятельно. У нее хороший опыт и знание в сфере продаж. Тухфанисо целеустремленный человек. Она сейчас хочет увеличить ассортимент сезонной обуви, однако для этой цели нуждается в кредите. По ее словам кредит поможет увеличить количество товара и объем продаж. В будущем Тухфанисо планирует приобрести еще один магазин и расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Tuhfaniso is married to a master finisher. They have one child.

Tuhfaniso in her 43 years has been engaged in the trading business. She began this business two years ago. In the market in her city Khujand, Tuhfaniso has a trade post, where she sells women's shoes. She runs this business on her own. She has good experience and knowledge in this area of sales. Tuhfaniso is an ambitious person. She now wants to increase her assortment of seasonal shoes, however for this goal she needs a loan. In her words, the loan will help to increase the quantity of goods and sales.

In the future, Tuhfaniso plans to acquire another store and to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of seasonal women's shoes

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.ru:
Гулбахор 40 лет. Она является членом дехканского (фермерского) хозяйства и работает там в течение 4 лет. Она по профессии учительница. Утром она работает на своей участке земли, а после обеда идет в школу преподавать начальным классам. Гулбахор любит оба свои деятельности. 
Гулбахор в настоящее время разведена. У нее нет детей, но она удочерила дочку своего брата. Гулбахор живет вместе с племянницей в селе района Яван. Сейчас она готовится к очередным посевам. На сумму кредита она хочет приобрести качественные семена овощей, минеральные удобрения и топлива. Она нуждается в вашей поддержке, без которого не может продолжить свою земледельческую деятельность.
texts.en:
Gulbahor is 40 years old. She is a member of a group farm and has been working there for four years. By profession she is a schoolteacher. In the morning, she works on her plot of land and after lunch she goes to school to teach primary grades. Gulbahor loves both these activities.

Gulbahor is currently divorced. She does not have children, but she adopted the daughter of her brother. Gulbahor lives with her niece in a village in the Yavan region. Now she is preparing for the next planting. With the loan amount, she wants to acquire quality vegetable seeds, mineral fertilizers, and fuel. She needs support, without which she cannot continue her agriculture activity.

loans.use: to buy quality vegetable seeds, mineral fertilizers, and fuel.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe BENKADI ont en moyenne 48ans, 6enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à DALLAN l’un des quartiers de SAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des condiments, des céréales et des produits divers.
Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe BENKADI sont à leur 9ème  prêt solidaire.LALA,1èrefemme debout de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter50Kgs de sucre, 10 boîtes de lait concentré, 1 carton de savon, 10Litres d’huile et 5 paquet de bonbon. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes.Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de22000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the group BENKADI average 48 years of age and six children each, all living in traditional extended families in DALLAN, a district of SAN/SEGOU (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). These women know one another through ties of kinship, and they have businesses buying and selling condiments, grains, and a variety of goods. After having correctly paid back their previous loans, the women of the group BENKADI are now on their 9th solidarity loan. 

LALA, the woman standing first from the left in the photo, intends to use her loan to purchase 50 kg of sugar, 10 boxes of condensed milk, 1 box of soap, 10 liters of oil, and 5 packets of candies. She gets her supplies locally from wholesalers. She makes her sales to men and women customers paying with cash and often credit. 

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 22,000 francs CFA that will be used to cover expenses related to healthcare, food, clothing, and schooling costs. The rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of goods

loans.name: Benkan Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe BENKAN ont en moyenne 38ans, 5enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à SANTORO II l’un des quartiers de SAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits divers.
Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe BENKAN sont à leur 16ème  prêt solidaire.FATOUMATA1èrefemmedela droite vers la gauche sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter20 paires de collier, 10 paires de chaussure en plastique, 5 paires de chaussure en peau, 3 pièces de Wax et 10 foulards. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes.Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de40000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the group BENKAN average 38 years of age and five children each, all living in traditional extended families in SANTORO II, a district of SAN/SEGOU (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). These women know one another through ties of kinship, and they have businesses buying and selling a variety of goods. 

After having correctly paid back their previous loans, the women of the group BENKAN are now on their 16th solidarity loan. 

FATOUMATA, the woman first from the left in the photo, intends to use her loan to purchase 20 necklaces, 10 pairs of plastic shoes, 5 pairs of leather shoes, 3 lengths of Wax ’pagnes’ (the colorful cloth of western Africa), and 10 scarves. She gets her supplies locally from wholesalers. She makes her sales to men and women customers paying with cash and often credit. 

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 40,000 francs CFA that will be used to cover expenses related to healthcare, food, clothing, and schooling costs. The rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of goods

loans.name: Muattarkhon

texts.ru: Муаттархон родилась в 1992 года. Она замужем, но не имеет детей. Муаттархон с самого детства была отличницей. Она окончила среднюю школу успешно и поступила в Худжандский Государственный Университет по специальности Востоковедения. Она окончила университет успешно и в этом году поступила в магистратуру по специальности востоковеда. Она хочет после окончания магистратуры работать переводчиком. Муаттархон владеет английский, арабский и русскими языками. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Muattarkhon was born in 1992. She is married, but does not have children. Muattarkhon has been an excellent student since her childhood. She successfully completed a secondary school and was accepted to the Khujand State University with the Asian Studies focus. She successfully graduated from the university and was accepted to a master's program in Asian Studies. She wants to work as a translator after completing her master's program. Muattarkhon is fluent in English, Arabic and Russian languages. She is requesting a loan to pay for her tuition. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for her master's program tuition

loans.name: Elecita

texts.en:
Elecita is 56 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. Elecita runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 20,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Elecita has borrowed and repaid 17 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from selling vegetables.

Elecita aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en:
Jenifer is a rural farmer in Kapsowar, Kenya, an area known for producing long-distance runners who have broken major world records. She is blessed with four children. Jenifer has been practicing mixed farming for the past ten years. On her farm, she grows maize and keeps poultry and dairy animals including goats. She sells milk, eggs and maize, and when she is not farming, Jenifer offers transportation services to other farmers on her motorcycle.
To meet her expenses and provide the best for her family, she often engages in small personal businesses to make extra money, but farming gives her a great sense of satisfaction despite meager earnings. She said, "I enjoy it most when I see customers come back for my products because it shows me that I am meeting their needs!" 
Her biggest challenge is drought. The long dry season can lead to crop failures and poor yields. To a farmer, this means business losses and lack of food for the family. Because of this challenge, Jenifer formed a group and joined Juhudi Kilimo, a microfinance organization that supports small rural farmers. She acquired a dairy cow that she later named Mrembo (Swahili for beautiful) which produces milk daily, which Jenifer sells to a co-operative. "The money from milk comes regularly and is not very affected by sudden changes in weather if you have stored feed," said Jenifer. The money Jenifer got from selling the milk was adequate to repay a loan. 
Today, Jenifer is seeking a new loan to buy another dairy cow and is planning to become a fully-fledged dairy farmer. Her future plan is to construct a zero-grazing unit. That way, she can use the grazing field to plant fodder and prepare silage. With this loan, Jenifer is going to grow into a very successful dairy farmer. All she wants is for her family to enjoy the abundance of life, good health and livelihood.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Sindayigaya

texts.en: Sindayigaya is 27 years old. He is married with two children aged between 1 month and 3 years old; neither of them goes to school. He has been selling local drinks made from sorghum for 3 months. With this loan, he would like to buy more sorghum for sale. The profits from the business will be used to improve his welfare.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum for sale.

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe SABOUGNOUMA ont en moyenne 35 ans,4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à Lafiabougou l’un des quartiers de SAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des condiments, des habits et des produits divers.
Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe SABOUGNOUMA sont à leur 6èmeprêt solidaire. MAMOU,1ère femme de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pouracheter5 pièces de Wax, 5 pièces d’unit Wax et 10 mètres de Bazin.Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes.Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de17 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the SABOUGNOUMA group are women who average 35 years of age and four children each. They all live in extended traditional families in Lafiabougou, a district of SAN/SEGOU (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). 

These women share ties of kinship. They buy and sell condiments, clothing and various other products. Having repaid all previous loans without incident, they are now in their 6th group loan cycle. MAMOU, first from the right in the group photo, plans to use her loan to buy 5 pieces of wax pagne and 10 meters of bazin. She buys her stock from local wholesalers, and she sells to a clientele consisting of men and women, cash or credit. 

Mamou expects to earn an average monthly profit of 17,000FCFA, which she will use to pay for healthcare, food, clothing and tuition. Any remainder will be reinvested in her activity.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Miriya Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe MIRIYA ont en moyenne 38ans, 3enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à SANTORO I l’un des quartiers de SAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits divers, des habits, des produits artisanaux  et des produits alimentaires.
Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe MIRIYA sont à leur 4ème  prêt solidaire. MAH,1èrefemmeassisedela gauche vers la droite sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter5 paniers de papaye, 30Kgs de pomme de terre, 20Kgs d’oranger, 15Kgs de banane et 10Kgs d’igname. Elle s’approvisionne à Sikasso.Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de21000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the group MIRIYA average 38 years of age and three children each, all living in traditional extended families in SANTORO I, a district of SAN/SEGOU (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). These women know one another through ties of kinship, and they have businesses buying and selling a variety of goods, clothing, artisanal products, and grocery items.

After having correctly paid back their previous loans, the women of the group MIRIYA are now on their 4th solidarity loan. 

MAH, the woman first sitting from the left in the photo, intends to use her loan to purchase 5 baskets of papayas, 30 kg of potatoes, 20 kg of oranges, 15 kg of bananas, and 10 kg of yams. She makes her sales to men and women customers paying with cash and often credit. 

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 21,000 francs CFA that will be used to cover expenses related to healthcare, food, clothing, and schooling costs. The rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, such as papayas, potatoes, and yams.

loans.name: Grupo Las Creativas Group

texts.es:
De 37 años de edad ya con grandes aspiraciones en dar a conocer a su comunidad y a todos los que la visitan la actividad que ella realiza con tanto esfuerzo y dedicación, casada y vive con su esposo con el deseo de superar en la vida e alcanzar grandes sueños que ella quiere realizar en la vida, ella tiene cuatro hijos los primeros dos hijos ya tienen familias apartes y los dos últimos son excelentes estudiantes en la escuela de su comunidad, (Manuela es la que se encuentra de 1ra de  derecha a izquierda de la fotografía)
	
El trabajo que ella realiza con tanto esmero es la compra y venta de cortes típicas dicha actividad lo realiza en su casa y en lugares cercanos de su comunidad donde ella vive, ella lleva realizando dicha actividad durante 8 años, la segunda actividad que ella realiza es la venta de frutas negocio que realiza con una hermana por más de cinco años porque les genera una ganancia para el bienestar de su familia y mejorar las condiciones económicas de su familia y comunidad.

Ella ha sido un ejemplo en su comunidad y es por ello que un grupo de mujeres se han unido a manuela para poder emprender sus negocios para que cada uno de ellas pueda supera y tener ingresos importantes.

El uso que ella le dará al préstamo que ella está realizando es para la compra de mercadería de trajes típicas para luego venderlas por los alrededores de su comunidad. Uno de las aspiraciones de ella es tener un local en el mercado de su comunidad y ver que sus hijos se convierten en profesionales en la vida.
texts.en:
Manuela is 37 years old and has great aspirations of spreading the word in her community and to all its visitors about the work she does with such effort and determination. She is married and lives with her husband. She wants to make progress in life and achieve the big dreams she wants to accomplish in life.

She has four children; the two older ones have their own families now and the two younger ones are excellent students at the community primary school. Manuela is the first one on the right in the photo. The work she does with such care is buying and selling typical outfits. She works from home and in other places near to where she lives. She has been doing this for 8 years.

Her second job is selling fruit, a business which she has run with her sister for over 5 years because it gives them an income for the family's wellbeing and helps to improve the financial situation for her family and her community. She has been an example in her community and this is why a group of women have decided to join forces with Manuela in order to launch their businesses, so that each one of them can make progress and have a good income.

Manuela will use the loan she is requesting to buy items of typical clothing so she can sell them around the outskirts of her community.

One of her aspirations is to have a stall in the community market and to see her children become professionals in life.

loans.use: to buy items of traditional clothing.

loans.name: Aiymzhan

texts.ru: Айымжан, 64 года, замужем, дети взрослые, самостоятельные. У Айымжан средне-специальное образование, она много лет проработала бухгалтером, сейчас на пенсии, дополнительно занимается животноводством, на сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Айымжан есть 3 нетели, 15 овец и 8 бычков. У нее очень хорошие отзывы от соседей, как о доброй и трудолюбивой женщине. Доходы от сельского хозяйства позволили Айымжан начать строительство дома, однако, не хватает средств на внутреннюю и внешнюю отделку и утепление стен и покрытие пола. Поэтому Айымжан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку гипсокартона, ДСП для покрытия пола. Утепление стен позволит снизить расходы на отопление дома, и накопить средства на дальнейшее развитие бизнеса Айымжан.
texts.en:
Aiymzhan is 64 years old and married, and her children are grown and self-sufficient. Aiymzhan has a specialized secondary education. For many years, she worked as a bookkeeper, and now she is retired and additionally raises livestock. Aiymzhan currently has on her homestead three heifers, 15 sheep and eight steers. She has very good compliments from her neighbors as a kind and hardworking woman.

Income from the village homestead allowed Aiymzhan to start construction of a home, however, the money is not enough for interior and exterior decorations and for insulating the walls and flooring. Therefore, Aiymzhan applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 120,000 som (KGS) to purchase plasterboard and particle board for flooring. Wall insulation will reduce expenses for heating the home and save money for the further development of Aiymzhan's business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials for insulating the walls and making the floor in a new house for her family.

loans.name: Anjiliko

texts.ru: Анжилико молодая 24-летняя женщина. Она живет с маленьким ребенком у матери в районе Дж.Расулова города Худжанд. С ними также живет ее младшая сестра. Анжилико на протяжении 7 лет вместе с матерью занимается швейным делом. Они имеют помещение на центральном рынке района, где предоставляют свои услуги. Анжилико научилась шить разные фасоны платьев у своей матери. У них всегда достаточно клиентов, так как их швейное ателье расположено в многолюдном месте. Целью запрашиваемого кредита является покупка швейной машинки модели "Чайка". Анжилико хочет расширить деятельность и надеется на поддержку.
texts.en: Anjiliko is a young, 24-year-old woman. She lives with her small child with her mother in the J. Rasulov district's town of Khujand. Her younger sister also lives with them. Anjiliko and her mother have been involved in sewing for 7 years. They have a space at the district's central market, where they provide their services. Anjiliko learned how to sew various dress styles from her mother. They always have plenty of clients because their sewing atelier is located in a well-traveled place. The goal of the requested loan is a purchase of a sewing machine "Chayka." Anjiliko wants to expand her business and hopes for the support.

loans.use: to purchase a "Chayka" model sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a microwave and oven.

loans.name: Esperanza De Lacaya Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ESPERANZA DE LACAYA” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Achacachi, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Eusebia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de pescado, producción de leche, pesca, agricultura.
 
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Eusebia es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio agricultura; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su padre, quien trabajada hace varios años con este negocio, con el pasar del tiempo decide independizarse.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumento de capital (compra de semillas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de su comunidad y posteriormente lo implementará en su espacio de siembra. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene ocho hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece la institución
texts.en: The Communal Association “ESPERANZA DE LACAYA” is starting its second loan cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Focal Center of Achacachi. It is formed by eight members and it is led by a board of directors with Eusebia as its president. The businesses these members have are diverse; among some: sale of fish, milk production, fishing, agriculture. The loan they are requesting will benefit small business owners where Eusebia is a member. She states that she has been part of Pro Mujer for a year. She joined thanks to an invitation by a promoter of the institution who came to visit her at her home. Currently, she works in agriculture. She learned this business from her father who worked for many years in this business. Later, she decided to be independent. She will use the loan to increase her capital (to buy seeds at wholesale prices) that she will buy from wholesale sellers of her community, and later she will use them in her sowing field. This way of work allows her to generate resources to support her family, since she is married and has eight children. When they ask her what she likes from Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the training program offered by this institution.

loans.use: To buy seeds at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Lotomua

texts.en: Lotomua is a 37-year-old, married woman with three children. She makes and sells barbeque in her community to earn a living. She has three years of experience with this business. Lotomua needs a loan to buy a large freezer, a boil tank, a new barbeque grill, new pots, two gas bottles, paper plates and soft drinks. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Lotomua has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to buy a large freezer, a boil tank, a barbeque grill, pots, two gas bottles, paper plates and soft drinks.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es:
El señor Leonardo es dueño de un comercio, además se dedica a la actividad de servicio de transporte hace más de 5 años. 
Es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora que está luchando para poder crecer y salir adelante. Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en una aguateria.
texts.en:
Leonardo owns a store, and has also been engaged in transport services for the past 5 years. 

He a hard-working, enterprising person who is striving to grow and succeed. He is asking for this loan to in order to invest in a water supply business.

loans.use: to invest in a water supply business

loans.name: Muhabat

texts.ru: Мухабат вдова. Она имеет 3 совершеннолетних детей. Она занимается купле продажей фруктов и овощей на местном рынке. Мухабат покупает оптом фрукты из местных садоводов и продает в розницу. Ее рабочий день начинается рано утром, когда она оптом покупает овощи и фрукты. В течение дня она продает в розницу. Мухабат с бизнесом справляется сама. Ее сыновья являются трудовыми мигрантами в Российской Федерации. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для покупки фруктов и овощей. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Muhabat is a widow. She has 3 adult children. She is involved in reselling fruits and vegetables at a local market. Muhabat buys fruits wholesale from local orchids and sells them retail. Her workday begins early in the morning, when she buys vegetables and fruits. During the day, she sells them at retail prices. Muhabat manages the business by herself. Her sons are migrant workers in the Russian Federation. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 2000 somoni to buy fruits and vegetables. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables in order to increase her working capital

loans.name: Mauricio Antonio

texts.es: Mauricio de 56 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hija, el tiene un taller de costura ubicado en su lugar de residencia desde hace 40 años y esa experiencia le ha dado la capacidad necesaria para hacer muy bien su trabajo, el cliente esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de hilos, botones, telas, elásticos, etc. y así poder continuar con su trabajo que le genera muy buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Mauricio is 56 years old and resides in his own home along with his wife and daughter. He has a sewing workshop in his home where he has worked for the past 40 years. His experience has given him the necessary skills to perform his job very well.

Mauricio is requesting a loan in order to buy thread, buttons, fabric, elastic, and other supplies. This will allow him to continue his work so that he can generate a very good income.

loans.use: to buy thread, buttons, fabric, elastic, and other supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizers for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Lagi

texts.en: Lagi is a 74-year-old widow with eight children. She owns and operates a small store, selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for five years. Lagi needs a loan to buy snacks, soft drinks, canned food, frozen goods, a new display fridge and bags of sugar. She hopes to use her profits to pay for the renovation of her house. She became a member of SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, soft drinks, canned food, frozen goods, a new display fridge and bags of sugar.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en: Anecita is a married woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Anecita is 41 years old and her child is currently in school. She has a business raising livestock in the Philippines. Anecita has requested a PHP 26,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy vaccines and vitamins for her livestock. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Anecita has been in this business for 19 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy vaccines and vitamins for her cattle.

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en:
Annaliza is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Annaliza is 31 years old and has two children who are in school.

Annaliza has a general store business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 29,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Annaliza has been in this business for nine years. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Eledita

texts.en:
Eledita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a furniture-making business in the Philippines.

Eledita requested a PHP 20,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional materials for her business, like wood, nails, and paint.

Eledita has been in this business for three years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Eledita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her business, like wood, nails, and paint.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en: Isabel works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. Isabel has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for four years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Isabel would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Santa Del Carmen

texts.es:
Santa de 34 años de edad, estudio hasta 3° grado, ya que sus padres, no tenían los recursos económicos y sumado a esto la escuela más cercana estaba a casi 2,000 mts de su casa. Ella es madre soltera de 2 niños de 12 y 5 años de edad, ya que su esposo, la abandono y solo ella ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos.

Santa es una persona, que ha sufrido mucho, pero eso no la ha detenido a que se supere, es por eso que posee mucha experiencia en la siembra de maíz y frijol, actividad que fue aprendiendo de su padre, quien desde pequeña le ayudaba a realizar la siembra de estos cultivos. Así mismo, fue aprendiendo a criar ganado, ya que su padre también tenía experiencia en esto. Ahora Santa produce una 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y otros 7,000 de frijol, de esta forma asegura parte de la alimentación para el próximo año de su familia y le corresponde caminar 600 mts hasta los terrenos donde cultiva. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar semilla, fertilizantes e insecticidas para cultivar frijol. 

Santa desea seguir progresando y es por eso que continuara trabajando, para sacar adelante a sus hijos y que puedan estudiar, porque dice que es la mejor herencia que pudiera ofrecerles. Además le gustaría tener más ganado.
texts.en:
Santa, 34 years old, studied up to 3rd grade because her parents did not have economic resources, and on top of that, the closest school was almost 2,000 meters from her house. She is a single mother of 2 children ages 12 and 5; her husband abandoned her and she alone has managed to raise her children. 
Santa has suffered a lot, but that has not stopped her from improving herself; that is why she has a lot of experience in cultivating corn and beans, which she learned from her father, who helped her plant these crops when she was a child. Also, she learned to raise cattle, as her father also had experience in this. Now Santa produces 7,000 square meters of corn and another 7,000 of beans, which ensures part of her family’s food supply for the next year. She walks 600 meters to get to the fields where she grows her crops. 
The loan she is requesting is to buy seeds, fertilizer, and insecticide to grow beans. 
Santa wants to keep progressing, and that's why she will continue to work, in order to raise her children and make it possible for them to study, because she says this is the best legacy that she could offer them. Also she would like to have more cattle.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, and insecticide to grow beans.

loans.name: Ailao

texts.en:
Ailao is 34 years old and married with 5 children. She makes and sells elei printed material to earn a living and has been doing this for 1 year. 

Ailao has requested a loan to buy fabric paint, stencils, wooden carved designs, rubber designs, materials and a new cutter. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's living expenses. She joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: buy supplies for her fabric print business

loans.name: Mafi

texts.en: Mafi is a 34-year-old woman who is unmarried with three children. She runs a small tailoring business in her community. She has two years of experience with this business. Mafi has requested a loan to buy rolls of material, scissors, a sewing machine, needles, thread and a new measuring tape. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy rolls of material, scissors, a sewing machine, needles, thread and a new measuring tape.

loans.name: Moana

texts.en:
Moana is 41 years old and married with 7 children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she sells in her community or at the market.  She has been doing this for 1 year. 

Moana needs a loan to buy sprayers, chemicals, a spade, crops, boots, a machete and a tiller. She has been a member of SPBD since 2014.  Moana will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's living expenses.

loans.use: to buy sprayers, chemicals, a spade, crops, boots, a machete and a tiller.

loans.name: Edward

texts.es:
Edward tiene 34 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rustico, vive con su conyugue y sus 2 menores hijos, él es natural de la zona, cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales. Edward vive en la parte rural del distrito de Pucará contando con servicios de agua y luz. En dicho distrito está ubicado en Pucará, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza Edward es el transporte de pasajeros mediante mototaxi, cuenta con movilidad propia, la actividad lo realiza en rutas de las Pucara- Cabuyas, tiene 05 años en este rubro, además realiza trabajos agrícolas el cual ayudará a pagar el crédito con normalidad. El destino del crédito será para invertir en su domicilio y en hacer arreglos a su movilidad, con ello le generará mayores ingresos y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida. Para este rubro no hay mayor competencia en la zona y con ello obtiene mejores precios.
texts.en:
Edward is 34 years old and resides in his own house made of basic materials. Living with him are his wife and their two young children. Edward is a native of the area and has many good personal and work references. He lives in the rural section of the District of Pucará, which receives running water and electricity. The District of Pucará is located in Jaén Province, which is in the region of Cajamarca in the northern mountains of Peru.

Edward’s business involves transporting passengers with the use of a motorcycle taxi. He has his own vehicle. Edward travels along the routes from Pucara to Cabuyas. He has been in this line of work for five years. In addition, he engages in farm work to help make his regular loan payments.

The purpose of this loan is to invest in his home and to make repairs to his vehicle. This will help him to generate more income so that he can improve his quality of life. In his line of work, there is no major competition in the area, so he is able to charge the best prices.

loans.use: to pay for vehicle repairs and to invest in his home.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: Francisca is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business raising livestock in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional livestock and other supplies for her business. Francisca has been in this business for two years. She also earns more income from food vending. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Francisca has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Wenefreda

texts.en:
Wenefreda is 40 years old and has two children who are in school.  She is in the agricultural business, fattening and selling pigs in the Philippines.  

Wenefreda requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.  She has been in this pig fattening business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.  She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Wenefreda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future for her family.

loans.use: buy pig feed and vitamins

loans.name: Erna

texts.en:
Erna is 56 years old and married with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  

Ema has a general store business in the Philippines.    She requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.  She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Erna has been in this business for 6 years.  She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future for her family.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Runa

texts.en:
Runa is a 28-year-old married woman with two children, one of whom is currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Runa has a general store business in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional stocks like canned goods, beers, sanitary pads, diapers, noodles, fabric conditioners, toothpaste, etc. to sell.   She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Runa has been in this business for 5 years.  She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Geraldine works hard to support her family.  She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. 

Geraldine is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.  She successfully paid back her previous loans and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Geraldine has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 50 years old, married, and has three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 29,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Evelyn has borrowed and paid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from providing jeepney transportation services.

Evelyn aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Bimaladebi

texts.en:
Bimaladebi is a 55-year-old widow from the village of Raipara in Jalpaiguri district. She lives with her only son who is associated with a business of making and selling wooden furniture. Bimaladebi is uneducated and due to economic stringency her son is also deprived of education. After her husband's death Bimaladebi’s only concern was to look after her only son and provide him with basic needs.  This determination and dedication acted as fuel in her life. 

She had a great desire to be involved in dairy farming as she had an experience of livestock breeding in her parent's home. She started with a dairy cow and she sells milk to her neighbors who are her only clients. However, in spite of their employment, the family lives in poverty and finds it hard to cover even their basic needs. 

She has requested a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) for her existing business. Bimaladebi plans to purchase another dairy cow with the requested amount and then to produce milk products (butter, cottage cheese, curd etc.) and start selling them. She will sell products at good prices and will have her own customers. 

Bimaladebi and her son rely on the goodwill of Kiva lenders and will be thankful to them for giving them a chance to live in better conditions. She wants to buy a small piece of land with the profit from her business and she is grateful to her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for her animal husbandry.

loans.name: Kalyani

texts.en:
Kalyani is a 48-year-old and hails from Dhupguri. She is married and the mother of a son. She lives with her family of two in West Magurmari in the district of Jalpaiguri. Kalyani and her husband Siben have primary education. They could not continue to study as their parents could not afford it. 

Her husband is a trader of greengrocery items; he purchases items from the wholesale market and sells them in the market. This business offers him a very minimum income. Kalyani is an active and energetic woman. A few years ago, in a search for a source of additional income for her family, she started a milk business. She sells milk to her locality and through her hard work she has achieved great success in her business and now earns a monthly income which is adequate for their family. Kalyani sells good quality milk, which is in high demand among local residents. 

Since demand is growing, she has turned to BJS ( Kiva's partner) for a loan to buy an additional milking cow. She plans to use the profits from the loan to further develop her business and to upgrade their mud and straw house to a concrete one. She is grateful to her lenders for their financial assistance.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow to increase her milk-selling business.

loans.name: Emeline

texts.en:
Emeline is a 21-year-old  unmarried woman with 2 children. She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has 1 year of experience with this business. 

Emeline needs a loan to buy bags of flour, sugar, a large frying pan, a new oven, cooking oil, a strainer and new pots. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's living expenses.  Emeline has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.use: buy supplies for her food business

loans.name: Flores De Ventilla Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLORES DE VENTILLA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Victoria es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de abarrotes, venta de queso, venta de pollos por mayor, servicio de internet, costura de banderas, venta de fruta, venta de accesorios personales, venta de cosméticos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Victoria es integrante, ella indica que es el primer ciclo que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción masiva de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de queso; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace dos años y actualmente es muy productivo por lo que decidió ampliar su mercadería. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de queso por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "FLORES DE VENTANILLA" communal bank will begin its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Santiago II regional hub. The group consists of eight members and is led by a board of directors, where Victoria is the chairwoman.
 
The businesses in which the members of the group work are varied. They include running a grocery store, selling cheese, selling chickens wholesale, providing internet service, sewing flags, selling fruit, selling personal accessories, and selling cosmetics. 

The loan that the group will take out will benefit the owners of microbusinesses, including Victoria. She says that this is her first cycle with Pro Mujer and that she became a member at the invitation of a massive promotion held by the institution. Currently, Victoria has a business selling cheese; she mentions that she started the business two years ago, and now it is very productive. For this reason, she has decided to expand her merchandise.   

The loan that she will take out is to increase her capital by purchasing cheese wholesale, which she will acquire from the wholesale vendors from the city of La Paz. She will then sell the product at her retail space. This type of work allows her to generate the means to support her family, as she lives in a common-law marriage and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the savings offered by the institution.

loans.use: to purchase cheese wholesale.

loans.name: Ema

texts.en:
Ema is a 21-year-old single woman with no children.  She runs a small canteen in her community to earn a living. She has 1 year of experience with this business. 

Ema needs a loan to buy sandwiches, pies, donuts, snacks, coffee, a large boiler and soft drinks. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's living expenses. Ema has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.use: buy food to resell

loans.name: Lonelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Lonelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs and farming vegetables. Lonelyn is borrowing 10,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to buy fish to sell in her stall for her fish vending business.

Lonelyn has received one previous loan from NWTF to help her sustain her business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Haidilita

texts.en:
Haidilita is 32 years old and married with four children.   She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. 

Haidilita is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.  She  has been in pig fattening for 5 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

Haidilita successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.  She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy pig feed and vitamins

loans.name: Ken

texts.en:
Ken works hard to support her family. Ken is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 5 years now.

Ken requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, coffee, milk, juice, cereals, detergent soap, etc. to sell.  She successfully paid back her previous loans and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Ken would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
Sofía de 64 años de edad, debido a que su familia tenía problemas económicos, solo pudo estudiar hasta 1° grado, su esposo es agricultor, tienen 3 hijos y 2 de ellos están en el extranjero.

Sofía es comerciante, tiene 10 años vendiendo pupusas negocio que ella misma inicio. El préstamo será utilizado para cancelar deudas personales, ya que presto dinero para la compra de mesas, sillas y cocina de plancha para su negocio.

Una vez cancelada su deuda, espera volver a invertir en su pupuseria, para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sofía is 64 years old. Since her family had financial problems, she was only able to study through the first grade. Her husband is farmer. They have three children, two of whom are living abroad.

Sofía is a merchant who has been in the business of selling “pupusas” (stuffed tortillas) for 10 years. Her loan will be used to pay off personal debts. The money she had borrowed was used to purchase tables, chairs, and a cooktop for her business.

Once her debt is repaid, she hopes to invest in her “pupusa” business so that she can provide better service to her customers.

loans.use: to pay off personal debts.

loans.name: Krishna

texts.en:
Krishna is 21 years old. She is from Dhupguri. She studied till 6th grade in the village secondary school. Now she is married and is a housewife. She is blessed with one young son, who has not yet been admitted to school. They live in their own house in West Magurmari in Jalpaiguri district. 

Krishna's husband, 25-year-old Madan, works as a decorator for social events. He uses this business to generate an income to support his family. He started the business on his own initiative following his innate creative abilities in the area of design and decoration. His customers request the decoration of weddings, children's birthday parties, religious and political gatherings etc. Every day he works at his business so that he can achieve his goal to provide financial sustenance to his family. His greatest challenge is obtaining customers in his small village.

Currently his wife Krishna is applying for a Kiva loan; through their field partner BJS. She will use it to buy tablecloths, tables and chairs, mattress, flower vases etc. She intends to decorate the furniture in her husband's small shop, which he runs from their house, so he can rent them out. With this loan she plans to offer a higher quality lifestyle to her family.

She wants to reinvest the profit to further grow the business. Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase decorating materials for her husband's business.

loans.name: Khunthea Group

texts.en:
A young woman from Siem Reap Province, Kunthea is 23 years old and the mother of a young child. Her main sources of income are rice farming and pig raising. She can earn about 23,300 KHR per day from this business, which she has had for a long time.

For Kunthea, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of three members to get a new loan. As a group leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to build a decent latrine. She hopes that her family will be living in better health than before.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more of goats to raise and sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more of livestock to raise.

loans.name: Channa

texts.en:
Living in a rural area in Kampong Speu province, Channa is a mother of three children. She secures the need in her family via rice cropping on a one-and-a-half-hectare area. Moreover, her husband earns more income to support the family via selling junk items. 

This is the second loan cycle for Channa with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loan wisely to improve her living condition at a gradual pace. 

She will spend her entire loan portion to pay the school fee for her nephew, who wants to pursue his bachelor’s degree, majoring in General Management. She hopes that her nephew can get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay the school fee for her nephew, who wants to pursue a bachelor’s degree in General Management.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita is 60 years old, married and lives in Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. She raises pigs to earn a living. She obtained the capital to purchase her original piglets and feed. Now, she requests a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy additional feed. She hopes and prays that her business will grow and benefit her family, in addition to the income of her husband. Someday, she wants to build a concrete pig cage to maintain more sanitary conditions.

loans.use: To buy additional bags of feed

loans.name: Ederlinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Ederlinda works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell charcoal and nipa roofing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Ederlinda is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to purchase more nipa and charcoal to sell for her buy and sell charcoal and nipa roofing business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested additional loan to further build her business.

Ederlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of nipa and charcoal to sell

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en: As a parent of two children, Maricel works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Maricel is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy new fishing bundles for her fishing business. Maricel has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new fishing bundles for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more goats to raise and sell to butchers

loans.name: Wadih

texts.en:
Wadih is an 31 year old Palestinian refugee who grew up with his parents in a Palestinian refugee camp located in South Lebanon. He is single and lives with his parents who stopped working. 
Growing up as a Palestinian refugee in an extremely unstable political and social setting, Wadih ambitiously completed his studies and started his own business in the constructions industry. For more than 8 years, he has been specializing his work in floor and wall tiling. 
Wadih is asking for a 2,313,998 Lebanese pounds loan for the first time from Kiva partner Ibdaa. He plans to use the loan to expand his toolkit by buying necessary construction equipment such as a tile cutter and a generator. 
This way, Wadih will be able to cut on tools renting costs, improve his productivity and increase his income which will allow him to improve his wife and children's living conditions.

loans.use: to expand his toolkit with necessary construction tools

loans.name: Han

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Han is a 60-year-old mother of five children. She is a rice farmer in the local area while her husband works as a paid worker to earn additional income. She has been in the business for 42 years. 

This is the first loan for Han with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is​ now applying for a loan to buy solar panels for lighting her house. She hopes to improve her living condition.

loans.use: To buy solar panels for lighting her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more goats in order to raise and sell them in the local markets for a good profit.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Lucia, tiene 36 años de edad, tiene 1 hijo, es madre soltera, y reside en una aldea de la comunidad de Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. Cuenta con su propia fuente de ingresos de una pulpería establecida en su casa. En este negocio ofrece productos como ser, azúcar, arroz, harina, papel, pan, dulces, productos enlatados, etc. con el fin de aumentar su inventario y las ventas ha decidido solicitar un préstamo de 4,500 lempiras para comprar granos básicos, azúcar, café, pan, dulces, golosinas, para vender. Ha planeado hacer crecer el negocio para darle lo mejor a su hijo.
texts.en:
Lucia is 36 years old and has one child. She is a single mother and resides in a neighborhood in the community of Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara.

Lucia generates her own income by operating a store that is set up in her home. In her business, she offers products such as sugar, rice, flour, paper, bread, sweets, canned goods, and other items. She wants to increase her inventory and sales, so she has decided to request a loan of 4,500 HNL in order to buy basic grains, sugar, coffee, bread, sweets, and snack foods to sell.

Lucia plans to grow her business so that she can provide the best for her child.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, sugar, coffee, bread, sweets, and snack foods to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more goats to raise and sell.

loans.name: Romanita

texts.en: Romanita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell salted and fresh eggs business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF to buy additional fresh and salted eggs to sell for her business. Romanita has been in this business for three years. She also earns more income from pig fattening. Romanita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fresh and salted eggs to sell.

loans.name: Isavilita

texts.en: Isavilita is 57 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.  Isavilita has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Yaneth Del Carmen

texts.es:
Yaneth de 34 años de edad, estudio hasta 9° grado, está casada, su esposo es agricultor y tienen 2 hijos de 5 y 2 años de edad. 


Yaneth tiene mucha experiencia en la agricultura, ya que desde la edad de 10 años, ayudaba a su padre en la siembra de maíz y frijol y toda su vida se ha dedicado a esta actividad y cuando se caso aprendió las técnicas de manejo de otros cultivos que anteriormente no conocía. Tal es el caso de cultivos de tomate, chile dulce, loroco, pepino, sorgo y papaya, gracias a que su esposo es un agricultor que también posee mucha experiencia y entre los dos, han sabido compartir sus conocimientos, para lograr salir adelante y aumentar sus producciones en cultivos que no son muy tradicionales. Los terrenos donde cultivan están en las cercanías de su casa y no es muy largo el recorrido que hacen para llegar a su lugar de trabajo.


El crédito será utilizado para comprar semilla, fertilizantes e insecticidas, para realizar la siembra de frijol. 

El sueño de Yaneth es tener un terreno donde construir su casa, poder sembrar sus cultivos y tener ganado, también le gustaría tener un sistema de riego, para sembrar en época de verano, cultivos que son rentables en esa época.
texts.en:
34-year-old Yaneth studied to ninth grade. She is married to a farmer and they have 2 children aged 5 and 2. 


Yaneth has plenty of experience in farming since, from the aged of 10, she helped her father to grow corn and beans. She has dedicated her whole life to the business and, when she got married, she learned the techniques required to grow other crops which did not know before. This is the case with tomatoes, sweet chiles, loroco, cucumber, sorghum and papayas, because her husband is also an experienced farmer. They have shared their knowledge with each other and this has helped them make progress and boost their production of less traditional crops. The land they farm is close to where they live and their journey to where they work is not very long.

They will use the loan to buy seeds, fertiliser and insecticide for their bean crops.

Yaneth's dream us to own a plot of land on which she can build a house, sow her crops and raise cattle. She would also like to have an irrigation system so that, in summer, she can co grow crops which are profitable at that time of year.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertiliser and insecticide for her bean crop.

loans.name: Mirian Vanesa

texts.es:
Mirian de 34 años de edad, Estudio hasta 3° grado de educación básica, está casada y tiene 3 hijos de los que solo dos estudian, 1° grado de educación básica y 9°grado de educación básica, con ellos vive su madre que por las tardes vende pupusas.

Mirian trabaja con su esposo en una fábrica, y por las tardes trabaja con su madre en la pupuseria, además, 2 días a la semana lava ropa ajena para obtener ingresos que ayuden a la economía familiar.

El préstamo será invertido en el negocio de la pupuseria comprar de maíz para también vender tortillas, además hacer unas reparaciones a la casa.
texts.en:
Mirian is 34 years old and studied through the third grade of her basic education. She is married and has three children, but only two of them are in school. One is in the first grade and the other is in the ninth grade. Mirian and her family live with her mother, who sells “pupusas” (stuffed tortillas) in the afternoons.

Mirian works with her husband at a factory and then helps her mother in the afternoons at her “pupusa” business. She also devotes two days a week to doing other people’s laundry as a way of earning extra income to help with her family’s finances.

Her loan will be invested in the “pupusa” business. Mirian will buy corn since she also sells tortillas. In addition, she plans to make a few repairs to her house.

loans.use: to buy corn for her "pupusa" and tortilla business.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
Aurora is 59 years old, married, and works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from farming rice and operating a general store. Aurora is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional gasoline, fishing nets, etc. for her fishing business. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now has requested this additional loan to further build her business.

Aurora has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional gasoline, fishing nets, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials in order to make repairs and do maintenance work on her old house

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 36 years old and married with one child. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Josephine is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She has been farming rice for five years and also earns additional income from selling vegetables. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to build and expand her business and to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Julie Fe

texts.en: Julie Fe is 24 years old and married. She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Julie Fe is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been pig fattening for three years and also earns additional income from selling vegetables. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to build and expand her business, and to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more goats in order to raise them to further expand his business and help him provide his family with a better future.

loans.name: Flor De Amapolas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE AMAPOLAS” iniciará el décimo séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Angélica es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: costura de colchones, tienda de barrio, venta de galletas, tienda de productos lácteos, tejido de mantas de hilo y alpaca, venta de frutas, venta de api.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Angélica es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su cuñada que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de pan; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años al apoyarle a su padre en su negocio, con el pasar del tiempo decide emprender su propio negocio. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de pan por mayor) que adquirirá de las panadería de su zona y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la atención  que ofrece el personal de la institución.
texts.en:
The AC "FLOR DE AMPOLAS" is beginning it's seventeenth cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Santiago II. It is made up of eight members and is managed by a board of which Angelica is the secretary. The businesses run by the communal association's members include: sewing mattresses, local shops, selling biscuits, dairy shop, weaving thread and alpaca blankets, selling fruit, selling celery. 

The loan they receive will be used to help small micro entrepreneurs of whom Angelica is a member. She says that she joined Pro Mujer five years ago, at the invitation of her sister-in-law who is one of the institution's clients. She currently runs a business selling bread and says that she started a number of years ago by helping her father in his shop and, after a time, she decided to set up her own business. 

She will use this loan to increase her capital (to buy bread wholesale) from local bakeries and she will then sell it from her sales area. This type of work allows her to generate an income to support her family financially, as she lives with her partner and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes the care offered by the institution's staff.

loans.use: To buy bread wholesale

loans.name: Nisa

texts.en: As a married parent of four children, Nisa works hard to support her family.
