She has a buy and sell vegetable business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a motorcycle transport.  She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall business. Nisa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money, so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Tita

texts.en: Tita is 61 years old and married. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.  Tita has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from buying and selling fish. Tita aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en: As a married parent of five children, Trinidad works hard to support her family. She has a buy and sell vegetable business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Trinidad is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of vegetables to sell for her business. She has successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business. Trinidad has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Alo

texts.en:
Alo is a 30-year-old woman who lives in a small village of the Jalpaiguri district. Her family consists of her husband and one lovely daughter. Both Alo and her husband Baren have secondary education. Their daughter is in grade eight in the village school.

Alo is a housewife. Her husband is associated with a wood business. He purchases wood from the villagers. He resells to the retail customers and different furniture shops. He established this retail business many years back and has been continuing until now. He works at the business every day from morning until night. His major problem is capital, as the prices of wood are increasing day by day, so he could not enhance his business.

To help her husband to continue with his business, Alo has taken a loan from BJS.  She plans to utilize the loan to buy timber from the villagers for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her family's living conditions. In the future, she plans to expand her business on a large scale, and with the profit, she will make a concrete house for them.

She thanks her lenders (BJS and Kiva) for their support.

loans.use: to purchase more wood for their existing business.

loans.name: Rekha

texts.en:
Rekha is a 29-year-old woman from Dhupguri. She is blessed with two sons. Rekha had attended school up to grade eight, but due to poverty, she could not continue her studies. Now she is married to Chandan, and they are raising their sons together. She is fully concerned with her children’s education, and always inspires them for further studies. She sends her sons to school. 

Rekha’s husband is involved in the nursery business. He buys seeds and seedlings from the wholesale market, grows them into a usable size, and then sells them to the market and in his neighborhood. Her husband has been very much interested in gardening from his childhood days; that is why he started this business and began to give financial support to the family. Rekha also assists her husband in his business.

Now they want to grow their business. Thus, Rekha applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase more variety of seedlings for her nursery. She hopes it will enable them to attain more profit to upgrade her family’s financial status and give a better future to her children. She dreams to enhance her business project further with the outcome profit.

She is grateful and thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase more seedlings and necessary supplies for her nursery business.

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en: Beverly is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials for her business. Beverly has been in this business for six years. She also earns more income from buying and selling fish. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business. Beverly has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to build a house for her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for her business.

loans.name: Soma

texts.en:
Soma is a 28-year-old housewife who lives in the small village of East Magurmari in Dhupguri, West Bengal, in their own small house. She is married to Rajkumar. They are blessed with three children (one son and two daughters); all of them go to school.

Soma is a housewife, and her husband is a cycle-van puller. He carries loads and people on his cycle-van and earns for the family. A cycle-van is a kind of carriage that is pulled using a bicycle and is widely used in rural areas by the regional people. But, his income is low, and it is difficult to maintain the family’s income and the educational expenses of their children. Thus, her husband thought to purchase another cycle-van and give the old one in rent, from which the income will be more.

Then Soma came to know about BJS (Kiva’s partner) and has taken a loan to purchase a cycle-van for her husband. Now they hope to have a better income than previously. Their future dream is to strengthen their family’s economy and admit their children to renowned schools to become professionals.

Her full thanks go to BJS as well as Kiva for giving the loan.

loans.use: to purchase a cycle-van for carrying goods and people.

loans.name: Mariafe

texts.en: Mariafe is 40 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Mariafe is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies. She has been farming rice for three years and also earns additional income from fishing. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to build and expand her business, and to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda is 47 years old and married with six children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.  Imelda has borrowed and repaid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from farming rice. Imelda aspires to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Kilisitina

texts.en:
Kilisitina is a 34-year-old, single woman, with no children. To earn a living, she makes and sells chicken pies and meat pies in her community. She has two years of experience with this business. 

Kilisitina needs a loan to buy boneless chicken, soy sauce, fresh meat, a large frying pan, and a new oven. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Kilisitina has been a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) since 2012.

loans.use: to buy boneless chicken, soy sauce, fresh meat, a large frying pan, and a new oven.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 29-year-old, married man from Khanoyonis. He is a father for two small sons. Mohammad is an employee in a local firm where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family’s needs. He also has a barbershop, which has been opened for few years. It is a good business, and it gives the family a good income. Mohammad took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new chair for his barbershop. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to improve his business and attract more clients.  Mohammad appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new chair for his barbershop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to rebuild the kitchen, install pipelines, and to buy glass and planks for renovating his home.

loans.name: Bisheshwari

texts.en:
Bisheshwari is a 32-year-old mother of four sons. She lives with her husband, Gajen, and children in a small village of Dhupguri, in rural West Bengal. She is illiterate, and only can sign her name. She is an energetic, enthusiastic lady who always tries to generate more income for the wellbeing of her family. All of her children go to school.  She is very much optimistic with her children. She hopes her children will lead a better life with good education. 

Bisheshwari’s husband drives a cycle-van for transportation service in the village in order to make a living. It is a kind of cycle-operated transport, which is used in rural West Bengal to carry loads and people to other villages and local markets. He has been operating this business for many years to earn income for the family. Now their children are growing older, so the cost of the family is also increasing. Thus, her husband decided to expand his business to generate more income for the family. 

Bisheshwari decided to help her husband thus: she is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase a new cycle-van to be used for expansion of her husband's business. She hopes this loan amount will provide more income. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the family and to bear on the educational expenses of her children.

Bisheshwari and her husband are very much happy after getting the loan and thankful to both BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a cycle-van for her husband.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria es madre soltera, sus 4 hijos tienen 9, 16, 19 y 22 años de edad, su hijo que tiene 9 años asiste a la escuela y los 3 mayores trabajan el jornal ya que por falta de recursos económicos no pudieron seguir sus estudios, ella es una señora colombiana que se vino a Ecuador por motivo que en Colombia existen muchos conflictos y no se tiene una vida tranquila, Gloria necesita el crédito para invertir en la compra de una vaca, ya que se dedica a esta actividad para mantener a sus hijos y tiene  otro ingreso   del trabajo que realiza de mesera en un restaurante, lo que aspira Gloria es seguir trabajando y darle el estudio a su hija que en la actualidad  asiste  a la escuela.
texts.en:
Gloria is a single mother with 4 children, ages 9, 16, 19, and 22.  Her nine-year-old attends school, and the three older children work as day laborers, as they were unable to continue their studies due to the lack of economic resources. 

She is a Colombian lady who came to Ecuador because there are many conflicts in Colombia, and life is not peaceful there.  

Gloria needs the loan in order to invest in the purchase of a cow. She devotes herself to this occupation in order to support her children, and she has another income from working as a waitress.

Gloria aspires to continue working, and to provide an education for her daughter, who is currently attending school.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials to repair and do maintenance of his old house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more goats in order to raise and sell them in the local markets to make a good profit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new chair and some tools for his barbershop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as iron and steel to expand and complete the building of her house.

loans.name: Shoira

texts.ru:
Шоира трудолюбивая и позитивная женщина в возрасте 42 лет. Она замужем и имеет пятерых детей. Вместе со своей семьёй Шоира живёт в сельской деревушке в небольшом доме. Так как семья у них очень большая, все трудятся как могут, чтобы приносить в дом доход на проживание.

Сама Шоира занимается своим делом. Она работает на местном рынке, занимается купле продажей орехов. Старший сын вместе со своим отцом работают строителями. От данной работы также они получают дополнительный доход. Но сейчас муж Шоиры сильно заболел и нуждается в хорошем лечении. Для этого необходимы денежные средства, но у Шоиры на данный момент не имеется необходимой суммы денежных средств. Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку необходимых медикаментов для лечения своего мужа. Шоира заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку и очень надеется на положительный результат.
texts.en:
Shoira is a hardworking and positive woman of the age of 42. She is married and has five children. She lives in a small house in a rural village together with her family. As the family is very big, all tries as they can to bring income for living expenses into the home. 

Shoira has her own business. She works at the local market with selling nuts. The eldest son works as a carpenter together with his father. They receive an additional income from this work. 

However, currently Shoira's husband has become very sick and needs good treatment. This requires monetary resources, but Shoira does not currently have the necessary amount. Therefore she turned to Arvand and would like to receive a loan to purchase necessary medicine for treatment. 

Shoira thanks Arvand in advance for the support and hopes very much for good result.

loans.use: to buy medicine for her husband's treatment

loans.name: Samar

texts.en: Samar is a 49-year-old married woman living with her family, which consists of five members. Her husband owns a dry cleaning store. Samar has been selling clothes for two years in order to help her husband financially. This business was profitable to her and became their second source of income as she is importing her products from outside the country. Samar is aiming to expand her business until she can open her own clothes shop in the future. To do so, she needs to raise her profit and to expand her merchandise. So she is now requesting a loan to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Basma

texts.en: Because Basma is a conservative lady, she asked her husband to appear in the photo instead. Basma is a 48-year-old married woman living with her family, which consists of five members. Her husband works at a private company. Basma has been helping her husband in paying their household bills for one year by selling blankets at her house. She sells blankets to her neighbors and friends. Because her business became well-known in her neighborhood, she started to get more requests from her customers. Now she is out of blankets, and because she doesn’t have enough money to buy more, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy more blankets to sell.

loans.name: Ihab

texts.en:
Ihab is a 22-year-old single man from the city of Khan Younis, where he lives with his family in a small house. Ihab is an agent for prepaid mobile services; he transfers credit for his clients online. It is a good business and easy for him.

Ihab has taken out a loan from FATEN to help him to buy a new laptop to replace the old one. By taking this loan, Ihab will be able to do his work in an efficient way. This will increase his income and improve his living conditions. Ihab appears in the photo with his new laptop

loans.use: to buy a new laptop to replace the old one

loans.name: Amandina

texts.es:
La socia Amandina continua dedicándose a su  negocio de artesania,la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia a la vez continua trabajando como profesora, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar telares entre otros.
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member, Amandina, continues working in her artisanal crafts business. She has been dedicating a lot of time to her business which has been showing progress thanks to the hard effort that she invests every day. She has also continued her work as a teacher and hopes to continue working in order to support her family.

The member is requesting a loan to purchase woven items amongst other things.

The member is happy and she promises to make her loan payments.

loans.use: to purchase woven items amongst other things.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 46-year-old single woman living with her family. She has been sewing clothes for ten years, and it has become a source of income for her family.  

Mariam is seeking to open her own sewing workshop in the future.  To do so, she needs to expand her business more by attracting more customers. She needs to purchase more sewing tools to raise her productivity and profit and to be able to add variety to her products.

She is also well-known in her neighborhood for the delicious pickles she makes.   She wants to buy more raw materials to make more pickles that her customers has been requesting.  However, she doesn’t have enough money to do so. 

For these reasons, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to purchase more sewing tools for her sewing business and raw materials for making pickles.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 20-year-old single young man from Khan Younis. He lives with his parents in a humble house. His father works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs. Ahmad is a university student where he studies English literature. He would like to take the BA degree and work as a teacher.

Ahmad took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Ahmad will be able to read more online articles and write his reports. Ahmad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Lalo Vitorino

texts.es:
El socio Lalo Vitorino continua dedicándose al negocio de carpinteria,el socio lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio ,el socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para comprar madera entre otros.
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member, Lalo Vitorino, continues to make a living in carpentry. The member has been working in this business for years and he has been doing well thanks to the effort made every day. The member hopes to continue working so that he can support his family. 

The member is requesting a loan to purchase wood amongst other things.

Lalo Vitorino is happy for the loan and he promises to comply with his repayment schedule.

loans.use: to purchase wood amongst other things.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to reinforce the walls of his house

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Divina works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns an additional income from pig fattening. Divina is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to  buy an additional fishing net for her fishing business.

Divina has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy an additional fishing net.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to decorate and do some maintenance for her kindergarten

loans.name: Jehad

texts.en: Jehad is a 41-year-old married man and the only provider for his family consisting of five members. He has been running his own mini-market for two years and it is the family's only source of income. Jehad is seeking to expand his market in the future to raise his productivity and profit. He needs to add variety to his products in order to raise his income and attract more customers. He has applied for this loan because he doesn’t have enough money to buy new products to expand his market.

loans.use: To buy new products to expand his mini-market

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a 55-year-old married woman living with her family, which consists of six members, in Tafila, Jordan. She has been running her minimarket for five years, and it has been a good source of income for her family. 

Halima is seeking to expand her minimarket to raise her profit. To do so, she needs to add variety to her products, and respond to some of her customers’ requests. However, she doesn’t have enough money to do so. For that reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to stock her minimarket with new products.

loans.name: Miguel Viceriano

texts.es:
Miguel tiene 29 años de edad, el es una hombre emprendedor y decidido para poder superar en la vida, el no se deja vencer por los obstáculos que la vida le pone sino el alcanza todo sus mentas y sueños, el tiene un hijos de un año de edad y se ha convertido en el motivo para que Miguel se levante todos los días para trabajar y solo así tener un ingreso económico para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia. 	

El obtiene sus ingresos económicos por medio de la producción de maxan en la comunidad donde el vive, sus padres le enseñaron dicha actividad desde hace 10 años, el realiza la venta de su producto en el mercado y en los alrededores de su comunidad y así tener un ingreso económico para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.

El uso respectivo que le dará al crédito es para la compra de terreno para poder cultivar mas maxan en su comunidad, ya que para el es de mucha importancia que sus plantas de maxan produzcan hojas de primera calidad y así no perder a los clientes con que el cuenta.

Una de las grandes aspiraciones de el es la siembra de más plantas de maxan y ver crecer a su hijo en el campo de la educación y convertirse en profesionales en la vida.
texts.en:
Miguel is 29 years old. He is an enterprising man, who is determined to succeed in life. He doesn't allow himself to be overcome by the obstacles that life puts in his way. Instead, he achieves all his goals and dreams. Miguel has a one-year-old child, who has become his motivation to get up every morning to go to work. Only in this way, he earns an income to improve his family's living conditions.

He earns his income through the production of "maxan" (leaves for wrapping tamales) in the community where he lives. His parents taught him said occupation over 10 years ago. He sells his product in the market and in the outskirts of his community. In this way, he has the means to improve his family's living conditions.

He will use the loan to buy a plot of land to be able to grow more "maxan" in his community. It's of great importance for him that his "maxan" plants produce top-quality leaves so that he won't lose the customers he has.

One of his biggest aspirations is to sow more "maxan" plants and to see his child grow in his education and become a professional.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land.

loans.name: Jhunu

texts.en:
Jhunu is a 44-year-old hardworking lady who lives in Dhupguri region, in Jalpaiguri district. She is a widow who lost her husband a few years back. Jhunu has two children (one son and one daughter). Her daughter studies in grade 11 and her son helps her in her business. Jhunu is engaged in a bag business to generate income for her family. 

Jhunu stitches different types of bags and her son sells those bags in the market. She stitches a variety of bags like leather bags, cloth bags, foam bags etc. She has chosen this business because it is very popular and profitable in her area and Jhunu has the knowledge in this business. Jhunu wants to serve more customers, so she has to manufacture more bags.

Thus, she needs some capital to invest in her business. So, Jhunu has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase more materials for making more bags to sell in the market. By selling the bags, she can earn more profit for her family. She hopes in the future, with the profit from this business, that she will be able to open a bag shop in the market. 

Jhunu is very much grateful to BJS and Kiva for the financial assistance.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her existing bag business.

loans.name: Zafarkhon

texts.ru: Зафархон по профессии учитель. Он работает в сельской школе на протяжении 8 лет. Зафархон живет в районе Кумсангир со своей семьей. Его жена занимается продажей пирожков на рынке. У них четверо дочерей. Старшая дочь студентка, а остальные дочери еще учатся в школе. Дочку-студентку Зафархона зовут Тахмина. Она учится в Государственном Институте Языков. Зафархон еще не оплатил за годовой контракт дочери, так как не имеет сбережений. Он просит в кредит 600 долларов США, чтобы оплатить годовое обучение дочери в институте. Зафархон полагается на Вас. Он действительно нуждается в этом кредите.
texts.en: Zafarkhon is a teacher by profession. He has been working at a secondary school for 8 years. Zafarkhon lives with his family in the Qumsangir district. His wife is involved in selling piroshki at a market. They have four daughters. The oldest daughter is a college student, and the rest of the daughters still attend a secondary school. The name of the college-student-daughter is Tahmina. She attends the State Linguistics Institute. Zafarkhon has not yet paid for his daughter's annual tuition because he does not have savings. He is requesting a loan in the amount of 600 US dollars to pay for his daughter's annual college tuition. Zafarkhon replies on You. He really needs this loan.

loans.use: to pay for his daughter's annual college tuition

loans.name: Gavhar

texts.ru:
Гавхар молодая свободная девушка в возрасте 22 лет. Она еще не замужем и живет со старшей сестрой и ее двумя детьми в районе Пяндж. Пянджский район расположен в долине реки Пяндж, по которой проходит граница с Афганистаном. В районах Пяндж проживает около 7917 человек.
Гавхар в своем районе занимается предоставлением услуги швеи. Ей помогает в деятельности ее сестра. Гавхар продолжает свое швейное дело уже 2 года. Теперь она хотела бы расширить его и для этого просит кредит для покупки новой швейной машинки. Она ожидает поддержки.
texts.en:
Gavhar is a young, free 22-year-old woman. She is not yet married and lives with her older sister and her two children in the Pyandj district. Pyandj district is situated in the valley of the river Pyandj, along which runs a border with Afghanistan. Approximately 7917 people live in the Pyandj district.

Gavhar is involved in providing seamstress services in her district. Her sister helps her with this business. Gavhar has been running her sewing business for 2 years already. Now she wants to expand it and is requesting a loan to buy a sewing machine for this purpose. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Carlota

texts.es:
La socia Carlota continua dedicándose al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia continua vendiendo productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para comprar leche ,gaseosas entre otros.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member, Carlota, continues working in her grocery store business. She continues selling staples such as rice, sugar, milk and cookies. She has been working in this business for years and is doing well thanks to the efforts made every day. She hopes to continue working so as to support her family.

The member is requesting a loan to purchase milk, sodas, among other things. The member is happy about the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase milk, sodas, among other things.

loans.name: Enma Beatriz

texts.es:
La socia Enma Beatriz  continua dedicándose al negocio de artesania,la socia vende  tejidos,chompas,entre otros, la socia la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar chompas de alpaca.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member, Enma Beatriz, continues working in the handmade crafts business. She sells weavings, sweaters, among other things. She has been working in this business for years and has been doing well thanks to the efforts made every day. She hopes to continue working so as to continue to support her family. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase alpaca sweaters. She is happy with the loan and is committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to purchase alpaca sweaters.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester works hard to support her family. Ester is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Ester has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials like a fishing net, wood and paints etc. for the maintenance of her business.

Ester has been in this business for ten years now.

In the future, Ester would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials like a fishing net, wood and paints etc. for the maintenance of her business.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is single, and has a general store business in the Philippines.  Janet requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items, like snack foods, bread, canned goods, milk, coffee, noodles, etc., to sell.

Janet has been in this business for one year now.  Janet would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items, like snack foods, bread, canned goods, milk, coffee, noodles, etc., to sell

loans.name: Phajarun

texts.en:
Phajarun is 40 years old and lives in the village of East Altagram in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She could not attended school after grade three.  She is married to Hapijar and they have five sons together. They live in their own kachha house (made of mud, bamboo and straw).

Phajarun’s husband is engaged in a small business.  But his income is not sufficient to cover all the family expenses. Thus, Phajarun has applied for a loan from BJS to purchase a dairy cow to start a milk supply business. She is a very energetic and hardworking woman.  She plans to sell the milk in her locality, which will provide more profit. There is a great demand for milk in rural areas, so she decided to start this business to give financial support to her family.

She aims to build a concrete house with the profit from her business.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva for this loan.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow to start a milk supply business.

loans.name: Katerine Elizabeth

texts.es: A sus 22 años de edad Katerine está casada y tiene una hija de 3 años y un hijo de 7 meses, Katerine se dedica desde hace 2 años atrás  a la venta de ropa por catalogo, por pedido y ofreciendo a sus amigas y clientas, dice ella que  al mismo tiempo que trabaja puede cuidar a sus hijos y sobre todo a su bebe que necesita más cuidado, su esposo es chofer y casi no vive con ella y sus hijos debido  a que tiene que viajar a partes muy lejanas manejando el carro  de sus jefe, Katerine va a invertir el crédito en  la compra de ropa para seguir trabajando  y del que aspira en algún momento ponerse un almacén de ropa y seguir velando por el bienestar de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Katerine is 22 years old and she is married, with a three-year-old daughter and a seven-year-old son.  

Two years ago she started selling clothing through catalogs, offering it to her girlfriends and clients on order. She says that while she is working, she also cares for her children, especially her baby, who needs more care. 

Her husband is a chauffeur, and he barely lives with them, as he has to drive his employers’ car to very distant places.

Katerine is going to invest the loan in purchasing clothing, in order to continue working.  She aspires to open a shop at some point, and continue looking after her children’s well-being.

loans.use: to purchase clothing.

loans.name: Firuza

texts.ru:
Фируза очень жизнерадостная и трудолюбивая женщина в возрасте 46 лет. Она замужем и имеет на иждевении троих детей. Сама она работает вот уже как несколько лет учительницей в средней школе. Она всегда мечтала дать своим детям достойное образование и старается делать всё возможное, чтобы её дети этого достигли и стали образованными людьми. Муж и старший сын Фирузы работают строителями, от этого дела они получают хороший доход. 

Фируза работает в местной школе учительницей и получает там средний заработок. Сейчас ей нужно приобрести компьютер для улучшения своей работы. Но сейчас у неё не достаточно денежных средств для покупки компьютера.  Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд, где узнала что есть возможность получить потребительский кредит. Фируза желает получить кредит для покупки компьютера. Она очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Firuza is a very happy and hardworking woman of the age of 46. She is married and has three dependent children. For the past few years she has worked as a teacher at a high school. She always dreamed of giving her children a good education and strives to do everything possible in order for her children to become educated people. 

Her husband and her eldest son work as carpenters, and from this they receive a good income. Firuza works at the local school as a teacher and receives a regular income. Currently she needs a computer to improve her work. However, she does not have enough money for purchasing a computer. Therefore she turned to Arvand, where she knew there would be a possibility to get a consumer loan. 

Firuza hopes to get a loan to purchase the computer. She hopes very much for a positive result and thanks Arvand in advance for the financial support.

loans.use: to purchase a computer

loans.name: Cresilda

texts.en:
Cresilda is a hard working entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell for her food vending business.

Cresilda has been in this business for eight years. Cresilda earns more income from fishing.

Cresilda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of food to sell.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Judith works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening, food vending and raising pigs. Judith is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional fishing net for her fishing business.

Judith has been sustaining her business activities through her past 28 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta works hard to support her family. She is married and has an ice-vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 29,500 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase an additional refrigerator and plastic bags.

Julieta has been in this business for ten years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

In the future, Julieta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase an additional refrigerator and plastic bags.

loans.name: Utpala

texts.en:
Utpala is a 33-year-old housewife who lives with her husband Hiru and three sons in a small village of Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri.   Her sons are in school in grades 9, 7 and 3, respectively. 

Utpala's husband has been engaged in agricultural activities for many years. He is hardworking, honest and a very simple man.  He has been continuing his agribusiness successfully until now.  Utpala works as a homemaker and in her free time, helps her husband do agricultural work. Utpala has gained good experience through work in the fields during the last several years with her husband.  

Now they decided to grow paddy in their field. Since rice is the staple food of the people in this region, they expect a good profit from this new cultivation.

Utpala applied for a loan from Kiva's partner BJS. She will use the requested loan to purchase necessary supplies to plant paddy such as seeds, manure, and insecticides. She dreams of improving the quality of life for her family and providing uninterrupted education to her sons. In the future, she wants to purchase more agricultural land with the profit.

She is highly grateful to BJS and Kiva for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers to cultivate paddy rice.

loans.name: Ibrohim

texts.ru:
Иброхим позитивный и ответственный мужчина в возрасте 40 лет. Он женат и имеет троих детей. Он живёт со своей семьёй в небольшом посёлке. Но дом, в котором они живут, маловат и не совсем  благоустроен для хорошего проживания в нём. Жена Иброхима домохозяйка, она очень трудолюбивая и заботливая мама.

Сам Иброхим работает на рынке, занимается купле продажей продуктов питания. От этого дела он получает хороший доход. Но этого дохода хватает  Иброхиму и его семье только на пропитание. Но у него есть мечта, Иброхим хочет построить большой дом для своей семьи. Но для этого ему необходимы денежные средства. То, что он зарабатывает не достаточно, чтобы позволить себе построение нового дома. Поэтому Иброхим в очередной раз  обратился в Арванд и  хочет получить кредит на покупку строительных материалов для построения дома. Иброхим надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд  за поддержку.
texts.en:
Ibrohim is a positive and responsible man of the age of 40. He is married and has three children. He and his family live in a small village. However, the house in which they live is too small, and not well constructed for good living. 

Ibrohim's wife is a housewife. She is very hardworking and a caring mother. Ibrohim works at the market, selling food products. He gets a good income from this business. However, this income is only enough for food for Ibrohim and his family. What he earns is not sufficient to allow him to build a new house. Therefore he has again turned to Arvand and would like to get a loan to purchase building materials for building a house. 

Ibrohim hopes for a positive reply and thanks Arvand in advance for the support.

loans.use: to purchase building materials

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 43 years old and married with six children. With two children currently in school, Jessica works very hard to provide for them.

Jessica runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock, like canned goods, snack foods, coffee, detergent, soap, shampoo and other items to sell.

Jessica has been in this business for 26 years, and sells a variety of items, such as canned goods, snack foods, coffee, detergent, soap, shampoo and other goods. In the future, Jessica would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock, like canned goods, snack foods, coffee, detergent, soap, shampoo and other items to sell.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Lourdes works hard to support her family.

She has a bakery business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buy-and-sell frozen foods. Lourdes is borrowing PHP 15,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional sacks of flour and sugar, cooking oil, margarine, etc. for her bakery business.

Lourdes has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of flour and sugar, cooking oil, margarine, etc.

loans.name: Namita

texts.en:
Namita is a young, energetic woman of only 25 years from Dhupguri. She is married to Niren and blessed with one young daughter. They live in their own Kaccha house (a house that is made of bamboo, mud and straw) in Ward number 9, in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri.  Namita and her husband studied up to grade nine. 

Namita’s husband is a farmer. Her husband decided to farm as they have their own land and he has experience in this field. He grows paddy rice on his farmland with the help of his spouse.  As rice is the staple food for the people of her locality and also in West Bengal, it is a very profitable business.  He has earned a good many customers with his simple and polite behavior and he sells quality products at a reasonable rate. Now, in order to satisfy his customers and to cope with the growing increase in essential commodities, he needs to grow more paddies.  He needs financial help as he lacks the capital.

To help her husband to continue his agribusiness, Namita has asked for a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner). She will use the loan to purchase quality seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to start cultivation in this monsoon season, which is the suitable time to cultivate this crop.  After the harvest, they will sell their products to their customers.

She hopes she will develop her business and with the profit, she will improve her family's financial condition and save money for the future to upgrade their house to a concrete house.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva for the funding.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers to grow paddy.

loans.name: Grupo Chuachinup Sector Campo 1 Group

texts.es:
De 45 años de edad ya con grandes aspiraciones en dar a conocer a su comunidad y a todos los que la visitan la actividad que ella realiza con tanto esfuerzo y dedicación, es casada y vive con su esposo con el deseo de superar en la vida e alcanzar grandes sueños que ella quiere realizar en la vida. (Magdalena es la que se encuentra 1ra fila de izquierda a derecha en la fotografía)

El trabajo que ella realiza con tanto esmero es la compra y venta de cortes típicas dicha actividad lo realiza en su casa y en lugares cercanos de su comunidad donde ella vive ella lleva realizando dicha actividad durante cuatro años, la segunda actividad que ella realiza es la venta de refacciones negocio que realiza con una hermana por más de tres años porque les genera una ganancia para el bienestar de su familia y mejorar las condiciones económicas de su comunidad.

Ella ha sido un ejemplo en su comunidad y es por ello que un grupo de mujeres se han unido a Magdalena para poder emprender sus negocios para que cada uno de ellas pueda supera y tener ingresos importantes.

El uso que ella le dará al préstamo que ella está realizando es para la compra de mercadería de traje  típica para luego su respectiva venta por los alrededores. Uno de las aspiraciones de ella es tener un local en el mercado de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Magdalena is 45 years old and she has great aspirations to present to her community, and everyone who visits, the activity that she performs with great effort and dedication. She is married and lives with her husband; she aspires to succeed in life and achieve great dreams. (Magdalena is the first person in the row, from left to right in the photograph.) 

The work that she performs with great effort is the purchase and selling of traditional garments. She performs this activity at home and at locations close to the community she inhabits. She has been working in this activity for four years. The second activity that she performs is the selling of meals; she has performed this business with her sister for more than three years because this generates profits for the wellbeing of her family and improves the economic conditions of her community.

Magdalena has been an example in her community and that is why a group of women have joined her in order to launch their own businesses so that they can move forward and have important revenue. 

She will use the loan to purchase traditional clothing merchandise so as to eventually sell it around. One of her objectives is to own a shop at the market in her community.

loans.use: to purchase traditional clothing merchandise.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La socia Isabel sigue dedicándose al  negocio de picantería, la socia vende a todos sus clientes que le solicitan, a la vez la socia continua dedicándose  a la ganadería, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz, aceite entre otros.
La socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Isabel continues devoting herself to her picantería (a restaurant serving traditional food and beverages). She sells to all of her customers on request, and she also continues devoting herself to raising livestock. 

She wants to be able to continue working so that she can continue supporting her family.

She is requesting the loan in order to purchase rice, oil, and similar items. She is very grateful to Kiva for allowing her to provide a better quality of life for her family, and she promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, and similar items.

loans.name: Leonita

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Leonita works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane. Leonita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of ready-to-wear clothing to sell to her customers for her buy and sell ready-to-wear clothing business.

Leonita has been sustaining her business activities through her past one loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream - to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of ready-to-wear clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Liunora

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Liunora works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling ready-to-wear in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice and corn.  Liunora is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of ready-to-wear, like blouses, t-shirts, pants, shorts, etc., to sell in her business.

Liunora has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWT. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ready-to-wear, like blouses, t-shirts, pants, shorts, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna works hard to support her family. Myrna is married, and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Myrna requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store. Myrna has been in this business for five years now.

Myrna would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Nelinda

texts.en:
Nelinda works hard to support her family. Nelinda is married and has a buy-and-sell banana business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional bananas to sell.

Nelinda has been in this business for 20 years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested this additional loan to further build her business.

In the future, Nelinda would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional bananas to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of one child, Evelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from a general store. Evelyn is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials like a fishing net, gasoline, etc for her fishing business.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like a fishing net, gasoline, etc

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 39 years old and widowed with two children, one currently in school. Teresa works very hard to provide for them.

Teresa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Teresa has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as bread, biscuits, coffee, detergent soap, and shampoo. 

Teresa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen is 67 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries.

Aileen has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from food vending.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a 43-year-old married mother of four children, one currently in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Vilma has a general store business in the Philippines. Vilma requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Vilma has been in this business for two years. Vilma would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Virgenia

texts.en:
Virgenia is 38 years old, and has three children. Virgenia is married, and has two children who are currently in school.

Virgenia is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Virgenia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.  Virgenia has been raising pigs for four years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Virgenia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
As a married parent of eleven children, Corazon works hard to support her family.

She has a transportation business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal.  Corazon is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to  buy spare parts for the maintenance of her van for her transportation business.

Corazon has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her van.

loans.name: Dora Delia

texts.es:
La socia  es la señorita Dora, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de los Milagros de Chimpahuaylla” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. 
La socia sigue dedicándose a enseñar en uno de los colegios de la ciudad, la socia lleva años dedicándose  a trabajar el cual le trae satisfacciones personales, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de materiales como papeles, plumones entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con su cuota establecidas.
texts.en:
The borrower is Dora. She belongs to the "Señor de los Milagros de Chimpahuaylla" communal bank, which is located in the city of Cusco, Peru.

She is still making a living as a teacher at one of the city's schools. She has been working for a number of years, and she derives personal satisfaction from her job. It is through her work that she gets her family ahead.

She is requesting a loan to purchase materials such as paper and felt-tip pens, among other things.

She is grateful for the loan provided and promises to comply with her repayment schedule.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as paper and felt-tip pens, among other things.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es:
La socia Noemí pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de los Milagros de Chimpahuaylla” de la ciudad del Cusco-Perú. 
La socia sigue dedicándose al negocio de venta de verduras como zanahorias, lechuga, tomates entre otros para todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de zanahorias entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Noemi belongs to the communal bank "Señor de los Milagros de Chimpahuaylla” in the city of Cusco, Peru.  She is continuing with her business selling vegetables such as carrots, lettuce, tomatoes, and other products to all of the customers who demand them. She is a responsible and hardworking person, as this is how she provides for her family.

Noemi is requesting a loan to buy carrots and other vegetables.  She is grateful for the loan that is being granted, and she promises to comply with the payment terms.

loans.use: to buy carrots and other produce

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La socia Hilda continua dedicándose al negocio de venta de comida  para todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de insumos como aceite, carnes entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: Hilda continues to dedicate herself to her business selling meals for all the clients who want her food. She is a responsible and determined person, this being the way that she gets ahead with her family. She is requesting a loan to buy supplies like oil, meat and others. She is grateful for the loan and promises to comply with the established quotas.

loans.use: to buy supplies like oil, meat and others.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is 34 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like soap, shampoo, eggs, canned goods, etc.

Flordeliza has borrowed and paid back 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and earns additional income from rice retailing.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like soap, shampoo, eggs, and canned goods, etc

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 45 years old with one child in school, Jocelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Jocelyn runs a buy and sell dry goods business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of dry goods to sell.

Jocelyn has been in this business for three years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of dry goods to sell.

loans.name: Rositas De Cavinchilla Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROSITAS DE CAVINCHILLA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Achacachi, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Paula es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de manta, venta de pescado, servicio de construcción.
 
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Paula es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de pescado; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su padre, quien trabajada hace varios años con este negocio, con el pasar del tiempo decide independizarse.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para alimento en tiempo de sequía (compra redes) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo implementará en su espacio de pesca. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito y el área de salud que ofrece la institución
texts.en:
Rositas de Cavinchilla Communal Bank will start its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Achacachi Regional Office.  It's made up of eight members and governed by a board of directors of which Paula's the president.  The communal bank members carry out a variety of businesses, including weaving blankets, selling fish, and construction services.

Their loan will benefit small business entrepreneurs like Paula.  She said it's the first time she has belonged to Pro Mujer, having joined on the invitation of a loan officer who visited her at home.  Currently she has a business selling fish.  She said she learned this work from her father, and she worked with him in the business several years ago.  As time went by, she decided to go out on her own.

The loan she's getting is for food for dry spells, to buy nets from wholesale vendors in the city of La Paz and then set up in her fishing spot.  This form of work allows her to earn income to support her family, because she lives in a common-law marriage and has five children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she said the institution's loans and health offerings.

loans.use: to buy nets

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La socia Lucia continua dedicándose al negocio de elaboración de artes, pulseras entre otros para todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
 La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de materiales como hilos entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Member Lucia continues dedicated to the business of creating wearable art pieces, bracelets among others, upon request from her clients. 

She is a responsible, diligent member who gets her family ahead through her work.  Lucia is requesting the loan to buy materials such as thread, among other things.

Lucia is grateful for the loan support, and commited to comply with her scheduled payments.

loans.use: to buy materials such as thread among other items.

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es:
La socia Marleni pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de los Milagros de Chimpahuaylla” de la ciudad del Cusco- Perú. 
La socia continua  dedicándose al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia continua vendiendo arroz, azúcar entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones personales, la socia a la vez vende cerveza a sus clientes que le solicitan,  siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de azúcar entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida con KIVA por permitirle dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y ayudarla a mantener y desarrollarse en sus actividades económicas.
texts.en:
Marleni belongs to the “Señor de los Milagros de Chimpahuaylla” communal bank in the city of Cusco, Perú. She continues to dedicate herself to her grocery store business. She sells rice, sugar, etc. She has been running her business for a long time and it provides her with personal satisfaction. She also sells beer to the clients that ask for it. In this way she gets her family ahead.

She is requesting the loan to buy sugar amongst other things. She is grateful to Kiva for allowing her to provide her family with a higher quality of living and help her maintain and develop her economic activities.

loans.use: to buy sugar amongst others.

loans.name: Liz Sonia

texts.es:
Liz es una madre de familia de 29 años, soltera, vive en Huaraz junto a su familia.
Estudió la carrera de Educación, a la fecha se está desempeñando como profesora en un Jardin y por las tardes brinda clases particulares. La razón por la que estudió esta carrera es porque le gusta los niños y porque cree que los niños, si tienen una buena base pueden convertirse en grandes profesionales y personas de bien.
Liz está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar una cámara fotográfica para tomas fotos en las distintos talleres y eventos que se realicen en el colegio, Más adelante Liz espera poder terminar de construir su casa de material noble.
texts.en:
Liz, age 29, is a single mother with a family. She lives in Huaraz with her family. She studied education and is currently a kindergarten teacher. She also teaches private classes in the afternoons. She went into education because she likes children and believes that if they have a good foundation, they can become professionals and upstanding citizens.

Liz is grateful to the Kiva lenders because with the support they have provided, she will be able to buy a camera and take pictures of the various workshops and events that are put on at the school. Liz hopes to one day finish building her house from superior materials.

loans.use: buy a camera for the classes that she teaches

loans.name: Cresilda

texts.en:
Cresilda is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a business selling personal collectibles direct in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase more personal collectibles to sell.  Cresilda has been in this business for 10 years. Cresilda earns more income from pig fattening and a general store.

Cresilda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more personal collectibles to sell.

loans.name: Demetria

texts.en:
Demetria is 61 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by having a pig feeding business in the Philippines. 

Demetria is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional piglet, feeds, and other supplies for her business. She has been in this business for 40 years and also earns additional income from farming corn and vegetables.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglet, feeds, and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
Aurelia es una persona muy trabajadora, que lucha por poder salir adelante por medio de su sacrificio y lucha, comenta que su préstamo anterior le fue muy útil para poder invertirlo en su trabajo, y por ello hoy esta pidiendo un nuevo préstamo que quiere usar en la compra de insumos para su despensa.
Quiere comprar verduras, bebidas, carnes y demás, y de esa forma poder seguir con su negocio, luchando por mejorar cada día mas.
texts.en: Aurelia is a very hard-working person who fights every day to get ahead through her sacrifice and drive. She said that her previous loan was very helpful to her because it allowed her to invest in her business. Today she is asking for a new loan that she will use to purchase the goods that she sells. She wants to buy vegetables, beverages, meats, and more. This way, she can keep her business running, fighting every day for a better tomorrow.

loans.use: buy vegetables, beverages, meat, and more

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is a 52-year-old widowed woman with six children, three of whom are still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Flora has a fishing and fish vending business in the Philippines. Flora requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing materials and gears for her business.

Flora has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Flora would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing materials and gears for her business

loans.name: Mary Anne

texts.en:
Mary Anne works hard to support her family. She has a ready-to-wear clothing sale business in the Philippines.

She requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell. She has been in this business for 6 years now.

In the future, Mary Anne would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell

loans.name: Gorgonia

texts.en:
Gorgonia is 46 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,500 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Gorgonia has borrowed and paid ten loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from food vending.

Gorgonia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 59 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

Editha has borrowed and paid twenty loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the general store for twelve years now and also earns an income from pig raising.

Editha aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Monina

texts.en:
Monina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her general store business.

Monina has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from buying and selling rice.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Monina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Estrella works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Estrella is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to purchase fishing net for her fishing business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Estrella has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing net.

loans.name: Brigida

texts.en:
As a  parent of one child, Brigida works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice and motorcycle transport. Brigida successfully paid back her previous loan and she has now requested an additional loan to further build her business. She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock, such as soap, milk, sugar, coffee, etc. to sell for her general store business.

Brigida has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock, such as soap, milk, sugar, coffee, etc. to sell

loans.name: Maricar

texts.en:
Maricar works hard to support her family. She is married and has a pig feeding business in the Philippines.

Maricar requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She has been in this business for two years now.

Maricar would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Aruela

texts.en: Aruela, 41 years old, is married and has four children, all in school. Aruela works very hard to provide for them. For the past 5 years, Aruela has run a business buying and selling nipa roofing in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of nipa to sell. In the future, Aruela would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of nipa to sell

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is 57 years old and married with three children. She is in the agricultural business; farming vegetables in the Philippines.

Narcisa requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Narcisa has been farming vegetables for 35 years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Narcisa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Jeanilyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children who are in school, Jeanilyn works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buying and selling nipa roofing.

Jeanilyn is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Jeanilyn had successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested additional loan to further build her business. She has been sustaining her business activities with her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hardwork will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Pedra

texts.en: Pedra, 50 years old, is married and has six children, two of them currently in school. Pedra works very hard to provide for her family. For the past 10 years, Pedra has run a general store in the Philippines, selling a variety of items such as toothpaste, vinegar, noodles, canned goods, detergent, soap, shampoo, etc. She has requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of these items. In the future, Pedra would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock, such as toothpaste, vinegar, noodles, canned goods, detergent, soap, shampoo, etc. to sell

loans.name: Carlos Gilberto

texts.es:
El negocio de Carlos ha ido creciendo poco a poco en estos ocho años de arduo trabajo. A inicios del 2014 tuvo un gran progreso, los clientes y los ingresos incrementaron de excelente forma, ya que tuvo un préstamo con el cual compró huevos, harina, azúcar, entre otros materiales para elaborar su repostería de calidad, teniendo la oportunidad de seguir pagando sus estudios. Por esta razón él se siente plenamente agradecido con KIVA, con MiCrédito y con todas esas personas que lo apoyaron en el préstamo anterior. 
Carlos de 27 años, padre de un hijo y esposo de una hermosa mujer que lo apoya en todo, es universitario y sueña con seguir adelante con su negocio de elaboración y venta de repostería. Así mismo sueña con terminar con sus estudios y ayudar a su esposa a terminar los de ella también, por lo que sabe que tiene que seguir trabajando fuerte. Razón principal por la que solicita un préstamo para comprar harina, azúcar, huevos, mantequilla, sabores y esencias en grandes cantidades. De esta manera poder incrementar sus ingresos y cumplir con sus metas de abrir una cuenta de ahorro, para arreglar su hogar e independizarse para volverse autosuficiente.
texts.en:
Carlos's business has been growing little by little throughout these eight years of hard work. At the beginning of 2014, he made a lot of progress. His customers and his income increased a lot since he had a loan with which he bought eggs, flour and sugar, among other things. He used this for his quality baking, having the opportunity to continue paying for his studies. Because of this he's very grateful to Kiva, Mi Crédito and with all of the people who supported his previous loan.

Carlos is 27 years old. He has one son and a beautiful wife that supports him in everything. He's a university student and he dreams of continuing forward with his bakery business. He also dreams of finishing his studies and helping his wife finish hers as well, which is why he knows that he has to keep working hard. The main reason he's asking for a loan is to buy flour, sugar, eggs, butter, and spices in bulk. This way he'll be able to increase his income and accomplish his goals of opening up a savings account, to fix his house and become independent.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, eggs, butter and spices.

loans.name: Mwangaza Kondoo Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand in the photo is Peter, a member of Mwangaza Kondoo Self Help Group. He is 41 years old and married with two children. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2012, where he underwent training on enterprise management. Based on this training, he was able to sharpen his business management skills.

He operates a general shop selling sugar, flour and household items. His goal is to expand his enterprise by adding more stock such as sugar, flour, cooking fat and household items. This makes him borrow a loan to finance and expand his enterprise. He hopes to make more sales leading to an improved income. Peter plans to use the profits to pay for his children's education. 

He greatly appreciates the support that Kiva and their lenders have offered.

loans.use: To buy additional stock of sugar, flour and cooking fat.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
The person in the photograph is Nancy. She is married and blessed with two children.  She is a vegetable farmer who grows kale and cabbages. She has applied for a loan to buy hybrid cabbage seeds which will give a high yield leading to bountiful harvests. Nancy looks forward to improved income. She plans to use the profits generated from this loan to satisfy her family's basic needs such as food and reinvest in expansion of vegetable farming.

 Nancy appreciates Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid cabbage seeds.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a hardworking woman. She is 21 years old and lives in the town of Arua 1 in the Arua region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past year, Jackline has been working hard to manage her hairdressing salon. 

To help expand her business, Jackline has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase materials and will help Jackline to generate greater profits and provide for her family. Jackline hopes that in the future, she will be able to educate her late brothers children. 

Jackline is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase materials

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en:
Doreen is a hardworking woman. She is 20 years old and lives in the town of Arua hill in the Arua region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past three years, Doreen has been working hard to manage her tailoring business, where she sews clothes.

To help expand her business, Doreen has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more material and thread, and will help Doreen to generate greater profits and educate her children. Doreen hopes that in the future she will be able to provide education for her children.

Doreen is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more material and thread.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Celsa works hard to support her family. She has a ready-to-wear clothing sale business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store and direct selling Avon products.

Celsa is borrowing 29,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more stocks of ready-to-wear clothing to sell to her customers.

Celsa has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hardwork will help her attain her dream to save money and to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of ready-to-wear clothing to sell

loans.name: Nathan

texts.en:
Nathan is married and has four children. He is an agriculturalist who rears cows and grows crops on a small scale in addition to being a business man. He realized the need for electricity in his community and decided to venture into selling solar to make an income. He is also an electrician, which is how he gets additional income to support his family. He has been in the business for eight years and was motivated by the profitability of the business and the fact that it was his field of study.
