He hopes to use the loan to pay tuition for his three children in secondary school. He sells products to local residents and fellow traders. He also faces a challenge of low sales some times. He is an honest and hardworking man.

loans.use: To pay tuition for his children

loans.name: Grupo San Miguelito 3 Group

texts.es:
La agricultura se ha convertido en un campo laboral para Juan de 50 años de edad que se ha dedicado al cultivo de bananos en los alrededores de su comunidad para tener un ingreso económico para el sostenimiento de cinco hijos que el tiene, los primeros 3 hijos que el tiene ya tienen familias apartes y los 2 últimos son estudiantes de la escuela de su comunidad. (Juan se encuentra 1ra de izquierda a derecha de la fotografía)

El obtiene sus ingresos a la producción de banano dicha actividad lo viene realizando durante 30 años, Juan a tomado los obstáculos de la vida como un reto para poder superarse y a el le ha ido bien gracias a su padre que le enseño dicha actividad que le genere un ingreso económico y ganancias para poder mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
El se ha convertido en un líder ejemplar en su comunidad y es por ello que un grupo de personas se han juntado con Juan para emprender juntos la producción de bananos para que ellos también mejoren sus condiciones de vida en el futuro.

El uso respectivo que el  dará al préstamo que está realizando es para el mantenimiento de banano ya que para el es muy importante que las plantaciones de bananos con que el cuenta de mejores frutos para poder abrir más campos para la venta del mismo. Una de las aspiraciones de el es la plantación de de más  plantas de bananos para agrandar más su producción y ver que sus hijos se convierten en profesionales en el futuro.
texts.en:
Agriculture has become a career field for Juan, age 50, who is in the business of raising bananas in the area around his community. He earns money from this work to sustain his five children. The eldest three are now grown and have families of their own and the two youngest are students at the nearby school. Juan is the leftmost person in the picture above.

Juan has thirty years of experience earning money through the growing of bananas. He takes on the obstacles in his life as challenges to improve himself, and it's been going well for him, thanks to his father who taught him how to farm bananas, earn money from the work, and use that money to improve his family's living conditions.

He has become an exemplary leader in the community. Now, a group of people have united with him to grow bananas together so that they too can improve their living conditions in the future.

He will use his share of the current loan to maintain his banana plantation. It's very important to him to be able to count on having the best fruits and opening more land for selling the same. One of his goals from planting even more banana is to expand his production and see his children become professionals in the future.

loans.use: maintain a banana plantation

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a married man and has been blessed with five kids who attend school. He lives in his own house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

George operates a poultry selling business, which has been operational for over 1 year. He mentioned disease outbreak causing losses as a challenge in the business. George dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future. 

With the KES 25,000 he wants to purchase chicks and poultry feed for his business. He joined Yehu to access loans to boost his business

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feed for his business

loans.name: Mikocheni Group

texts.en:
Dotto, who is in his early 50s, is married with five children. Two of the children are still in college and three are grown-up. He has been running a genge business (popular hip-hop music in Kenya) for eight years now.  He work from 8 am until 8 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Dotto's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loan to increase his genge stock and has paid back his loan successfully.  He used the profit to pay school fees and covered household expenses.  He is doing fine with his genge business and dream to be a successful man.  He will use this loan to buy the out of stock items in his genge.

Dotto will share this loan with his loan group "Mikocheni," which consists of six members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy the items that are out of stock in his genge.

loans.name: Venuste

texts.en: Venuste is 31 years old. He is not married. He sells clothes and has been selling in this business for 6 years. With the loan, he would like to buy more shirts, skirts and shorts to sell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: To buy more shirts, skirts and shorts to sell.

loans.name: Andre

texts.en: Andre is 48 years old. He is married with six children aged between 15 and one year; four of them go to school. He sells shoes and has been working in this business for six years. With the loan he would like to buy more shoes for resale. The profits from the business will be used to re-invest and pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy more shoes for resale.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is 45 years old and has four children. She is married and two of her children are currently in school.

Concepcion is in the agricultural business, pig fattening, in the Philippines. She requested a 15,000 PHP  loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Concepcion has been in pig fattening for 20 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Concepcion would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Old Tax Park Development Association. Group

texts.en:
Victor is a 30-year-old vendor at a taxi park in Kampala town. She is a hard working and creative mother with two children.

She deals in jewelry for women and women's clothing with a capital base of four million. Victor has been borrowing from UGAFODE now for the third time taking a loan through the group to expand her stock.

After divorcing her husband, Victor resorted to vending to earn a living and support her young family. Since then Victor has never looked back. She says her hard work has helped her to survive in business among her peers. Her major problem however is price fluctuation. This happens so often forcing her into losses.

She intends to use the loan to acquire more stock and in the future she hopes to acquire a permanent place to operate as they are always faced with threats of eviction by market authorities. She is hard working and the group appreciates the work done by the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials, in order to make a necessary renovation of his old house.

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en: Chantal is 29 years old. She is married with two children who are five and three years old and both of them go to school. She is a farmer who cultivates sorghum and maize. She has been running the business for the past five years. With the loan, she would like to buy more sorghum and maize to sell. The profit from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and reinvest.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum and maize to sell

loans.name: Ange Yvonne

texts.en: Ange Yvonne is 30 years old. She is married with two children who are four years old and one year old. One of them goes to school. She sells foodstuffs and has been running the business for five years. With the loan, she would like to buy more foodstuffs for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for sale.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla is a Camfed Learner Guide volunteer and an entrepreneur from Mudzi District, Zimbabwe. She bakes fresh bread and buns and sells them to her community. Priscilla started her business in 2012 in order to become self-sufficient. However, she has not been able meet the demand of her customers. 

With the loan from Kiva, Priscilla would like to buy baking trays and flour, and build another oven so that she can meet the current demand.

loans.use: To buy baking trays and flour, and build another oven

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Virgen de Fatima, un grupo ejemplo que se destaca por su entusiasmo y ganas de superación, donde cada una pone su mayor esfuerzo y quieren ayudar a sus seres queridos por medio del esfuerzo en conjunto. Todas están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, el que les permitirá poder conocer la situación de vida de cada una.
Adriana forma parte de este grupo, ella por su parte vende comestibles que ella misma hace y con mucho esfuerzo y a la vez entusiasmo sale a vender todos los días desde muy temprano, su sueño es poder tener un local de comidas grande y trabajar desde allí.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para hacer sus comidas, como ser verduras, condimentos, carne, pollo, jamón y demás, de esta forma poder seguir haciendo sus comidas y deleitar a sus clientes de esa forma.
texts.en:
This group is called Virgen de Fatima, a model group that stands out for its enthusiasm and desire to improve themselves, where everyone puts in her best effort and wants to help her loved ones through their joined efforts. All are in the poverty elimination program, which allows them to be able to know each one's life situation.

Adriana is part of this group; for her part, she sells food that she makes herself and, with great effort and also enthusiasm, she goes out to sell very early every day.  Her dream is to be able to have a large retail space for her food and work from there. 

She asks for this loan to be able to purchase supplies to make her food, such as vegetables, seasonings, meat, chicken, ham, and others, and in this way to be able to continue preparing the food and please her customers in this way.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, seasonings, meat, chicken, ham, and others

loans.name: Mujeres Lideres Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se formó gracias a la unión de vecinas y amigas de la ciudad de Caaguazú, es un grupo nuevo, que tiene las expectativas de poder mejorar las condiciones de vida y las de su familia. Ellas forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde una de las integrantes es la Sra. Juana.
Ella es la presidenta de este grupo, una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora, que se viene abriendo camino gracias al esfuerzo y lucha de ella. Tiene una despensa bien surtida que con mucho sacrifico formo y que hoy le ayuda con el sostén de la casa.
Juana pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos varios para su despensa, como ser verduras, frutas, comestibles, bebidas, lácteos, panificados, y demás, de manera a poder seguir con su negocio como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe y que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
This group was formed thanks to the teamwork of neighbors and friends of the city of Caaguazú. It is a new group that holds the expectation of improving life conditions for members and their families. They are part of the poverty elimination program, of which Juana is one of the members.

Juana, the group's president, is a hardworking, enterprising woman who is getting ahead thanks to her efforts and struggle. She has a well-stocked grocery store that she set up through much sacrifice, and that helps her nowadays to support the household.

Juana is requesting this loan to buy various supplies for her store, such as vegetables, fruit, groceries, drinks, dairy products, baked goods and other items, in order to continue with her business as she has been doing to date.

She is grateful for the support offered which will help her greatly.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruit, groceries, drinks, dairy products, baked goods, and other items.

loans.name: Molly's Group

texts.en:
Molly's Group is comprised of six hardworking women. Molly is 20 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. For the past three years, Molly has been working hard to manage her retail business, which sells products. 

To help expand her business, Molly has requested a loan of 900,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more coffee and groundnuts for sale, and will help Molly to generate greater profits and buy food for her family. Molly hopes that in the future, she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Molly is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more coffee and groundnuts for sale.

loans.name: Las Divinas Group

texts.es:
Las Divinas se formó con la unión de vecinas y amigas de la ciudad de Encarnación, cada una de ella pone lo mejor de sí para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida, también forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, que les instruye a ir mejorando día a día.
Una de las que integra este grupo es la Sra. Yolanda, directora general del Comité, quien se dedica a la venta de Frutas y Comestibles desde hace tiempo, gracias a esta actividad ella puede mantener su hogar e ir aumentando sus ingresos para poder ayudar a sus seres queridos. Su marido también trabaja, se dedica a la pesca y venta de pescados, así se ayudan para poder salir adelante y ser el sostén de la casa.
La Sra. Yolanda solicita este préstamo para la compra de más insumos para elaborar comidas, como ser carne, verduras, condimentos, aderezos y demás, ya que con ello podrá seguir con su trabajo, luchando por un día a día mejor, y ayudar así a su marido.
texts.en:
Las Divinas (The Divines) was formed when some friends and neighbors in the city of Encarnación got together. Every one of the women puts in the very best of herself to try and improve her living conditions. They are also part of a program geared at eliminating poverty, which teaches them to improve every day.

One of the members of this group is Yolanda, director general of the Committee, who has been in the business of selling fruits and foods for some time now. Thanks to this work, she is able to maintain her home and earn income to help her loved ones. Her husband also works; he fishes and sells the fish. Together they help each other get ahead and sustain their household.

Yolanda is requesting this loan so that she can buy supplies for making meals, including meat, vegetables, condiments, seasonings, and more. With these items, she can keep going with her work, fighting to make every day better, and help her husband.

loans.use: buy ingredients to make and sell meals

loans.name: Hiari Ya Moyo Group

texts.en:
Amina, who is in her mid-thirties, is married with four children who are still at school. She has been running a business of selling clothes, handbags, rice, beans and maize flour for eleven years now.  She works from 8am to 7pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Amina's 20th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase her business products and has paid back all her loans successfully.  She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for their support.  She used the profit to pay school fees, bought bricks, covered household expenses and started building her house. With her 20th request, she will use it to restock her business with all items. Her desire is to see one day her business sells grow more and be better in life. 

Amina will share this loan with her loan group "HIARI YA MOYO" which consists of eight members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loans.

loans.use: to restock her business with all items.

loans.name: Meshack

texts.en:
Meshack is a 30-year-old man. He is married to Janet who adds additional income to their family and they are blessed with four children. Meshack has been operating a motorcycle transport business for five years earning himself an income of KES 10,000 at the end of every month.
 
Meshack was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a Credit Officer and is now servicing his first loan of KES 20,000. He intends to use this amount to buy spare parts and repair his motorcycle.

He plans to use the anticipated profits to expand his wife’s Boutique business shop and educate his children. He hopes to become a successful business man with a bright future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for ladies dresses, skirts, and blouses to sell

loans.name: Jovelia

texts.en:
Jovelia works hard to support her family. Jovelia is married and has a restaurant business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like  pork, chicken, vegetables, etc.

Jovelia has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Jovelia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like pork, chicken, vegetables, etc

loans.name: Tabu

texts.en:
Tabu, aged 56 years, is married and has six school-going children. They live at their own house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

she has operated an agricultural business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. she faces a major challenge of disease outbreak and pests affecting her crops.

With the loan of Kes 10,000, she wants to purchase more seedlings and a water pump for water irrigation in her farm. she decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more seedlings and water pump for water irrigation in her farm.

loans.name: Leopord

texts.en: Leopard is 35 years old. He is married with three children aged between 4 and 13, all of whom go to school. He has been selling meat for 12 years. With the loan, he would like to buy more meat to sell. The profits from the business will be used to build his house.

loans.use: To buy more meat to sell.

loans.name: Hana

texts.en:
Hana was born in 1961. She is a widow, living with her five sons and daughters in Salt, Jordan. She has been running her own business since her husband's death. Her business is selling blankets. She does this work, to be able to raise her children and to cover her own needs.

As her business is their only source of income, she is planning to expand it. Now she is seeking to buy more blankets and a collection of clothes, to start selling clothes, also. But she doesn’t have enough money to do so. For that reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy more blankets and a new collection of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en: Innocent is 46 years old, and he is married with four children aged between 6 and 17, and all of them go school. He has been selling in his shop for 10 years. With the loan, he would like to buy more salt, sugar and soap to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay the school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy more salt, sugar and soap to sell.

loans.name: May

texts.en:
May was born in 1962. She is a separated woman, who has been trying her best to support herself. She has been running her own business, selling clothes, for four years.

She is planning to expand her business, to raise her profit by having a huge collection of clothes to sell, which will help in attracting a good number of customers. Now May is seeking a loan to buy a new collection of clothes that her customers have requested.

loans.use: To buy a new collection of clothes to sell

loans.name: Lenora

texts.en: Lenora's line of handmade skin care products started as a hobby with a friend. Using essential oils and homegrown recipes, they developed signature products like "Salty Margarita Body Scrub". Over the last four Lenora has had great success selling her "SkinArise" skin care line at local farm markets and bazaars. Now ready to expand her business, Lenora will use her loan of $1,350 to upgrade her marketing materials and website.

loans.use: to upgrade her marketing materials and website

loans.name: Rigoberto Esteban

texts.es:
El medio ambiente forma parte importante en el planeta y es bueno saber que aun hay personas que se dedican a cuidar el medio ambiente como un actividad productivo tal es el caso de Rigoberto que desde muy pequeño tiene ese deseo de plantar en su comunidad, el tiene 33 años de edad  que tiene 2 hijos el primero es de 9 años de edad es estudiante en su comunidad y el último de dos años de edad que aun no estudia.

La actividad que Rigoberto ha venido realizando desde hace 8 años es la plantación de café y el lo aprendió de sus padres ya que es la única herencia que ellos le dejaron y es por ello que el se a dedicado de la plantación de los mismos para poder tener un ingreso económico para su familia e obtener ganancias para el sustento de su familia.

El propósito de la realización del préstamo de Rigoberto es para la compra de terreno que le están ofreciendo ya que un tiempo atrás el ha venido tratando de comprar dicho terreno para poder dejar un bonito recuerdo a sus hijos para que ellos tengan las condiciones de vida adecuad y la compra de injertos y bolsas.

Rigoberto quiere ser diferente que sus padres y uno de sus más grandes aspiraciones por el futuro es la construcción de viviendas para sus hijos para que vivan en condiciones adecuadas y bridarles estudios para que ellos sean profesionales en la vida.
texts.en:
The environment is an important part of the planet, and it is good to know that there are still people who devote themselves to caring for it as a productive activity. 

Such is the case with Rigoberto, who has wanted to farm in his community ever since he was a child.  He is 33 years old, and he has two children. The oldest, age 9, is a student in their community and the youngest child, age 2, is not yet in school.

For 8 years, Rigoberto has been growing coffee, an occupation that he learned from his parents, and the only inheritance that they left him.  That is why he has devoted himself to the same occupation: to be able to have an income for his family, and to obtain earnings in order to provide for them.

Rigoberto is seeking a loan with the goal of purchasing a plot of land that is being offered for sale.  He has been attempting to purchase this plot of land for some time now, in order to be able to leave a beautiful legacy to his children, so that they may have decent living conditions. He also wants to purchase cuttings and bags.

Rigoberto wants to be different from his parents. His greatest aspirations for the future are to construct homes for his children so that they may have decent living conditions, and to provide them with an education so that they may become professionals in life.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of land, cuttings, and bags for coffee plants.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sugar, flour, rice, Cremora, washing soap, peanut butter, salt, and candles to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo está en su octavo ciclo, cada una de ellas son mujeres jefas de familias, que están luchando por un mejor porvenir para sus familias. Forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde quieren mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
La Sra. Rosa en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel tres, lo que quiere decir que se encuentra mejorando a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y también por medio de la peluquería que con sacrificio pudo montar. Ella comenta que ya se hizo de muy buena clientela, y que le prefieren y gracias a su trabajo ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para su peluquería, como ser tintes, shampoo, enjuagues, tijeras, y demás, de manera a poder seguir dando un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
This group is now in its eighth loan term. Each one of the members is a female head of household, fighting for a better future for their families. They are part of a poverty elimination program in which members want to improve their living conditions.

In her last survey, Rosa showed a poverty level within level three, which means that her situation is improving through her continuous hard work in the beauty shop that she managed to get running. She said that she can now count on very good clientele who prefer her over others, and thanks to her work she is able to help her family.

She is requesting this loan to buy supplies for her beauty shop such as dyes, shampoos, washes, scissors, and more, so that she can keep providing her customers with good service.

loans.use: supply her beauty shop

loans.name: San Expedito Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Expedito está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante, por medio del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y las capacitaciones.
María es miembro de este grupo, es una mujer que se esfuerza por salir adelante y dar a su familia todo lo que no pudo tener, es una señora muy sacrificada que a pesar de los sacrificios ha ido saliendo adelante. Ella tiene un copetín donde vende todo tipo de productos con el que abastece a sus clientes.
María pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de comestibles, bebidas, golosinas, y demás, de manera a poder seguir cumpliendo con sus clientes. Todas agradecen por la oportunidad que reciben, de poder crecer y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The San Expedito group is in its second loan cycle in the women's committee program, where they all work and help each other to get ahead, through their efforts and continuous work, and training.

María is a member of this group; she is a woman who works hard to get ahead and giver her family everything that she couldn't have. She is a very self-sacrificing woman who, despite the sacrifices, has gotten ahead.  She has a fast food counter, where she sells all sorts of products with which she serves her customers.

María asks for this loan to be able to invest in the purchase of food products, drinks, candies, and others, and in turn be able to continue satisfying her customers. All are grateful for the opportunity they get, to be able to grow and improve their life conditions.

loans.use: to purchase food, drinks, candies, and others.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is passionate about business. “Every business that I have managed, I have turned around to generate higher profits than ever before.”  Now with his new woodcrafts company, Eliteco, this 31-year-old father of three is ready to carve the same success for himself.

With the support of his wife who comes from a long line of wood craftsmen, Patrick intends to make Eliteco Florida’s number one producer of high quality, handmade wood decor.  “In my opinion the quality of products produced in the U.S. has dropped in favor of the assemble-yourself style of Home Depot and Lowes.  I want to change this.”

Thanks to his work history, Patrick understand what it takes to maintain a business and is currently in the initial stages of raising funds to make his dream come true.  “The largest obstacle I’ve faced has been trying to figure out how to come up with the capital to start the business.”

Over the past three months, Patrick has been purchasing some of the equipment he needs for woodwork.  However, he’s still missing some of the  most important tools, and these cost a lot of money to ship because of their fragility. Shipping can set Patrick back upwards of $500.00.  

The loan that Patrick is requesting will go to covering the costs of tools, wood and shipping.  Patrick needs this working capital to launch his business, and slowly transition from managing other people’s businesses, to taking care of his own.

loans.use: to purchase equipment and merchandise and pay for transport
